loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia tiene 31 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en casa de sus padres. Desde su niñez ha estado ligada a las actividades agrícolas, en la actualidad cría animales como  vacas, cerdos y ovejas que vende  periódicamente en la feria ganadera de su ciudad. Su esposo también vende  junto con ella y ambos  ofrecen al público  los animales que disponen. Le agrada desarrollar su negocio porque le permite tener ganancias más estables que le ayuden a sostener económicamente a su familia, por tanto su deseo es tener variedad de animales y de buena raza. Es su séptimo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de remedios para sus animales.
texts.en:
Sonia is 31 years old and lives with her husband and two children in her parents' home.  Sonia has been working in agriculture since she was a child.  She currently raises animals such as cows, pigs and sheep that she sells periodically in the livestock market in her city.  Her husband also sells with her and they both sell their animals to the public.  Sonia likes carrying out her business as it allows her to make stable profits that help her to financially support her family.  For this reason, her wish is to have a variety of animals and for these to be good breeds.

This is Sonia's seventh loan with MFP.  She is happy to know that she has financial support.  She has always been responsible in making her repayments.  Sonia likes being part of her community bank because all the members are responsible people who are very supportive of each other.  She is grateful to those who will help fund her loan as it will be very useful to her in making progress in her business.  She will invest her loan in buying medicine for her animals.

loans.use: To buy medicine for her animals

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 22 years old and single. He has been farming for four years in Litein town, Rift Valley, Kenya. His main products are eggs and milk which are sold locally. He also earns income from his small-scale farming of tea which he sells locally.

He has requested for a loan of 20,000Kes through Juhudi Kilimo for poultry farming. The extra income from the sale of eggs will enable him to improve his livelihood. He says that his biggest challenge has been lack of stable markets for his products.

loans.use: Poultry farming.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 32 años, vive con su esposo y su pequeño en una casa arrendada. Desde hace 1 año vende balones de gas, negocio que lo realiza de manera ambulante, por ello su esposo la apoya en la venta y distribución del producto siempre y cuando lo requiera el cliente. En tanto ella trabaja de manera  dependiente en un establecimiento y durante los fines de semana ayuda a su esposo a buscar nuevos clientes para vender más balones. Ella procura tener mucho cuidado al momento de cuidar y mantener los balones de gas, procura cumplir con las normas seguridad, pues sabe que vende un producto inflamable. Ella considera que su negocio le ha dado muchas rentas, por ello desea más adelante tener más capital de trabajo. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más balones de gas para abastecerse y cumplir con la demanda del cliente.
texts.en:
Rosa is 32 years old and lives with her husband and young child in a rented house. She has been selling tanks of gas for one year. Rosa operates her business as a traveling merchant. Her husband helps with selling and distributing this product since customers are always in need of it. Rosa normally works from her establishment and on the weekends she helps her husband find new customers who want to buy gas. She takes great care in handling and maintaining the tanks of gas. Rosa complies with safety standards since the product she sells is flammable. She considers her business to be very profitable, so going forward she wants to have more operating capital.

This is her second loan with MFP. Rosa is grateful to be part of her Communal Bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people. She expresses her thanks to those responsible for approving her loan request since the funds will be useful in advancing her business. The loan she requested will be invested in more tanks of gas to restock her inventory so that she can keep up with customer demand.

loans.use: Purchase tanks of natural gas

loans.name: San Pedro Sur 3 Group

texts.es:
el grupo San Pedro Sur esta ubicado en el Barrio San Pedro de la ciudad de Choluteca, esta integrado por 3 mujeres, las cuales son muy unidas, trabajan duro para salir adelante. a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:

doña Emerita H. es una mujer que se dedica a la venta de leña, su negocio lo tiene en su casa de habitacion. tiene muchos clientes ya que la leña en esta zona es usada para las estufas y hornos, la mayoria de las casas cocinan con este tipo de estufas.

Emerita es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo se dedica vender la leña en otros lugares.
Emerita en sus tiempos libres se dedica  a visitar la iglesia.
 
doña Nixa G. se dedica a la elaboracion de pan casero en su casa de habitacion, tiene varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, tiene mucha experiencia en la elaboracion de pan, todos los dias  se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para elaborar su rico pan que lo vende en la ciudad de Choluteca.
Nixa cuenta con la ayuda de un hermano para la distribucion del pan.
en sus tiempos libres visita a sus familiares.

la joven Kenia Suyen M. se dedica a la fabricacion y venta de tortillas, tiene 4 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion.
Kenia es madre soltera y tiene la ayuda de su madre para el cuidado de sus hijos mientras esta elaborando y vendiendo las tortillas.

sus tiempos libres lo dedica para visitar la iglesia.
texts.en:
The San Pedro Sur Group is located in the Barrio San Pedro in the city of Choluteca. It is made up of three women who are very united. They work hard to get ahead. Here are the different activities they do:

Mrs. Emerita H. is a woman who works selling firewood. She has her business in her home. She has many customers since they use firewood in this zone for stoves and ovens. The majority of the houses cook with this type of stove.

Emerita is the mother of three children. Her husband works selling firewood in other places. In her free time, Emerita visits the church.

Mrs. Nixa G. works making bread in her home. She has been doing this for many years. She has a lot of experience in making bread. Every day she gets up at 4:00 am to make her tasty bread that she sells in the city of Choluteca. Nixa shares that her brother helps her distribute the bread. In her free time she visits her relatives.

Kenia Suyen M. is a young woman who works making and selling tortillas. She has done this work for four years. Her business is located in her home. Kenia is a single mother who has the help of her mother to care for her children while she is making and selling tortillas. In her free time she goes to church.

loans.use: To buy corn, firewood, lime, water, sugar, eggs, lard, baking powder, seasonings, margarine, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Givi

texts.en:
Givi K. and his family live in the village of Dmanisi, Kartli Region. His wife is 55 years old, and she is a housewife. They have two sons, 25 and 26 years old, who are unemployed at the moment. Their 19-year-old daughter is a student. 

Agriculture has been the main source of the income for Givi’s family for about 20 years. They have four milk cows. They produce cheese, which is sold on local market. At the same time, the family owns 0.6 ha plot of land, where maize and haricot beans are grown. The harvested grain and vegetables are sold locally to retailers. 

The requested loan will be used for cultivation of the land, where maize and haricot beans will be sown. Givi hopes that after good cultivation, they will have a good harvest and it will be enough to pay tuition fees for his daughter, and also to purchase some furniture for the family.

loans.use: to pay for materials for cultivation of the land.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 55 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos los cuales son mayores e independientes. Vive en casa propia en el distrito D. José Leonardo Ortiz, una zona urbana, granD. y con vía D. crecimiento. Se encuentra unos veinte minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, la capital D. la región D. Lambayeque. Su comunidad cuenta con los servicios D. agua potable y luz eléctrica.

Julia se dedica a la venta D. verduras en el Mercado Moshoqueque, un mercado granD. y con mucho movimiento comercial. Julia cuenta con cuatro puestos propios con los cuales sus hijos la ayudan. Ella tiene más D. 20 años D. experiencia en este rubro. Es muy conocida en el mercado y cuenta con una clientela ya establecida. Con su crédito, Julia pretenD. comprar un lote D. verduras (zanahorias y zapallos) a un buen precio. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo D. 2000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner). Julia tiene como visión la compra D. una camioneta para traer sus propios productos directo D. los agricultores.
texts.en:
Julia is 55 years old, married and has 3 children who are grown and independent. She lives in her own home in the district of Jose Leonardo Ortiz, an urban zone, large and growing. It is located some 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the region of Lambayeque. Her community has potable water and electricity. 

Julia sells vegetables in the Mercado Moshoqueque, a large market with a lot of commercial activity. Julia owns four stalls that her children help her with. She has been in this line of work for more than 20 years. She is very well known in the market and has an established clientele. With her loan, Julia hopes to buy a bundle of vegetables (carrots and gourds) at a good price. For this reason, she has asked for a loan of 2000 nuevo soles from Edpyma Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner). Julia's vision is to buy a truck to bring her own products directly from the farmers.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of vegetables (carrots and gourds) at a good price

loans.name: David Mwana

texts.en:
David Mwana O. O. is 28 years old and married with one child. For the past three years, he has been in the livestock trading business in Narok Town. He earns a monthly income of 9,000 KES. 

David was introduced to KADET by a registered client in his town. He is an industrious man who struggles to achieve his goals. David is applying for his first loan to purchase some goats and sheep to sell for a profit. He intends to use the return from his loan to expand his business and repay his loan. David's dream is to become a famous businessman and educate his children to a higher level.

loans.use: to purchase goats and sheep to sell

loans.name: Hassan

texts.ar: حسن عمره 42 سنة هو رجل متزوج واب لثلاثة اولاد يعمل في الجرارات الزراعية  له في عمله 5 سنوات يرى ان عمله هو من اهم اسباب تطوره يريد ان يزيد من مدخوله وتأمين حياة افضل له ولعائلته يسعى من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء جرار زراعي جديد متطور حتى يواكب التطور والتقدم يتميز بالالتزام في العمل والدقة والصدق ولكنه يواجه بعض الصعوبات المادية التي تقف عائق في وجه تقدمه له زبائن من مزارعي واقارب في محيطه
texts.en: Hassan is a 42-year-old husband and father of three who is committed to securing a good income to support himself and his extended family. For the past five years, he has operated tractors with superb dedication, thoroughness, and efficiency. He serves his relatives and several of the local farmers, although financial constraints have not permitted him to develop his work further. To this end, Hassan was interested in applying for a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase a state-of-the-art tractor.

loans.use: to purchase a state-of-the-art tractor.

loans.name: Zaina

texts.en:
Zaina is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has one child, who is not currently in school.  Zaina has a business of a boutique, which she has had for one year.         

To help expand her business, Zaina has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Zaina hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Zaina hopes to expand her business.  Zaina is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her more skills on how to budget.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es: Fredy es un hombre casado que tiene dos hijos en las edades de 13 y 19 años. Èl se dedica al oficio de marroquinerìa, desarrollado como una forma de generar ingresos adicionales  con el que sueña ampliar para continuar fortaleciendo el bienestar de su Famiia. Fredy es un hombre muy trabajador, por eso cuando salió pensionado de las Fuerzas Armadas de Colombia, no dudò en dedicarse a una actividad que ademas de generarle entretenimiento,  le facilitara ganar un dinero extra y por ello se dedicó a capacitarse y se dió tambien a la tarea de emprender su propio negocio con lo que aprendió, y poco ha poco ha logrado sorprendentes resultados; ahora Fredy cuenta con un mercado al que le vende a crèdito y de contado y su aspiración es ampliarlo, adicionandole nuevas líneas de producción, porque su gran desafio es la competencia de mucho calzado barato en el mercado, no obstante sus capacidades comerciales, acompañada  de su vocacion emprendedora y de servicio, son la gran fortaleza con las que cuenta para obtener los logros previstos y responder a este desafio. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará cueros, accesorios y una máquina guarnecedora para mejorar los procesos productivos, aumentar la calidad de sus productos y con ello lograr el incremento de su mercado, al que auguramos un gran èxito por la disciplina y las habilidades negociadoras que Fredy imprime en cada momento productivo.
texts.en:
Fredy is a married man who has two children, ages 13 and 19. He is a leather craftsman who established his business as a way of generating extra income. His dream is to expand his business so that he can continue improving his family’s well-being. Fredy is a hard worker. When he retired from the Colombian Armed Forces with a pension, he did not hesitate in starting a business so that he could keep himself entertained and earn some additional money. Fredy decided to get some training and then established his business using what he had learned. Over time, he was able to achieve some surprising results.

Fredy now has a market for his products and sells them for cash or on credit. He has aspirations of expanding his business and offering new product lines. His greatest challenge is competition since there are many cheap shoes available for sale in the marketplace. Despite his lack of business experience, Fredy’s entrepreneurial spirit and commitment to service are his greatest strengths which will help him overcome this challenge.

This Kiva loan is the first one he has received from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use the money to buy leather, accessories, and an industrial sewing machine to improve his manufacturing processes for creating a high-quality product. As a result, he will be able to expand his market. One can predict that by being disciplined and utilizing his negotiating skills, Fredy will become a great success and make each moment a productive one.

loans.use: to purchase leather, accessories, and an industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hens and 30 sacks of chicken feed and to cover the cost of labor

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en:
Ramil is 32 years old. He has been selling different kinds of construction materials, such as cement, paints and so on, in the market for the past 5 years, during which time he has acquired the knowledge and skills required to open his store. 

Since he started his store, his clientele has increased, thanks to his good service.  With the first loan he was able to increase his stock, and he has a good client history. 

Now he is requesting a loan of 1,300 AZN, which he will use to buy merchandise to increase his assortment of items for sale.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to increase his assortment of items for sale.

loans.name: Ritah

texts.en:
Ritah is 16 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Ritah has a business of a small hotel (restaurant), which she has had for two years.         

To help expand her business, Ritah has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase food to cook for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Ritah hopes to generate greater profits and pay for her school fees.  In the future, Ritah hopes to study and become a nurse.  Ritah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save money.

loans.use: to purchase food to cook and sell

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana de 46 años, es una mujer ejemplar que lucha por la vida, sola. Para darles una adecuada calidad de vida sus 3 hijos. En unión familiar ellos viven en el caserío de Cumutay, en una humilde vivienda, según cuenta su hijo mayor salió de casa en busca de un futuro mejor. El ser padre y madre para los hijos es una difícil tarea que valerosamente afronta Juana, desde que su pareja sin importarte nada los abandonó aún cuando sus vástagos eran pequeños; para llenar la olla dice ella – desde hace 20 años me dedico a sembrar papa (tubérculo peruano), arveja y maíz, también crió cabezas de ganado, dos asnos y algunos ovinos y porcinos que al principio me confundían porque no sabia a quien atender primero, ahora las cosas han cambiado y gracias a Dios mis hijos están grandes y me ayudan a veces hasta me limito a preparar el almuerzo por las dolencias que me aquejan – resume, a la vez que cuenta que le gusta ver siempre limpio sus chacras por lo que los trabaja adecuadamente, además considera que su actividad es rentable por las satisfacciones y logros que le brinda en la vida, por lo que quiere seguir sembrando, además de ser la única actividad que conoce. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Lindo amanecer de cumutay” y este es el noveno crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con sus cuotas. Juana de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de una bolsa de semilla de alverja y varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales para comenzar con éxito su próxima siembra.
texts.en: Juana is 46 years old. She is an exemplary woman who works hard, alone, to earn a living and provide an appropriate quality of life to her 3 children. As a family, they live in the settlement of Cumutay, in a humble home. She reports that her oldest son left home in search of a better future. Being both mother and father to her children is a difficult task which Juana has faced bravely since her partner, without caring about anything, abandoned them when his offspring were still small. "To fill the pot," as she says, for the past 20 years she has worked growing potatoes (a Peruvian variety of this root crop), peas and corn. She has also raised various heads of livestock, two asses and some sheep and pigs. She reports that "at first they confused me because I didn't know which one to take care of first, but now things have changed and thanks to God, my children are big and they help me at times, even when I am limited to preparing lunch because of the pains that plague me." She also says that she always likes to see her fields clean and neat because they are well-cultivated. She considers her work worthwhile because of the satisfaction and achievements it provides her in life, so that she wants to keep planting. In addition, it is the only work that she knows. She belongs to the “Lindo Amanecer de Cumutay” ["Beautiful Dawn of Cumutay"] communal bank, and this is their ninth loan with MFP, from which she expects a small loan so that she can fulfill her objectives. She also promises to be punctual with her payments. When Juana receives her support, she will invest the funds she is requesting in buying a bag of pea seeds and several sacks of natural fertilizers so she can get her next planting off to a successful start.

loans.use: to buy pea seeds and sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es: Nilda tiene 50 años de vida, radica en la ciudad de Huancayo, es viuda y vive con sus 4 hijos en una casa alquilada. Tiene más de 20 años de experiencia en la elaboración de tejidos de chompa a mano. Tras el fallecimiento de su esposo esta actividad se ha convertido en su unica fuente de ingreso, y por ello se ha intensificado más en este trabajo. Para lograr tejer la cantidad de prendas que necesita, debe contratar la mano de obra de otras señoras para optimizar su producción, esto le permite llevar una cantidad considerable de chompas a los comerciantes mayoristas a quienes le deja a crédito. Pese que es un riesgo toda la inversión que realiza, ha sabido salir adelante porque en todo este tiempo ha aprendido administrar adecuadamente sus ingresos y el deseo de incrementar su capital de trabajo para abastecer materiales básicos. Ella es nueva en el banco comunal que integra y fue invitada por sus vecinos  para que pueda mejorar su negocio, esta muy entusiasmada porque tendrá una experiencia vivida de un crédito grupal y por ello se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos agradeciendo por el voto de confianza hacia su persona. Con el dinero comprará más lanas de diversas calidades y colores.
texts.en: Nilda is 50 years old and lives in the city of Huancayo. She is a widow and lives in a rented house with her 4 children. She has more than 20 years experience in knitting sweaters by hand. With the death of her husband, knitting has become her sole source of income and so she has concentrated her efforts into the knitting business. In order to optimise production and knit the number of garments she needs, she must hire other women to help her. This provides her with a substantial number of sweaters to take to wholesalers on consignment. Despite putting her entire investment at risk, she has known how to get ahead because during this time she has learnt how to manage her income and balance it with a desire to increase her working capital in order to stock basic raw materials. She is new to the communal bank she is a member of and was invited to join by her neighbours so that she could improve her business. She is very excited as she will be able to experience group lending first hand. For this reason she is committed to being punctual with her repayments, grateful for the group's vote of confidence in her. With the loan, she is going to buy wool of different colours and varying quality.

loans.use: to buy wool of different colours and varying quality

loans.name: Aracely Anicia

texts.es:
Aracely,  tiene 4 años con el negocio que dejó su padre desde su fallecimiento, ella lo atiende sola desde muy temprano ya que su esposo hace otras actividades.  En su negocio ella vende artículos varios pero ahora quiere incrementar la línea de bazar ya que sus clientes le piden de todo un poco.  Su negocio está ubicado en su casa,  ella vive en la zona periurbana de fortín con caminos de tierra lo que hace un poco difícil el acceso.
Entre sus planes de inversión está solicitar un préstamo para comprar mercadería, como son artículos de bazar, y víveres en general; así podrá seguir apoyando en los gastos del hogar y en futuro quiere agrandar la casa.
texts.en:
Aracely inherited this business four years ago after her father died. She manages it alone, starting in the early morning hours, because her husband engages in other activities. In her business, Aracely sells various products but now she wants to expand the inventory of her bazaar because her customers want a little bit of everything. Her business is located in her home. Aracely lives in the periurban district of Fortín, which consists of dirt roads, thereby making this place difficult to access.

Her plans for investment include requesting a loan to buy merchandise, such as bazaar goods and food in general. This will allow her to continue helping with the household expenses. In the future, she wants to enlarge her house.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia tiene 43 años, vive al lado de su pareja y sus 5 hijos en su casa propia dentro de su tierra natal. Tiene 12 años de experiencia en las tareas agrícolas, pues posee una extensión de terreno en donde siembra papa y alfalfa para alimentar a sus 2 vacas que tiene en su establo, y de los cuales extrae leche para venderlo diariamente por las mañanas. Asimismo, en su granja cría pollos y ovejas que vende de acuerdo a la demanda de sus clientes, siendo éstas expuestas en la feria ganadera de su localidad. Disfruta del trabajo que realiza porque le permite estar en su casa, pero lo que más le importa en aumentar la cantidad de animales que tiene, así como continuar con la actividad agraria. Es por ello que acudió a los crédito de MFP, siendo el primero y espera poder mejorar su negocio. Con el dinero solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para sembrar más alfalfa, alimento indispensable para su animales, asimismo sembrará papa.
texts.en:
Alicia is 43 years old and lives alongside her partner and their five children. They own a home that is located in the place where she was born. Alicia has 12 years of experience as a farmer and owns an extension of land where she grows potatoes and alfalfa for the two cows that she keeps in a stable. The cows produce milk that she sells every morning. In addition, Alicia raises chickens and sheep that she sells based on the demand from her customers at the local livestock fair. Alicia enjoys her work because it allows her to stay at home. What is most important to her is increasing the number of animals she currently has so that she can continue with her farming activities.

For this reason, she is requesting a loan from MFP. This will be her first loan and she hopes that it will improve her business. The money she requested will be used to purchase sacks of compost so that she can plant more alfalfa, which will provide indispensable feed for her animals. She will also plant potatoes.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of compost.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
Wilfredo is 61 years old and lives in Centro Napu, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. He is widowed with 5 children. 
Wilfredo sells fish for a living. He has been doing this for 30 years. He has requested a loan of 12,000 to  purchase fishing materials such as hooks and nets.
Wilfredo has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future, Wilfredo hopes to save money for his old age.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials such as hooks and nets

loans.name: Vitaliana

texts.es: Vitaliana, natural de la ciudad de Santa Rosa de 44 años, es una mujer trabajadora vive en su propia casa rodeado de sus 04 queridos hijos a quienes le inculca que el estudio es la mejor herencia que las puede otorgar. Vitaliana tuvo que sobresalir sin resignaciones ante la perdida de su amado esposo, cuenta que los primeros años fueron difícil pero con el tiempo lo superó y ahora se dedica a su trabajo, en sus cultivos de cacao, café y árboles frutales, plantas originarias de la zona selvática del Valle Río Apurimac. Vitaliana sabe que sus ingresos dependen de la calidad de sus plantas, las cuales tiene que cuidarlas muy bien y menciona que la clave de su éxito radica en la perseverancia y las ganas de trabajar, asimismo sus plantas están trabajadas de manera tecnificada porque recibe capacitación sobre el manejo de poda y control de la plagas de insectos  que hacen de su producto el mejor. Ella normalmente trabaja por cuenta propia pero los fines de semana recibe el apoyo de sus hijos, pero en tiempos de cosecha contrata jornaleros, de esa manera avance con mayor celeridad en la extracción y selección de su producto. Su plan a futuro es seguir trabajando con la misma perseverancia que la caracteriza y así salir adelante junto a sus hijos. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y trabaja sin causar problemas a la entidad financiera y a su banco comunal, por tanto espera contar con el apoyo de ustedes. Con el crédito solicitado comprará sacos de abono y fertilizantes para mejorar la calidad de sus plantas.
texts.en:
Vitaliana is originally from the city of Santa Rosa. She is 44 years old and is a hard working women who lives in her own house surrounded by her 4 dear children whom she has influenced with the idea that education is the best legacy that can be given. 

Vitaliana had to survive without giving up when she lost her beloved husband. She tells us that the first years were difficult but with time she put it behind her and now she dedicates herself to the work of growing cacao, coffee, fruit trees, and plants from the jungle area of Valle Rio Apurimac. 

Vitaliana knows that her income depends on the quality of her plants, which she cares for with devotion and she mentions that the key to her success comes from her perseverance and willingness to work.  Also, she mentions that she goes about her work in a scientific way because she receives training about how to go about pruning and about pest control that has improved her crops. 

She normally works alone but on the weekends she has the help of her children and during harvest season she hires laborers and in this way the harvesting of her crop is done quicker. She plans to continue working with the same perseverance that she is known for and thus to give her children a better future. 

This is her third loan with MFP. She has been very punctual in the payment of her past loan and she works without causing any problems for the communal bank and therefore she is looking forward to your help. She plans to use this loan to buy bags of compost and fertilizer in order to care for her crops.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizer

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is aged 44 and married with 6 children aged between 20 and 5 years. They are all in school and their family relies on farming and a second-hand clothes selling business for the family upkeep. Jane's farm produces milk, maize, beans, and vegetables.

Jane (pictured above with two donkeys tied to a cart) has requested a loan of 95,000 KES from Juhudi Kilino in order to construct a dairy unit for 30,000 KES, as well as venture into poultry farming by buying poultry birds and constructing a unit for the birds at a combined 65,000 KES. She says the poultry business venture will grow due to good markets for poultry products in the region. She also aspires to own only pedigree breeds for better income.

She reiterates that many farmers face the challenge of accessing finances and water especially during dry seasons.

loans.use: To construct dairy and poultry units and buy poultry birds

loans.name: Narantuya

texts.en: Narantuya is disabled, 45 years old and lives with her husband and two kids in Ger, Mongolian nomadic tent in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia.  Her husband does delivery in the market with his cart, her older son lives independently and younger one studies at school.  She started her business by selling ice-cream in 1999 and since then, she has expanded her business to services like paid phone, prepaid phone card retail and selling underwear. Now that winter is approaching, she is planning on selling warm clothes.  She is a strong and hardworking woman who says "I am disabled, however I never stepped back. I always search for a business opportunity." She is requesting 500,000 MNT to buy winter clothes for sale.

loans.use: To buy winter clothes for sale

loans.name: Chann

texts.en:
Mrs. Chann, 44 years old and the mother of two single children, is in the business of fishing alongside her husband. She has operated this business for 6 years on the bank of the Tonle Sap River. This couple tries hard to catch fish from the river, earning an average of $4 per day. However, the business activity mainly depends on fishing materials. 

Chann decided to borrow some funds from HKL and Kiva in order to purchase some fishing materials to replace the old ones. She hopes that those new materials will enable her to catch more fish and earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase some fishing materials to replace the old ones.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Mosa

texts.en:
Mosa is a 49-year-old married man with three sons and one daughter. One of his sons is an employee, the other two are workers with decent salaries, and his daughter is a university student. 
Mosa has a store for selling used home appliances. He wants to expand his business by purchasing and collecting used home appliances in bulk. He has insufficient funds, so he wants to take a loan of $2,000 from Kiva partner FATEN. When Mosa receives the loan, he will be able to expand his store by collecting more used home appliances for resale. This will enable him to compete well, increase his sales and income, and so provide better living conditions for his family. 
Mosa is photographed in his store.

loans.use: to purchase used home appliances in bulk.

loans.name: Awawou

texts.fr:
Awawou est une femme  âgé(e) de 41ans. Elle est mariée å un  militaire retraité. Elle est mére de 03 enfants tous scolarisés. L’ainé a 12ans et le dernier 06ans.
Awawou travaille comme revendeuse de bois de chauffage et du charbons de bois depuis 2000. Elle vend à la maison après achat à Lomé. Elle n’a pas de difficulté principale.
Awawou a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter de bois de chauffage, du charbon et des ignames. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité, agrandir le commerce et assurer la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en: Awawou is a 41-year-old woman.  She is married to a retired army member.  She is the mother of three children who all attend school.  Her oldest child is 12 years old and the youngest is 6.  Awawou has been reselling firewood and coal since 2000.  She buys her merchandise in Lomé and sells from home.  She experiences no major difficulty.  Awawou has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy firewood, coal and yams.  She would like to reinvest in her professional activity, increase the size of her business and be able to provide for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy firewood and coal.

loans.name: Saoudatou

texts.fr: Saoudatou  est âgée de 32 ans et n’est pas encore mariée. Saoudatou  n’a pas d’enfant. Saoudatou  vit seule et assure seule ses différentes charges. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Saoudatou  mène comme activité la vente de chaussures et de produits divers (riz, pâtes alimentaires, vinaigre, conserves, etc.) à son domicile. Saoudatou achète ses produits au Bénin et au Togo. Saoudatou  exerce cette activité depuis sept ans. Ce deuxième crédit permettra certainement à Saoudatou  de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Saoudatou is 32 years old and is not yet married. She has no children. She lives by herself and covers her various expenses on her own.

In order to provide for herself, Saoudatou sells shoes and a variety of other products (rice, pasta, vinager, canned food, etc.) from her home. Saoudatou buys the products in Benin and Togo. She has been doing this for seven years now.

Saoudatou's second loan will allow her to improve her business and better respond to the demands her customers.

loans.use: to buy various products (rice, pasta, vinager, canned food, etc.)

loans.name: Phea's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer residing in Kampong Cham province, Phea is 35 years old and married. She is a mother of two children who remain in school. 

Besides rice and cassava farming, Phea also catches fish for resale to supplement her income. She has been involved in the current business for 16 years, earning about 32,700 KHR per day. 

Phea is a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She joined a group of six to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for the plowing fee for her cassava. She hopes to get a higher yield than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for the plowing fee for her cassava.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: MIGUEL: Es un señor amable de 53 años de edad, vive en Puerto Cabezas, tiene tres hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Desde hace más de una década,  habitan en una vivienda humilde de tambo y madera. Con el propósito de mejorar su vivienda, solicita su primer financiamiento para construir un anexo de madera, que será utilizado como cuarto, para reducir el hacinamiento. Con el préstamo comprara: materiales de construcción zinc, clavo, madera y una parte cubrir los costos de mano de obra. El sueña con tener una vivienda de concreto, ya que es de mayor durabilidad y seguridad para su familia.
texts.en:
Miquel is a kind, 53 year old man. He lives in Puerto Cabezas, and he has three children who are grown and independent. For over a decade they have lived in a humble house made of wood on stilts.

In order to improve his house, he is requesting a loan to build a wood annex that will be used as a room to reduce the overcrowding. He will use the loan to buy zinc sheeting, nails, and wood. He will use part of the loan to pay for the labor.

He dreams of having a house made of concrete because it is more durable and safer for his family.

loans.use: to build a wood annex.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Juluis, 38 years old, lives in his own house with his brother. He has also selling foods for there boarders. Thanks to his sales and the profits he obtains, he achieves covering the expenses that he faces. He wants to improve his boarding house, finishing the construction of his boarding house.
Since he doesn't have enough capital, he is applying to Integral for a loan for the purchase of the necessary construction materials and to pay for labor and to therefore be able to have a more comfortable boarding house.

loans.use: to purchase material for boarding house improvement

loans.name: Jordanka

texts.en:
Jordanka S. – 32 years old with higher education – teacher in practice of bread-production and confectionery. She has 9-year practice as a technologist in confectionery in the Regional Cooperative Union – Silistra. She is married and has a son. Her husband is fireman, In 1995 Jordanka set up her company \"Dana\" and Since then its main activity is production and trade with confectionery. At the moment besides the owner, there are four more workers in the company. 
The company is developing well, because the production is of a good quality and well-known on the market.

loans.use: Purchase of a new kneader and oven

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Naomi Wanjiku intends to purchase a dairy cow and household goods for her shop

loans.name: Santos Gabriel

texts.en:
Hello, my name is Gabriel, and my principal activity is the sale of dairy products door-to-door in my community. I have several years of experience in this type of business, which generates income to cover my family's expenses and other agreements. At present, I have a lot of customers and the product is not sufficient, so I need to invest more in order to satistfy the existing demand.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Hola mi nombre es Gabriel, mi actividad princial es la venta de producto lacteos de manera ambulante en mi comunidad, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio, el que me genera ingresos para los gastos de mi familia y demas compromisos actualmente tengo bastante clientela y el producto no es suficiente por lo que necesito invertir mas para satisfacer la demanda existente.

loans.use: To buy cheese, butter, and cottage cheese.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary would like to buy household items for her retail shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy Stock of Shoes

loans.name: Keshari

texts.en:
Mrs. Keshari M. is a 33 year old lady who lives in Tangal, Lalitpur. Tangal is one of the very busy bazaars of Lalitpur. She lives in a single family home with her husband. Her husband Mr. Krishna M. works in a private office.

Mrs. M. opened her tailoring shop two years ago. She makes different types of custom fitted lady's dresses in her shop. She prefers to makes lady's dresses like kurta-salwar, blouses, petticoats, lady's long dresses and dresses for newborn babies. She had six months of training in tailoring work from a local tailoring shop. She is now asking for her first loan to buy raw materials like clothes, threads, and a cutting machine for her tailoring work.

loans.use: To buy raw material for her tailoring work

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
Magdalina is a widow. She lives in Mukachevo and works in the local trade center selling gifts and souvenirs. Magdalina started this venture 12 years ago. Her enthusiasm and commitment have added greatly to the success of her business. Currently, she has about $5000 in inventory.

Magdalina values each of her clients very much. She is very skilled at interacting in one-on-one conversations. The result of valuing personal relationships with her customers gives Magdalina’s business the biggest leg up against other clothing market entrepreneurs. Today, she is requesting a loan of $1200 to increase her turnover capital, boost her sales and gain additional revenues.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.es:
Benedicta produces decorative articles which she sells during the local fairs and her husband is a bus driver for the “16 of July minibuses union”. Their home is located in the Alto San Pedro’s neighborhood in the city of La Paz.

This is the 4th time Benedicta has requested a loan. The credit will be used to buy ribbons, cloth, fringes, sequins and other articles that she needs to create her decorative articles for the local fairs.

She has a lot of experience in her business and her husband, who has a daily income, helps her with the family’s revenue. That is why she has the possibility to cover her personal needs as well as the repayment for the requested loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Benedicta elabora adornos para las ferias y su esposo es chofer del sindicato 16 de julio de minibuses.

Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Alto San Pedro en la ciudad de La Paz. Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de cintas, tela, flecos, lentejuelas y otros artículos que le servirán para la preparación de su mercadería para las ferias departamentales.

Tiene experiencia en su negocio y además que su esposo le ayuda con los ingresos familiares ya que su trabajo de chofer le da ingresos diariamente, por lo que tiene las posibilidades de cubrir sus requerimientos personales así como el repago del crédito solicitado.

loans.use: To buy materials to produce decorative articles which she sells during the local fairs

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa, a sixty-five-year-old woman and mother of an only daughter, is the owner and operator of a small grocery store in the Café community of Santo Domingo. Early in the morning, Luisa prepares coffee to sell to people on their way to school or to work. At about 7:30 am, she opens the grocery store and receives the visits of people in the neighborhood who go to the store to purchase different kinds of goods.

The entrepreneur is asking for a loan to get a lot of products to replenish her store.

loans.use: Purchase of goods to restock her grocery store

loans.name: Budumuli East C A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Sarah N.. She is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to stock more charcoal. Sarah is 30 years old and is married. She has 4 children ranging from age 5 to 12 and her children go to school. Each week, Sarah makes approximately UGX 70000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to purchase more charcoal. Sarah has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 100000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Sarah is joined in her small group by Fauza B., Juliet N. and Safina K.. Fauza B. has a business in used clothing sales and wants to expand business. Juliet N. is currently operating a business in tailoring and wants a loan to buy more cloth fabric. Safina K. operates a salon business and wants to add more equipment.

loans.use: To increase charcoal purchases

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr:
Mrs. E. Mariama was born on January 23, 1986 in Lomé. She is a travelling saleswoman and re-sells fabric and shoes in the district of Nukafu in Lomé. On average, she walks up to twelve (12) kilometers per day. With this first credit in the amount of $1,200, she plans to start a jewelery business.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Translator

Madame E. Mariama est née le 23 janvier 1986 à Lomé. Elle est revendeuse ambulante de pagne et de chaussures dans le quartier de Nukafu à Lomé. Elle parcourt à pieds en moyenne une distance de douze (12) kilomètres par jour. Avec le premier crédit qu’elle sollicite d’un montant de 500.000 FCFA, elle envisage débuter le commerce de bijoux.

loans.use: Starting a jewelery business

loans.name: Sinat

texts.en: Mrs. Sinat P. is a rice and vegetable farmer in Kraing Thnorl Village in Kampong Speu Province. Her husband, Mr. Sophat Hun, is a farmer and construction worker. Additionally, he is a pig breeder but in this business he is facing some problems as his pigs have disease and some have died.  Thus, Mrs. Sinat P. now would like to obtain a loan to buy more pigs and pig feed. The remainder of the money she intends to use to buy some medicine to cure his pigs. Mrs. Sinat P. has five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, one is a car taxi-driver, two  attend school and the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and pig feed and the rest of money she will use to buy some medicine to cure her pigs.

loans.name: Takarsu Group

texts.en: Abdul Rahaman is the Takarsu group leader. The members are all school dropouts due to a lack of school fees. The members have accessed loans from SMT twice and have expanded their businesses. They own stalls of general merchandise in Magburaka town. As young people, the members have ambitious future plans for a better life and therefore would like to expand and diversify their businesses to meet their goals. Abdul is 21 years old, and his plan is to pursue education through distance learning while running his business. The group is therefore requesting a loan of Le. 3,426,000.

loans.use: To purchase various items to increase stock

loans.name: Path

texts.en:
Path M., 23, lives in Kampong Cham with her husband, Yem Chamreun, and their one child. She goes to the local food market each morning and sells rice and groceries for US $28 in revenue each day. Her husband works as a security guard and he typically makes US $4 each day.

Path M. and her family has had to endure some difficult times economically in the country of Cambodia. Inflation is high and gas prices influence every single family.

Path M. has desired to expand her business and increase her income, but lacks the capital necessary to do so. She has asked for a loan of US $1000 to purchase more rice to resell and to raise pigs. She believes that by diversifying her income through this new business venture, she will create stability for her future and allow her to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase pigs; and purchase rice to resell.

loans.name: Thi Ly's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Ngo Thi Ly (ID Number 09050102), 34 years old, has three small children. She has a store selling animal feeds and silk. She also rears pigs, thus her family's daily income is stable. Seeing that the loans here are very convenient as she can repay them on an installment basis, Mrs. Ly decides to join the SEDA Fund. It is also very suitable for her kind of business. Therefore, she would like to borrow 3,186,000VND to invest in raising pigs. Her group also consists of:
  • Mrs. Ngo Thi Nhung (ID Number 09050103), borrows 3,186,000VND to purchase pig feeds.
  • Mrs. Tran Thi Huong (ID Number 09050104), borrows 3,186,000VND to purchase silk worms.
  • Mrs. Nguyen Thi Tan (ID Number 09050105), borrows 3,186,000VND to purchase chickens to breed.
  • Mrs. Ngo Thi Hang (ID Number 09050106), borrows 3,186,000VND to purchase pig feeds.
  • Mrs. Ngo Thi Thin (ID Number 09050107), borrows 3,186,000VND to purchase pig feeds.
  • The total amount requested is 1,175.00USD.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

    chị Ngô thị Lý năm nay 34 tuổi MS 09050102 gia đình chị có 3 con nhỏ. Chị và chồng chị mở cửa hàng đại lý thức ăn gia súc, buôn tơ, chăn nuôi rất nhiều lợn. Vì vậy mức thu nhập hàng ngày của gia đình cũng khá ổn định, khi có vốn vay trả dần Chị đăng ký tham gia, bởi chị thấy rất thuận tiện và phù hợp với mục đích kinh doanh của gia đình. Chị đăng ký vay ở mức 3.186.000 VND để chăn nuôi. Nhóm Chị có các thành viên sau :

  • chị Ngô thị Nhung MS 09050103 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để mua cám lợn
  • chị Trần thị Hương MS 09050104 vay mức 3.186.000 VND mua kén về kéo tơ
  • chị Nguyễn thị Tần MS 09050105 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để mua gà giống
  • chị Ngô thị Hằng MS 09050106 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để mua cám lợn
  • chị Ngô thị Thìn MS 09050107 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để mua cám lợn

loans.use: Rearing pigs

loans.name: Hida

texts.es:
Hilda es una mujer de 28 años de edad que vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos.  Se dedica a las plantaciones de yuca, frijoles y maíz, lo cual realiza por más de 10 años.Sale desde muy temprano, junto a su esposo,  rumbo a sus terrenos, no sin antes haber  realizado los quehaceres de su casa.Debido a que esta actividad le toma todo el día, tiene que dejar preparados los alimentos en su hogar, pero ya se acostumbró a esta rutina, por lo que le agrada estar al lado de su pareja, lo más difícil para ella, es levantarse muy temprano para dejar todo en orden y después tener que salir a sus terrenos de cultivos.
Hilda tiene en sus tres menores hijos un motor para su esfuerzo y trabajo.
Ahora, piensa comprar  mayor cantidad de semillas de frijoles y de maíz, para incrementar su producción, y con el tiempo ser la que abastezca a parte de los comerciantes que vienen a su localidad en busca de productos.
texts.en:
Hilda is 28 years old and lives with her husband and 3 children. She has been harvesting yuca, beans, and corn for more than 10 years. Along with her husband, she leaves her home early for her fields, however, not before finishing her household chores. Since her work occupies her entire day, she must prepare the food for her household before leaving for work. However, she has grown accustomed to this routine, and enjoys working alongside her husband. The most difficult thing for her is waking up extremely early to leave everything in order. Hilda's three children are her inspiration for her sacrifice and hard work. She plans to purchase a larger quantity of bean and corn seeds so as to increase production and meet the demands of her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bean and corn seeds to increase production

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Đào Thị D. tham gia Quỹ năm 2001. Trước khi chưa tham gia Quỹ TYM gia đình chị còn gặp nhiều khó khăn không có vốn làm ăn. Từ khi tham gia Quỹ TYM chị đã bàn với chồng mạnh dạn vay vốn về phát triển kinh tế và đến nay gia đình chị đã có 2 mẫu vườn trồng bưởi và cam đường canh. Nhà chị đã sắm được một số trang thiết bị như xe máy, tivi. Chị co 3 con, 2 con đã trưởng thành, 1 con đang sống cùng chị và gia đình hiện nay đang đi làm thu nhập 1.500.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000đ đâu tư mua giống cây ăn quả và phân bón.
Thu nhập bình quân. 5.000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Mrs. Đào Thị D. joined the TYM Fund in 2001. Before participating in TYM, her family experience many financial hardships with no means to make a living. Since joining TYM, she made plans with her husband to borrow funds so they could transform their financial situation. And today, her family owns two acres of citrus orchards - grapefruit and oranges. They have been able to purchase various items for the household, such as a motor vehicle and television. She has three children - two are grown, living on their own, while one is still living with her and working with an income of 1,500,000 VND per month. For this loan cycle, her family wants to borrow 9,000,000 VND to buy fertilizer and more of the same trees. Their average income is 5,000,000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and more fruit-bearing trees.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.en: Nazira has sold fabrics for women’s clothing at the market for many years. Her fabrics are some of the best at the market. By now she has many clients. She knows her business very well. She has 3 kids. Her husband works as a carpenter. She wants to borrow money for purchasing more goods to sell and thus have more profit. And with that profit she can provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: Purchasing more goods and expanding her business

loans.name: Nermi

texts.es: Nermi es una señora de 40 años, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos. Trabaja muy duramente en sus terrenos de producción de palta, mangos y cítricos, actividad que realiza por 20 años, siendo el cultivo de  mangos  y plátanos lo que más le agrada de entre todas sus actividades, ya que es un producto altamente  productivo y de corta producción, lo cual ayuda a que mensualmente  tenga posibilidad de comercializarlo. Aunque lo más dificultoso es poder limpiar  sus terrenos cultivables por las diversas yerbas que crecen en el contorno de ellas. Es el primer préstamo que  obtiene con MFP. Nermi está dispuesta a incrementar  sus terrenos cultivables, por ello requiere de la cantidad que solicita para seguir trabajando en su producción.
texts.en:
Nermi is a 40-year old woman who lives with her husband and their three children. She works very hard in her fields where she grows avocadoes, mangos, and citrus fruits. She has been engaged in this work for the last 20 years. Growing mangos and bananas is what pleases her the most out of all her activities since they produce a lot of fruit in a short time. This is a great benefit as she can market the fruit monthly. The most difficult part of her work is to keep her fields clear of the weeds that grow all around. This is the Nermi’s first loan with MFP. She is planning to expand the area under cultivation and increase production.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase production on her farm

loans.name: Mrs. Run Heang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Run H. is the village bank president of eight people who live in Pou Steang village in Kampong Cham province. She sells prohok, which is maked from small fish and is usually used in soup. Since this business is going well, she now wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more prohok for her business in order to meet her customers’ demand. Her husband, Mr. Dam Deang, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Run H. has five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are enrolled in the local school. Mrs. Sokhny C. did not come to take the loan but her husband did, so he is presented in the picture instead of his wife.

This is a group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Two members have end-of-term loan and the rest have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-Term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more prohok to re-sell.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana T. is twenty-eight years old. She is married and has no children yet. Juliana and her husband live in Somanya, a business town in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Her husband is a commercial driver. She is an entrepreneur. She has been selling mainly plantains and porridge on the streets in the mornings. She buys her ingredients (the plantains) from the farmers in her community and the surrounding villages.

Juliana treks to Accra and other towns to sell to local ‘chop bar’ (restaurant) operators. Juliana has been in business for four years. She says when plantains become scarce, she resorts to other foodstuffs such as cocoyams, yams, etc., to remain in business. Juliana wants to buy plantains on large scale so that she can supply a number of customers and increase her profit margin. She says she wants to put away a lot of savings before she begins to have children.

loans.use: To procure plantains for re-sale

loans.name: Pheng

texts.en: Sinoun is 25 years old and is married, with one child who is still young. She is a good homemaker and cooks delicious meals for her family and cares for her lovely young child. Her husband's name is Baiy, 34. He is a trailer-motorcycle (tuk tuk) driver. Sinoun's husband normally gets up early in the morning to work and will come back in the evening with his income. He is a very responsible man to his family, providing food, clothing, and medical care. Sinoun hopes to start a small business, and in order to make that possible, she is requesting a loan to start a new business selling food. She currently lives in Siem Reap Province and she was not available for photographing so her husband is shown in the photo instead.

loans.use: To start a new business selling food

loans.name: Mkorofi Si Mwenzetu Group

texts.en:
Chausiku J. M. has owned a small charcoal and firewood store in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for seven years. Chausiku is 45 years old and is married with five children, aged between 4 and 15. Chausiku belongs to the Maisha Bora group loan (group code 2101). Chausiku works every day at her business from 6:30 a.m. to 10:30 p.m. and earns an average monthly profit of $80 dollars.

Chausiku is requesting a second loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more bread for her business. Chausiku is hoping that through this loan her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business, improve her home, and pay school fees for her children. Chausiku will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Kiduchu, who also has a small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to expand her business.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
LUCILA C. R., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Rosas”, con domicilio ubicado en el Jr. Guillermo Lumbreras Mz. 174 Lt. 3 del Distrito de Callería, tiene 59 años de edad, tiene 7 hijos, y su pareja trabaja en la agricultura.

El primer préstamo que obtuvo de S/.300 nuevo soles, y desde 3 años de socia en Manuela Ramos, al inicio tubo una tienda de abarrotes, pero por infortunios lo tuvo que cerrar, mas adelante se dedico con sus hijas al rubro de la belleza e instalaron en su casa un pequeño salón, con el tiempo están obteniendo clientela y ganas de seguir adelante.
El último préstamo que recibió de S/.2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en espejos, sillas, juegos de peines para implementar su  salón de belleza y una parte invertirá con su esposo en el cultivo de yuca. Aunque los problemas de salud siempre aquejan, está decidida a seguir adelante y cumplir con sus letras.

Muy agradecida de Manuela Ramos por confiar en ella, y se siente contenta, ya que de tal modo también colabora en su hogar, con sus hijas y esposo.
texts.en:
Lucila C. R. is part of the Communal Bank "Las Rosas." She lives in Jr. Guillermo Lumbreras Mz. 174 Lt. 3 del Distrito de Callería. Lucila is 59 years old and has 7 children. Her husband works in agriculture.

The first loan she received was for 300 Nuevo Soles, after 3 years of membership in Manuela Ramos. At first she had a grocery store, but unfortunately it had to close. Later, with her children she sold beauty products and built a small salon in her house. Over time she has gained clientele and wants to continue moving forward. Her most recent loan is for 2,000 Nuevos Soles. This will be used to buy mirrors, chairs, and a comb set for her beauty shop. Additionally, part of the loan will be invested by her husband for yucca cultivation. Although people always suffer from health problems, she is dedicated to moving forward and complying with the loan agreement.

She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for believing in her. She feels very satisfied because there has been collaboration in her home, with her daughters and husband.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Morey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mirrors, chairs, and a comb set

loans.name: Sulema

texts.es:
Sulema  vive en la calle “ Felipe López ”  de la zona Franz Tamayo en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Ella es soltera, vive junto a su madre y hermanos.
 
Trabaja como auxiliar en una pequeña oficina de venta de materiales de construcción, por las tardes  trabaja con una de sus tías en la venta, por comisión,  de productos dietéticos en el centro de la ciudad.
 
El crédito lo destinara en la adquisición de productos dietéticos y así incrementar sus ventas, por lo tanto sus comisiones
 
Es el primer   crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Sulema lives on “Felipe López” street in the Franz Tamayo zone of the city of El Alto. She is single, and she lives with her mother and siblings. She works as an assistant in a small office that sells construction materials. In the afternoons she works in the center of the city with one of her aunts selling dietary products on commission. The loan is to acquire dietary products and increase her sales which will then increase her commissions. This is her first loan with Impro. An evaluation shows that she qualifies for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more dietary products to sell and earn commissions.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis O. is married with four children and received an education through senior high school. Since 2008, Francis has worked as a trader selling foodstuffs and soft drinks at Aburanse in Elmina. His wife also works as a trader in the same area. Francis uses his income to pay for his family’s school fees and bills.

He will use the loan to purchase additional crates of soft drinks and other provisions for resale. With the new profits from his expanded business, Francis plans to save and further his children's education.

loans.use: To purchase additional crates of soft drinks and other provisions for resale

loans.name: Rasuljon

texts.ru: Ахмедов Расулжон- мужчина 31 лет. Расулжон женат, имеет одного ребёнка. Расулжон занимается торговлей скота. Расулжон закупает и перепродает скот на рынках Аппон, Булок и Жигда. Расулжон  работает  колхозником. У Расулжона также имеют знакомые мясники, которые покупает у него скот. Каждый год он со своей семьей выходит на сбор хлопка, и получают деньги за свой труд, который является дополнительным и сезонным доходом для семейного бюджета.
texts.en:
Rasuljon A. is a 31 year old man. Rasuljon is married; he has one child. Rasuljon trades livestock. Rasuljon purchases and resells livestock at the Appon, Bulok and Zhigda markets. Rasuljon works as a collective farmer. Rasuljon is also acquainted with butchers who purchase livestock from him. Every year together with his family he goes out to harvest cotton, they earn money for their labor which provides supplementary and seasonal income for the family budget.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock sales

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah is 50 years old and married with three children. She sells lightly-used clothes. She is requesting the loan of N50,000 to purchase more lightly-used clothes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more lightly-used clothes to sell

loans.name: Amor Y Seriedad 3 Group

texts.en:
Elsi L., the group coordinator of Amor y Seriedad, resides in a batey (a small agricultural village) in the La Romana Region of the Dominican Republic. She lives at home with her husband, Yenes Polis, and their four children, aged 15, 10, 5, and 3. Despite receiving limited formal education, she has thus far been able to use her business savvy and hard work to own and operate her own colmado (small retail store). Elsi has been assisted by a loan from Esperanza which she successfully repaid.

With her new loan Elsi aims to purchase more inventory for her colmado including charcoal, shoes and meat. Additionally, she has recognized that, given the diverse fashion sense of her clientele and her limited space and resources, that she can most efficiently sell clothing by offering it to order, a setup in which she will collect several orders and then purchase the desired items from a larger city. She intends to use a portion of her new loan to establish this new element of her business.

Elsi's dream for the the future of her business is to continue growing and, for her family, she envisions using her new earnings to purchase a house for her family to live in. This will be a considerable advantage over paying the rent that she currently pays.

loans.use: To buy new inventory for her store including shoes, meat, charcoal and pre-ordered clothing

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 39 años, vive con su esposo, quien es cocinero y trabaja en un restaurante; juntos tienen 4 hijos en edad escolar y todos viven en su casa propia. Desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y ropa, pero también cuenta con una tienda de abarrotes y bebidas que instaló en su casa y actualmente se encuentra en reparación. Sus productos cosméticos los lleva a vender por los distintos lugares de su zona, dejándolos al crédito o al contado a sus clientes. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es estar en contacto con las personas, con quienes comparte ideas y hace muchos amigos por su buena atención. Además le es muy rentable porque trabaja para una marca cosmética muy reconocida y sus clientes no dudan en solicitar estos productos. Para más adelante, Maria quiere llegar a tener un minimarket muy bien surtido. Ya tiene 4 créditos con MFP y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque ya se a acostumbrado a trabajar en unión con sus compañeros y les tienen mucho cariño. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más productos de belleza y ropa, así como también materiales de construcción para seguir mejorando el local de su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Maria is 39 years old and lives with her husband. He works as a cook in a restaurant. Together they have 4 children who live with them and attend school. For the last year Maria has been selling beauty products and clothing, but she also counts on income from a small general store she set up in their house. They are currently fixing up this store. She sells her cosmetics in distinct areas of her neighborhood, selling both on credit and on customer request. What she enjoys about her work is that she interacts with people, sharing ideas and making friends through her good customer service. In addition, the business generates good income as she carries a well known brand which her customers don't hesitate to buy. In the future, Maria would like to set up a mini market which she can keep well stocked. She has had 4 loans with MFP. She likes working with the communal bank because she is accustomed to working together with the other members and they all care about each other. With the money she is requesting, she will purchase more beauty products and clothing to sell, as well as construction supplies to complete the work on her small general store.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beauty products and clothing to sell, as well as construction supplies to complete the work on the small general store she runs from her home.

loans.name: Rose

texts.fr: Rose F., 33 ans, est célibataire avec 2 enfants en charge. Elle souhaite faire de la restauration et en même temps un commerce de fruits. Son objectif est d’assurer son autonomie financière et subvenir à ses besoins.
texts.en:
Rose F., age 33, is not married and has 2 children to support. She wants to do catering and at the same time commerce in fruits. Her aim is to ensure her financial independance and provide for her needs.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Doing catering and at the same time commerce in fruits

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is fifty years old. She is married and has given birth to two children: a son and a daughter. Her children have completed school and are working. She lives with her husband and niece in a rented apartment.

Edna trades in utensils and fabrics. She buys her goods from the central market in the city at wholesale prices and sells at the market square in her community. She has been in business for twenty years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to grow her business and be able to support her family adequately.

loans.use: To buy goods in bulk

loans.name: Nuevo Por Venir Group

texts.en:
Joselin O. is currently participating in her second cycle as an associate of Esperanza International. She lives with her husband and four young children in Boca Chica, an area in the Southeast of the Dominican Republic where running water and electricity are often unreliable. She has begun a small business selling clothes and medicine which she operates from her wooden house.

With this loan, Joselin will buy more blouses, pants, and underwear to sell to her customers. Currently she has to supplement her business with outside work, and she hopes to one day be able to make enough money to quit her other job and be her own boss. With the money she'll gain from increasing her business, she hopes to put her children in high school, improve the family's nutrition, and one day create a bigger and more comfortable house. She has truly enjoyed working with Esperanza International and greatly appreciates your support.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for reselling

loans.name: Lizeth Karina

texts.es:
Karina es un mujer activa y colaboradora de 32 años de edad, madre de una niña y se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir y productos de belleza, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es chofer de motocarro (propio), es socia del Banco Comunal “Siete Estrellas” desde hace seis años.
El primer préstamo que obtuvo le permitió invertir en bebidas como gaseosas, néctar y refrescos.
Con este préstamo es de S/. 3,000 soles podrá viajar a Lima y traer mercadería como prendas de vestir y artículos para el hogar.
texts.en:
Karina is an active and effective woman. She is 32 years old, mother of one girl and works in the sales of garments and beauty products. She has the support of her husband, who is owner and operator of a motorized rickshaw. She has been a member of the Communal Bank “Siete Estrellas” for six years.

The first loan that she obtained allowed her to invest in the purchase of drinks such as sodas and juices.

With this loan of 3,000 Soles ($1,050 USD), she will be able to travel to Lima to bring merchandise such as clothing and various household goods.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase garments and household goods

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en: S., age 28, has been farming since she was single, a skill she learned from her mother. She is married to Phoeun, 33 years old, who is a palm climber. With the palm climbing, he can tap palm juice from palm trees, boiling it to make palm sugar or turning it into palm wine for sale. This couple lives with two teenage children in the family home. S. has been growth her crop for along time, but it is not growing well, so she is applying for a loan to purchase fertilizer to fatten her crop yield.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to fatten her crop yield

loans.name: Mahdi

texts.en: Mahdi is 26 years old, married and has two young children. For more than two years, he has made a living selling vegetables. Mahdi has applied for a $1,000 loan to buy additionA. merchandise to satisfy customer demand, which is very heavy because he is so well known in his community.

loans.use: To buy additional vegetables to sell to his customers

loans.name: Enma

texts.es:
Enma tiene 44 años, vive en la casa de sus padres, junto a su pareja y padre de sus 2 hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de artesanías tejidas en las galerías de un centro comercial ubicado al costado de la plaza central de su pueblo. Allí vende chalinas, gorras, escarpines, guantes y tapices de todos los tamaños y modelos, elaboradas por ella o compradas. Asimismo, cada quince días, viaja a la ciudad de Lima, llevando las prendas elaboradas por ella misma, y durante la siguiente quincena del mes viaja a otra ciudad llevando los tejidos de su esposo.
Por cada frazada o manta de pura lana de cordero le pagan aproximadamente 120 soles, y es así que con sus tejidos a telar ó a palitos, Enma quiere conseguir el dinero suficiente para comprar su terreno y construir su casa propia.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y en todo este tiempo (un año) demostró ser muy puntual en todos sus pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en el incremento de la mercadería de su negocio.
texts.en:
Enma is 44 years old and lives in her parents' house with her partner and father of her two children. She sells textile handicrafts in the galleries of a commercial center located in the central plaza of her town. She sells scarves, hats, shoes, gloves, and tapestries of all styles and sizes; some made by her and some that she has purchased. On the fifteenth of each month she travels to the city of Lima, bringing garments she has made. During the next fortnight of the month she travels to another city with textiles made by her husband. Each blanket made from pure lamb wool sells for approximately 120 soles. Enma would like to save enough money to purchase land and build her own house. This is her third loan with MFP and during this time (1 year) she has been very punctual with her payments. She will use the money from the loan to increase her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Kossivi

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est un jeune célibataire et très dynamique, pour subvenir à ses charges il a mobilisé ses ressources pour ouvrir son propre atelier  de vente de matériaux informatiques qu’il a appelé «  INTER-CONTACT », il fait également dans sa boutique le traitement de texte de même que la vente de téléphones portables. Son stock étant en baisse, il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter divers matériels informatiques et des portables.
texts.en:
This young gentleman is unmarried and very dynamic. To provide for himself, he mobilized his resources to open his own shop selling computer equipment, which he has named "Inter-Contact." In his shop, he also does word processing and sells cellphones. His stock being low, he is seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to buy various computer equipment and cellphones.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy computer equipment and cellphones

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Mr. Sam V., 29, is a hard working man who resides in Siem Reap province.

(Sam was busy providing his services when the photo taken, so his wife is pictured instead.)

To pursue a daily income, Sam owns a trailer motorbike (Tuk Tuk) which he uses for a taxi service. Most of his clients are foreigners who need him to pick them up to visit Angkor Wat and other relaxable places.

He is able to earn around $8 each day to manage his family’s daily requirements.

His wife sells a little fish in the market and also takes time to either care for a lovely young child or do housework.

Sam will use his first loan to purchase a plot of farmland in the best location for farming, which he will rent to farmers for fees.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of farmland in the best location for farming, which he will rent to farmers for fees.

loans.name: Rolando Vargas Quisbert

texts.es:
"Don Rolando, tiene 33 años de edad, es conductor de taxi vive en casa propia y tiene 2 hijos pequeños, se encuentra casado con doña Paola Lizeth, ella tiene como actividad, el manejo del un  Snack que se encontraba ubicado en la zona de Tembladerani; Don Rolando tiene como actividad principal la de chofer propietario de un taxi, y su otra actividad esta relacionada con la cerrajeria. 

El crédito que solicita está dirigido a la utilización como fondo en garantia de la nueva rotiseria que abriran en la av. Buenos Aires, ya que su rotiseria de la zona de Tembladerani no genera muchos ingreso y piensan cerrarlo para cambiarse a una zona comercial. "
texts.en:
Don Rolando is 33 years old and drives his own taxi to earn a living. He is married to Doña Paola Lizeth and they live in their own home with their two small children. In addition, he manages a snack bar located in the Tembladerani District. Don Rolando’s main business activities are driving his taxi and working as a locksmith.

This loan will be used as a security deposit for opening his new rotisserie shop on Buenos Aires Avenue in the Tembladerani District. The current rotisserie restaurant in the area does not generate much income and Don Rolando thinks it will close down and move to a commercial area.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Security deposit for a new rotisserie shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sell food products and basic necessities

loans.name: Lilia
