texts.en: Lilia N. is 64 years old and is a rice farmer. She said that she has benefited a lot from growing rice. Her husband is also a farmer. Both of them work hard to earn an income for their family. She hopes to improve her harvest, but she needs additional capital to buy all of the farming necessities. She would like to apply for a loan of 6,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures Inc. The loan will be used to buy fertilizers and farm supplies.

loans.use: Farm Supplies and fertilizer

loans.name: María Patricia

texts.es:
Muy deliciosos son los refrescos que a diario vende la señora María D. en el mercado central de Chinandega donde ofrece todo tipo de refrescos naturales como lo son fresco de naranjas, melón, cebada, cacao, entre otros.
Ella se ha caracterizado por elaborar con alta calidad estos refrescos. La razon por la que está solicitando el crédito es para invertirlo en la compra de la materia prima como lo es las frutas, el azúcar, las bolsas plásticas  y un termo donde guardar dichos refrescos. Espera ser beneficiada con el crédito para continuar satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
María D. sells very delicious cold drinks everyday in the central market in Chinandega. She offers all types of natural drinks like orange, melon, barley, cocoa, and others. She is known for making high quality cold drinks. The reason she is asking for the loan is to buy raw materials like fruit, sugar, plastic bags, and a thermos for storing the drinks. She hopes to receive the loan to be able to continue satisfying her customers’ needs.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruit, sugar, plastic bags, and a thermos

loans.name: Adebiyi

texts.en: Adebiyi is 37 years old and married with two children. His wife also works to support their home. For a long time, Adebiyi has been in the business of renting plastic chairs and tables to people in his community, and he hopes to expand his business in the future. He loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction with his customers. Adebiyi hopes for a loan amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more plastic tables and chairs. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more plastic tables and chairs

loans.name: Wan Word Mabureh Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the 'Wan Word Mabureh' group from the small town of Waterloo, near Freetown, where 'Shine on Sierra Leone' has partnered with SMT to start a branch. Kadiatu B., pictured on the right, is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. The 24-year-old is married to a police officer and they have two children. 

For two years now, Kadiatu has been selling rice, fish, vegetable oil and palm oil (the most popular cooking oil). With her share of this loan, she will expand her business by buying the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: Buy rice, fish, oil and palm oil to add to her business inventory

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia M. is a 57-year-old married woman who supports her family by engaging in a general store and cafeteria business. She lives in Bagumbayan, Valladolid, Negros Occidental with her 57 year old husband, Remias, and works as a driver. They have 3 children who are 24 to 30 years of age. With the eldest already working in Manila while their youngest has her own family, Herminia and Remias' second daughter still lives with them because of her special condition that needs care and attention.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1998 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and cafeteria business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,000.

Herminia is now borrowing PHP 25,000 so that she could expand her general store and cafeteria business. This will be her 17th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 22,000, which she paid off within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Herminia aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To buy additonal working capital.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther N. M. is a 48-year old mother of three who sells cooking gas to earn a living. She has been in this business for four years and has three employees. Esther also rents residential houses to earn more money to support her family, since she is the breadwinner. She previously ran a retail shop before she ventured into this business. 

In 2001, Esther joined a group in Faulu Kenya called Ushindi. Esther saves her money with the group, which guarantees loans to its members. She has requested a loan of 45,000 Kenyan shillings (Kes) from Faulu Kenya to add to her stock of cooking gas. Esther hopes to grow her business and improve her living standards in the future.

loans.use: To add to her stock of cooking gas for sale.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Kahled is a 27-year-old young man from Jenin. He started a cafe eight years ago, and over the eight years Khaled has been able to attract a big number of regular customers by his excellent service and good quality food and beverages, especially since his cafe is located in the city center.

After eight years, Khaled came to FATEN and took a loan to replace the old tables of the cafe and buy a wide-screen TV as well as doing remodeling.

Khaled hopes to collect enough money from his work to able to get married soon as he lacks the financial resources at the moment, and the cafe is his only source of livelihood.

loans.use: Cafe Improvements

loans.name: Mamodiyarova's Group

texts.en:
Mamodiyarova S. is the leader of this group. She is 57 years old and a widow. Her eldest son is married and lives with his family. Her two grandchildren, aged 9 and 11, are at school. S. is a pensioner, so her son is the one who is engaged in business. At the moment, they are preparing for the sowing process. With her loan, S. is going to purchase fuel and seed potatoes, which are needed for farming. In this way, she hopes to save money for her son's wedding, which is in the autumn.
Kadyrkulova M. is 52 and the group's treasurer. She has raised two daughters and a son. Both daughters are students and her son is married and lives and works in Bishkek. Her husband is a taxi driver. In order to make money, M. bought three sheep for 6000 KGS a year ago and sold them for 9300 KGS. M. has one hectare of land, which she wants to sow, so she is requesting a loan to buy fuel and seed potatoes.
Keldibek uulu R. is 29 and has a wife and two children. His wife works as a teacher and both children are preschool age, so R.'s wife is on maternity leave. Now, R. is preparing for the sowing process. With his loan, he will buy seed potatoes and fuel.
Kemelova S. is 56 and married. Her husband is a pensioner and works in cattle breeding. They have a 19-year-old daughter who is a student. They also have grandchildren who go to school. S. wants a loan to buy fuel and seed potatoes (they have one hectare of land, which they want to sow).

Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase fuel and seed potatoes

loans.name: Fatima De La Concepcion

texts.es: Fátima De La Concepción tiene 50 años, pues siempre se ha preocupado por proporcionar a su familia los ingresos para el alimento diario. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general y una pulpería. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Inicio ofreciendo sus productos de manera ambulante y ha luchado fuertemente para obtener estos ingresos. Debido al buen trato con el que atiende a sus clientes su negocio ha ido creciendo y ya cuenta con una clientela fiel. El financiamiento que solicita es para comprar cosméticos, ropa, golosinas, refrescos y jugos. Su deseo es obtener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Fátima is 50 years old and has always been concerned with doing her part to provide for her family. She sells general merchandise and runs a general store. She has been doing this for seven years. She began selling on foot and struggled to make this income. Because of the good service she gave to her customers, her business has grown and she now has loyal customers. She will use the money from this loan to buy cosmetics, clothing, snacks, soft drinks, and juices. Someday she would like to have house of her own.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, 50, is a driver by profession and also does farming. He has four children and some are independent. He is assisted by his wife in farming. 

John was introduced to Ikinye Ria Mbere group in Faulu Kenya with his friend who is also a business man. Being in the group, he can be guaranteed a loan by the group members. He has requested for a loan of Kes 35,000 to buy fertilizer and farm equipment. He plans to invest in dairy cattle farming to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and farm equipment

loans.name: Byambaa

texts.en: Byambaa L. is 47 years old and lives with her two daughters in Tosontsengel, one of the biggest towns of the Zavhan province in western Mongolia. Both of her daughters are students. Her husband died by car accident in 2006, and since then, Byambaa has been trying her best to raise her two children as a single parent along with operating her boot-making business. She operates a small boot-making and repair business in her town. She makes durable boots called buriad and traditional boots, which she trades with herders in the surrounding countryside. When the peak period of demand for boots comes, she also trades her boots in exchange for a variety of products. Byambaa started her business in 2007 and has quickly found success. Her business has enabled her to keep up both of her homes and provide a quality life for her family. Byambaa is a very hard-working and business-minded person. She always looks for ways to increase her earnings and improve her business. She said, “Year by year, I have experimented with making a variety of style of boots, which are potentially sold among the herdsmen, and it seems quite profitable for me. I will continue to produce boots and I am trying to do many things in order to provide for my daughters." Byambaa is requesting a 1,500,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) loan to purchase materials such as felt boots, leather and rubber for her boot-making business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence K. is 54 years old, married, and has 5 kids and 7 dependents. For the last 20 years, he has been operating his retail shop in Mityana Town.

On shillings 80,000 as profits per week, he has obtained a firm business footing. He began his business with savings from his agriculture business, and he still maintains his agro business as another source of income. Twenty years in any kind of business speaks volumes of somebody’s resilience, hard work, and maturity in making decisions aimed at solidifying his ventures.

Lawrence is happily married and all his children are at school. With this loan, he wants to purchase more retail items like sugar, salt, soap and plastics. He hopes to resell these as a means to an end in his quest for more profits.

loans.use: To purchase more retail items like sugar, plastics, salt, and soap for resale.

loans.name: Jorge Eduardo

texts.es:
Jorge Eduardo se ha vuelto un experto en productos nutricionales, pues es un negoció que desde el año 2007 inició entre vecinos y amigos y que gradualmente le ha agregado artículos de uso diario como calzado electrodomésticos, el   vive en la ciudadela 20 de Julio de la ciudad de Barranquilla donde confluyen muchas actividades comerciales formales e informales en una zona residencial y donde abundan los mega espacios deportivos como el Estadio metropolitano donde se juega el mejor futbol de Colombia. Jorge Eduardo está vinculado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo desde hace mas de un año, su credikiva es su segundo crédito, con el comprará productos nutricionales, ropa y calzado que tiene encargada por sus clientes, Desde su crédito anterior su liquidez ha mejorado y ahora tiene para comprar de contado aunque cada día aumentan sus pedidos y siempre quisiera tener un capital guardado para cualquier oportunidad que se le presente pues en su negocio son contantes.
Su sueño y desafío mayor se concentra ahora en tener un punto de venta abierto al público para asesorar personalmente y desde este mismo a muchas personas que desean mejorar sus condiciones nutricionales y exponer todo la mercancía  atractiva que vende
texts.en:
Jorge Eduardo has become an expert on nutritional products. He started his business in 2008 by selling to neighbors and friends, and gradually he added products such as footwear and household appliances. He lives in the "Ciudadela 20 de Julio" neighborhood of the city of Barranquilla, where there is a convergence of many commercial activities, both formal and informal, in a residential area, and where there are many sporting venues such as the Metropolitan Stadium where they play the best soccer in Colombia. Jorge Eduardo has been involved with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for more than a year. This loan from Kiva will be his second loan. With it he will buy nutritional products, clothing and shoes to fill orders from his customers. Since his first loan, his liquidity has improved and now he has sufficient capital to buy with cash, even though every day his orders increase, and he always wanted to have some capital saved in case an opportunity presents itself, which in his business requires cash. His dream and his main challenge is to have a retail outlet that is open to the public where he can personally advise the many people who want to improve their nutritional conditions and where he can exhibit all of the attractive merchandise that he is selling.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: he will buy nutritional products, clothing and shoes to fill orders from his customers

loans.name: Sithavy's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sithavy U., age 29, is a married woman and the village bank president who was selected by the nine members of this group loan. They are all located in Khop Leu village in the Kandal province. Each member of this village loan will use their portion of the loan to support their different businesses.

Mrs. Sithavy U. is a tailor at home, while her husband, Mr. RattanA. P., is a teacher in the local school. With both of these occupations, they are able to earn a small income to support their family. In order to increase their income to improve the family's lives, Mrs. Sithavy U. will use the loan to buy piglets for breeding and to buy pig food. This couple has two children. One is attending the local school while another, age 4, is not yet in school.

loans.use: To buy piglets for breeding and to buy pig food

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: Bertha, de 34 años de edad, es divorciada y tiene cuatro hijos en etapa escolar. Juntos residen en la localidad de Santa Rosa, ubicada en la hermosa selva tropical peruana, donde tienen su propia casa. Para Bertha lo que prevalece es la realización personal, es así que logró tener su tienda de abarrotes, negocio del cual tenía mucha demanda en su localidad, hoy la competencia ha aumentado, por ello debe mejorar cada día para seguir siendo la preferida de sus clientes. Se siente muy contenta con el trabajo que tiene, además recibe buenas rentas por lo que le da seguridad económica. Normalmente trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en tiempo de vacaciones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos y su rutina es de lunes a domingo, a partir de las 6:00 de la mañana hasta las 10:00 de la noche. Su punto de venta lo realiza en su mismo barrio de su propia localidad, no obstante en un futuro no muy lejano, ella piensa ampliar su negocio de abarrotes con la necesidad de atraer mayor clientela y en efecto mejorar sus ventas considerablemente. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus respectivos pagos, además está satisfecho con su banco su banco comunal, ya que todos están comprometidos en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de mercaderías, con la finalidad de que su tienda esté bien surtida.
texts.en:
Bertha, 34, is divorced and has four school aged children. They live in Santa Rosa located in the beautiful Peruvian tropical jungle in their own house. Personal fulfillment is an important goal for Bertha and this is why she managed to have her own grocery store, a business that is in high demand in her location. Today, competition has increased so she must improve daily in order to continue to be the one preferred by her customers. She is happy with her work and it produces good profits which gives her economic security. She normally works by herself but during school vacation periods her children help her. She is open for business Monday through Sunday from 6am until 10pm. Her sales point is in her own neighborhood. Notwithstanding, in the not so distant future she plans to expand her grocery business in order to attract more customers and improve her sales considerably. This is her 5th loan with MFP and she pledges to continue repaying. Besides, she is satisfied with her communal bank because everyone is committed to their payments. The requested funds will be used to buy merchandise in order to have her store well stocked.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Siomara Del Socorro

texts.es: Siomara Del Socorro tiene 34 años, su actividad es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio ella tiene todas las esperanzas de salir adelante, ya que ella no tenía la oportunidad de mejorar sus ingresos pues no había terminados sus estudios universitario, ya que sus padres no le habían dado la oportunidad de finalizar fue por eso que inicio este negocio con muy poco capital. Actualmente esta solicita este crédito para la compra de lápiz labial, brillo, tratamientos, pintura de uñas, colonias y cremas. Ella sueña con establecer una pulpería en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Siomara Del Socorro is 34 years old and sells cosmetics. She has dedicated herself to this business for more than three years and she has every hope of getting ahead in life. She did not have the opportunity to improve her earnings by finishing university, because her parents didn't give her the opportunity to do so. That is why she started this business with very little money. Currently, she is requesting this loan to buy lipstick, gloss, treatments, nail polish, colognes, and creams. She dreams of someday opening a small grocery store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy lipstick, gloss, treatments, nail polish, colgnes, and creams

loans.name: Maricho

texts.en:
Maricho C. is from the village of Sta. Cruz, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 27 years old. Maricho is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Maricho owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products  including fish and shrimp in the local community. Maricho has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Maricho joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maricho has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fishes to sell. Maricho is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Maricho from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Neema R. is a 56-year old lady who is the sole proprietor of a business renting kiosks and houses to people in the Shanzu area of Mombasa. She is a widow who lives alone, and has been in this business for the last ten years. 

Neema's monthly income has been great, and now she is now requesting a second loan from KADET to start a fishing business venture. With this loan, she would like to purchase a boat engine and use the anticipated profits to renovate her rental houses. In the future, she would like to purchase more boats for her business.

loans.use: To buy a boat engine to start a new fishing business venture.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza B. is from the village of Daan Lungsod, Gingoog City. She is 33 years old. Liza is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Liza owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, generic medicines & beverages in the local community. Liza has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Liza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Liza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Liza is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Liza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a resident of Kitale Town in western Kenya. He has three children and has been doing mixed farming for 10 years, producing maize, groundnuts, millet and bananas to sell to the local market.

He has applied for this loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the proceeds will help him pay for the education of his children. He plans to have four dairy cows in five years time.

His major challenge remains poor prices while production costs remain very high.He recommends more diversification in Juhudi Kilimo loan products.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Nazarboy

texts.en:
Nazarboy I. is 43 years old. He is married with 3 children. Nazarboy has dedicated himself to the cattle breeding business for the past 10 years. He purchases calves to raise, fatten, and then sells them or butchers them to sell the meat. His children help Nazarboy with his business. Today, his major need is acquiring cattle for his business. For this reason, Nazarboy looks for support from IMON International, to buy more cattle and fodder. This will make his family’s sustenance possible.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing calves to raise

loans.name: Anacita

texts.en:
Anacita O. is from the village of Sta. Cruz, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 52 years old. Anacita is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Anacita owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & junk foods in the local community. Her husband is a fisherman, and Anacita sells the fish he catches. Anacita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2000, Anacita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anacita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Anacita is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  Some of the funds will be used to maintain their boat.  This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Anacita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, and for boat maintenance

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.en: Gulnaz S. is a 46 year-old woman who has a primary education. She is from Nagorno-Karabakh but fled with her family to Bilasuvar at the beginning of the 1990s. Now she lives with her family in a small settlement built for refugee families. Gulnaz is married and has a 25 year-old son and a 23 year-old daughter. Her husband and children help her in the cattle-breeding business which she started in 2007. Now the family's monthly income is on average 250 AZN. This is her first loan with Aqroinvest and Kiva 1000 AZN which she used to buy three cows. Now she has six cows. After she repays this loan she plans to apply for more loans to expand her business. Her goal is to have thirteen cows.

loans.use: to buy three cows

loans.name: Escona

texts.en:
Escona T. is currently in a business of selling fish. She is 23 years old and married to a GoSS (Government of Southern Sudan) worker. She has two children who do not go to school.

She requested a loan to stock more fish to sell. She hopes to expand her business with extra profits in the future.

loans.use: To stock more fish to sell

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
Sergio, reside en Lolotique departamento de San Miguel, tiene 37 años de edad, vive con su esposa y tres hijos de 12, 10 y 9 años de edad, Sergio tiene una moto taxi, con la que trabaja realizando viajes a personas que transitan por el centro de Lolotique y que desean desplazarse a otra zona, trabaja todos los días desde hace 4 años.
Él necesita un préstamo para mejorar el piso de su casa, comprando ladrillo de piso, cemento y arena, este préstamo le ayudara pues él no cuenta con los fondos para realizar la inversión, además que mejorara su condición y la de su familia.
Sus aspiraciones es continuar mejorando la vivienda, hacerla cada vez más confortable y segura, también cuidar su trabajo porque de él depende su familia y la realización de estos proyectos.
texts.en:
Sergio lives in Lolotique in the department of San Miguel. He is 37 years old and lives with his wife and three children aged 12, 10 and 9. Sergio has a motorcycle taxi, which he uses to carry passengers traveling in the center of Lolotique and to other places. He has worked every day for the last four years.

He needs a loan to improve the floor in his house; he needs to buy floor tiles, cement and sand. He does not have the funds to invest, so this loan will help him and will also improve his family's living conditions.

Sergio hopes to keep improving his home, making it increasingly more comfortable and safe. He also wants to take care of his business because both his family and these projects depend on it.

loans.use: To buy floor tiles, cement and sand

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita L. is from the village of Salimpono, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old. Lolita is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Lolita owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling health & medicinal products in the local community. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Lolita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Lolita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anadira De Fatima

texts.es:
ANADIRA DE FATIMA G. S., ES DEL MUNICIPIO DE TICUANTEPE  ELLA TRABAJA DIARIO COMO CAJERA, ES MADRE DE FAMILIA DE DOS HIJOS, Y ESTOS  ACTUALMENTE DEPENDE DE ELLA Y SE ENCUENTRAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR.
DOÑA ANADIRA DE FATIMA ACUDE A LAS OFICINAS DE CEPRODEL PARA SOLICITAR UN PRESTAMO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU VIVIENDA PARA INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO: ARENA, CEMENTO, PIEDRAY HIERRO  PARA LA CONSTRUCCION DE UN BAÑO EN SU CASA DE HABITACION.
TODO ESTO PARA MEJORAR LAS CONDICIONES DE SU VIVIENDA PARA SU FAMILIA.
texts.en:
Anadira de Fatima G. S. is from the municipality of Ticuantepe. She works every day as a cashier. She is the mother of a family with two school-age children who depend on her.

Anadira went to to CEPRODEL's office to request a loan for making improvements to her house. She will invest in the purchase of construction materials like sand, cement, stone, and iron bars, in order to build a bathroom in her house. She would like to do this in order to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Almira

texts.es:
La señora Almira, es socia del banco comunal Las Luchadoras, del Distrito Campo Verde, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos.
Son dos años que viene trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, se dedica a la elaboración de bocaditos como rosquitas, ñutos, suspiros, bizcochuelos, panes, sus hijos le ayudan en la elaboración y también en el asado del ambiente.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará un saco de almidón, 1 caja de manteca, 1 galón de aceite, 1 kilo de levadura, ½ saco de azúcar, 7 doc. de huevos.
Su trabajo lo realiza en su casa, cuenta con un horno artesanal que le es muy económico por que no tiene que gastar en energía eléctrica.
Agradece a Manuela Ramos por la ayuda que brinda dando las charlas educativas a las socias para que puedan manejar con mucha responsabilidad su dinero.
texts.en:
Almira is a member of Las Luchadoras (The Fighters), a communal bank located in Campo Verde, a district of the Ucayali department. She is 38 years old, she is married and she has 4 children.
She has been receiving loans by Manuela Ramos for 2 years. She engages in preparing snacks such as rosquitas, ñutos, suspiros (typical Peruvian pastries), cookies, breads. Her children help her preparing the snacks as well as caring for the cleanliness of the shop.
With this new loan of 1,000.00 PEN she will buy one bag of starch, one box of lard, one gallon of oil, one kilo of yeast, half a bag of sugar and 7 dozens of eggs.
She works in her house, as she can count on a crafts oven that is very cheap for her, as she does not have to waste electricity.
She is thankful to Manuela Ramos for the help provided through the educational lectures, held for the members to teach them how to responsibly manage their money.

loans.use: To buy starch, lard, oil, yeast, sugar and eggs.

loans.name: Anzazi

texts.en:
Anzazi is a widow with six children, all of whom attend school. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

She has operated a "posho" (cornmeal) mill for the past four years, selling to her neighbours and passersby. Anzazi faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a cereals shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase diesel for running the "posho" milling machine. Anzazi decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase diesel to run the "posho" (cornmeal) mill.

loans.name: Claire

texts.en:
Claire is a twenty-five year-old married woman with two children, living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda.  She takes care of the family with the help of her husband, who is a taxi driver. Their goal is to build a residential house.  

For three years, Claire has been in the salon business.  She got her start-up capital of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings from her husband, and her current working capital is 3,000,000.  She has the challenge of the current inflation in the country, and irregular customers.  Her dream is to own a beauty parlor. Claire needs the loan to buy synthetic hair and setting lotions for the salon.

loans.use: to buy synthetic hair and setting lotions for the salon.

loans.name: Pura

texts.en:
Pura is from the village of Estefania, Amulung, Cagayan. She is 52 years old. She is married and has eight children. To make a living, Pura owns & operates a specialized retail store. Her main source of income comes from selling food products in the local community. Pura has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Pura joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pura is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase bread, canned goods and soft drinks to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Pura from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bread, canned goods and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Benerad Kimani

texts.en:
Benerad has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the past six years.  He is 25 years old, married to Serah Njeri and they have three children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan. He repaid his previous loan of Kshs 30,000 well and in good time. He plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Benerad hopes to become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 37-year-old married man, and father of three children. He has owned a pet shop specializing in birds and fish since mid-2010. Hussein's favorite hobby was raising birds and fish, that's why he invested his hobby in a small shop he opened almost a year and a half ago.

Hussein's initial work is in a car rental business he started in 1995. He also works in selling Hookas. He believes that to make a good living, you have to search for several sources of income and that's what he's doing. 

Hussein is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to improve the pet store through buying necessary food for both fish and birds in addition to vases, cages and many other pet needs. This is his first time to request a loan, but he feels it's going to be a good step for his business to improve more and more.

loans.use: to purchase necessary items for his pet store

loans.name: Cherl

texts.en: Cherl is 30 years old, married, and has four children.  They live in the Philippines. Cherl has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and biscuits. She has had this business for three years. She is requesting a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy more canned goods, snacks, and biscuits. Cherl has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Cherl hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purcase canned goods, snacks, and biscuits

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

She has operated a tailoring business for the past five years, selling in a shop and from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high competition from other tailors in the area. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase four rolls of cotton and repair her sewing machine. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase four rolls of cotton and repair her sewing machine.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 51 years old from Vihiga and is married to Miriam. They have two children who are in primary school.

Thomas has a livestock business that he has been operating for the past ten years. He is applying for his first loan from KADET Ltd. after being introduced to KADET by a friend who is a client. He intends to use the loan to buy three cows to add to his herd.

The anticipated profits from this business will be used to pay for the family's needs and school fees for his children. He intends to see his business expand and be able to open a butcher shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy three cows to add to his herd.

loans.name: Marie Claire Gentille

texts.fr: Marie Claire Gentille est salarie, elle est célibataire, âgée de 23 ans, et elle est né au Rwanda.  .Son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans de secondaire et un an de l’université. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB.  Elle va acheter du ciment, peinture, planche et payer la main d’œuvre. Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est  la construction d’une belle maison remplit des conditions exige par le plan directeur de sa district. Dans l’avenir il voudrait construire d’autre maison destine à la location, avoir une bonne famille
texts.en:
Marie Claire Gentille is employed and a 23 year-old single woman born in Rwanda. Her education consists of six years in secondary school and one year in college.
This is her first loan cycle with ABC. She will purchase cement, paint and boards, and pay for labor. Her strategy for the success of the project is to build a beautiful house fulfilling the conditions set by the master plan for her district.
In the future, she would like to build another house intended for rental and to have a good family.

loans.use: to buy  cement, paint, boards and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Johnny De Jesus

texts.es:
Johnny tiene 39 años de edad es casado y padre de familia de tres hijos los cuales dos se encuentran en el colegio y uno esta en la universidad, el trabaja diario como tecnico industrial desde hace mas de cinco años.
el visita las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar un prestamo para el mejoramiento de su vivienda ya que quiere ponerle ceramica en la parte de abjo de su casa de habitacion ya que esta era solo de concreto todo esto para el brindarles mejores condiciones de su vivienda a su familia.
agradece a ceprodel por brindarle el prestamo.
texts.en:
Johnny is 39 years old, he is married and he is the father of three children, two who go to school and one attending university. He has been daily working as an industrial technician for more than five years.
He has visited CEPRODEL’s offices to request a loan he will use to improve his house: he wants to put ceramic tiles on the lower floor of his house, currently made only of concrete, in order to offer better housing conditions to his family.
He is grateful to CEPRODEL for granting him the loan.

loans.use: To by ceramic tiles.

loans.name: Sokreoun

texts.en:
Sokreoun is 29 years old and works as a garment factory worker. Her husband is a construction worker and their combined income is 4 USD per day. Sokreoun has two children, four and seven, and one of them is in school. Each month, she spends 40 USD on food, 10 USD on electricity, 10 USD on rent, 10 USD on school fees, 20 USD on transportation, and 15 USD on other expenses.  

Sokreoun is requesting a 500 USD loan to buy a motorbike to travel to work. In the future, she plans to raise chickens at home once she is able to save some money to buy feed. In the future, Sokreoun hopes to have more income to support her children’s studies through university.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to commute to work

loans.name: Brenda Magaly

texts.es:
Brenda, de 28 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de Granada, esta casada, es madre de tres hijos, ella es comerciante, es dueña de una pulpería. Cuando empezó a vender fue con un canasta de dulces, caramelos y un termo con hielo que usaba  para vender gaseosas, jugos naturales , así fue  luchando poco a poco , hizo un préstamo para poder comprar mercadería y surtir su pulpería la cual hoy en día ya tiene un año de tenerla activada.    

Requiere el préstamo para surtir su pulpería de productos tales como arroz, frijoles azúcar, aceite, huevo, leche, productos de limpieza. Esto le será de mucho beneficio pues podrá satisfacer en parte la demande de producto de consumo diario y masivo, vender mas productos que antes no vendía y mejorar sus ingresos. En sus metas próxima esta ampliar más su pulpería, hacerle mejoras a su casa.
texts.en:
Brenda is 28 years old. She lives in the city of Granada. She is married and has 3 children. She is a storekeeper and owns a grocery store. She started out by selling candy from a basket and soft drinks and fruit juices from a thermos of ice. In this way she worked hard to move forwards a little bit at a time. She took out a loan to buy groceries to fill the grocery store she started a year ago. 

She is asking for the loan to fill her store with products such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, milk and cleaning products. This will be of great benefit as she will be able to satisfy in part the great demand for consumer products needed on a daily basis, sell more products not previously sold before and increase her income. Her next goals are to further expand her store and make improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy inventory and fill her grocery store with products such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, eggs, milk and cleaning products.

loans.name: Tania De Los Angeles

texts.es: Tania De Los Ángeles tiene 30 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de cyber y  video juegos. Hace más de 4 años que tiene este negocio, comenzó con dos televisores, pero fue con el esfuerzo de su Mama que también la apoya con este negocio que han ampliado sus servicios. Ella atiende desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, siempre se preocupa por brindar un buen servicio. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de televisores, PlayStation, controles, juegos entre otros.
texts.en: Tania De Los Ángeles is 30 years old.  Her main form of employment is in the cyber and video game service.  She has had this business for over four years.  She began with two televisions but with the help of her mother, who also helps her with this business, they were able to increase their offerings.  Tania manages the store from 8am until 9pm, always ready to offer the best possible service.  She is seeking a loan in order to purchase more televisions, Play Stations, controls, and video games.

loans.use: purchase televisions, Play Stations, controls, and video games.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children.

Marietta has a retail shop that sells generic drugs like paracetamol and ambroxol. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of generic drugs to sell.

Marietta is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Marietta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of generic drugs to sell

loans.name: Mykola

texts.en: Mykola is married with one child. He and his wife Lesya have a business selling bicycles. Mykola loves this business because he himself loves to ride. Their son who is four already has his own bicycle. Mykola would like to borrow 8,000 UAH to increase his bicycle inventory. His dream is to start a bicycle club in their small town to introduce more people to a healthy and fun activity.

loans.use: to purchase bicycle parts and accessories.

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison is a 60-year-old married man. He has 5 children between the ages of 6 and 24 years. He describes himself as God-fearing, hard-working, trustworthy, and patient. He operates a charcoal-sales business where he sells charcoal to the local people. He has been involved in this business for 1 year. His business is located in a busy shopping centre. 

He describes his biggest business challenge as the low purchasing power of his customers. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to increase his stock of charcoal. His business goal is to grow his current business and diversify into a fish-selling business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will provide a better standard of living for his family.

loans.use: To increase his stock of charcoal

loans.name: Hun

texts.en:
Hun is 46 years old and married with 3 children. She is a cucumber farmer and has been in business for 10 years. 

This is her first loan with VisionFund.  Hun requests a loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland and to buy seeds to grow vegetables. 

With this loan, Hun hopes to increase her crop yield, earn more income and saving money to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland and seeds for vegetables planting.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Son's Group

texts.en:
This group, consisting of four members, comes from Siem Reap province. They’ve joined together to ask for some funds from Kiva for their own different purposes.  Among them, Mrs. Son, 29, is the leader of this group. She is a fishery worker, earning a profit of $3 per day to support her family. She has 3 single children who are attending the local public school. 

Recently, Son prepared to fix her present house partially, but she needs a loan from Kiva in the sum of $100 to supplement her saved money to pay local laborers who come to fix her house. She would like to say thanks to all lenders who kindly help her family and other members of her group.

loans.use: to pay local laborers who come to fix her house.

loans.name: Faustin

texts.en: Faustin is 35 years old with 4 children ages 1 to 12. The eldest child is in school. He sells clothes in a store he has run for 13 years. Faustin would like a loan to add different types of clothes to sell in his store and also to buy sorgham to sell. He hopes to use any profits from the business to buy a motor bike. He dreams to one day own a bigger clothing store.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a hardworking businesswoman, aged 54. She is married and blessed with four children. She has been practicing dairy farming for the last four years to support her family. She employs one person to help her to manage the business. Mary has been able to retain her business because of her good reputation with her customers. 
Mary is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy a dairy cow. Since she joined Kiva partner Faulu Kenya, she has been able to access loans to boost her business. In the next five years, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a single mother of four children and all her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members (her mother).  Judith requested 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings  from MCDT SACCO with which  she wants to  buy more crates of beer and soda, boxes of mineral water, and jerrycans of local gin. 

Judith has been in this business for ten years. She works in a shop and works seven days a week. Her business challenges include seasonality and increasing prices of beer and soda. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow big and becoming a wholesaler. Judith resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses   include rent, school fees, and medication.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and soda, boxes of mineral water, and jerrycans of local gin.

loans.name: Marga

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal   ”QORI ORCCO”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Urcos en la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra Marga;  La socia tiene 47 años de edad, La socia es soltera, La socia tiene 5 hijos; el ultimo de los hijos tiene 13 años de edad; la socia se dedica  la elaboración de tamales, panes, empanadas,  en los buses camino de Huaro a Urcos y viceversa, la socia desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de insumos como son royal, manteca, azucar, maiz, y la socia compra todos los ingredientes en la ciudad de Cusco, luego viaja 1 hora hasta Urcos y prepara en casa todos los productos para la venta, La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de ingredientes como son, royal, manteca, maiz, azucar, entre otros ingredientes.

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Sra. Marga is a member of the Communal Bank “Qori Orcco” which is located in the District of Urcos in Quispicanchis Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 47 years old, single, and has five children. Her youngest child is 13 years old. Marga prepares tamales, bread, and empanadas and sells them on the buses that travel on the road from Huaro to Urcos and vice versa. She will invest her loan in the purchase of supplies such as baking powder, lard, sugar, and corn. Marga purchases all of her ingredients in the city of Cusco. She must then travel an hour to her home in Urcos where she prepares all of the products that she will sell. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of these supplies.

Marga is grateful for the loan and promises to complete her payments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy baking powder, lard, sugar, and corn.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 28 years old and single. He is a businessman in Kapsabet town, owning a small phone accessories shop. He has been in operation selling mobile phone accessories such as chargers, batteries and keypads for a period of two years, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000.

He is requesting his third loan of KES 60,000 from KADET Ltd. He plans to use this money to purchase more phone accessories; batteries chargers and key pads for his shop. The profits will be used to develop his new plot. 

His dreams are to prosper in business and live a happy life.

loans.use: To purchase more mobile accessories.

loans.name: Tuzamurane Cb Group

texts.en:
Immaculee has two children. She is 30 years old. Her children are 4 and 9. Both of her children go to school.

Immaculee is the group leader of a group called Tuzamurane which means "Raise Together " in English. The group members have different businesses they run.

Immaculee is married to a driver. She owns a store where she sells different items such as soap, rice, sugar and cooking oil. With the loan requested she will buy more items to sell. She plans to use the profits for paying school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is 34 years old, married to Rodgers, a teacher, and they are blessed with two children, aged 10 and 8. She raises poultry, a business she started six years ago, and she earns a monthly income of KES 3,000. 

Anne has requested her first loan, in the amount of KES 5,000, to purchase more chicks and materials for renovating their coop. The anticipated profit will aid her in educating her children. 

Her dream is to be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and materials for renovating their coop.

loans.name: Jeanelyn

texts.en:
Jeanelyn is 41 years old and married with three children.

Jeanelyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through GDPMC in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Jeanelyn has been raising pigs for the past 2 years, and she has borrowed 2 previous loans from GDMPC to sustain her business.

Jeanelyn is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and feeds

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina B. is divorced and has a daughter. After the divorce she dedided to start a life of her own and it has been a great challenge. Irina was compelled to find a way to support herself and her daughter. That’s how she decided to open a small stall at one of the local markets selling toys. She has seen growth, her business is stable and successful today. Irina is very balanced and persevering. Her customers always speak very favorably of Irina, for the top-rate service she provides can make every client feel special and unique. She has had a perfect credit history in Nadiya Ukraine with no defaults. Irina needs a loan to invest in merchandise for the Chrsitmas season. She wants to buy a greater variety of items, like board games and different toys at a favorable price. Irina realizes there will be an increase of the demand for toys and that’s the reason she needs working capital to be prepared to supply her clients this Christmas season. The loan will help her meet the needs of the community, provide better service to customers, and get a higher return.

Броневич Ірина Вікторівна – розлучена, в неї є донечка. Після розлучення вона вирішила почати життя спочатку, але це стало справжнім випробуванням. Ірина Вікторівна була змушена знайти спосіб забезпечити родину самостійно. Вона вирішила відкрити маленький кіоск на одному з місцевих ринків та продавати іграшки. Бізнес поступово зростав, сьогодні він стабільний та успішний. Ірина Вікторівна – дуже врівноважена та цілеспрямована. Її клієнти дуже гарно озиваються про неї. Завдяки високоякісному обслуговуванню кожен покупець почувається особливим. В „Надії України” в неї прекрасна кредитна історія. Ірина Вікторівна потребує фінансової підтримки, тому що хоче інвестувати кошти в товари до Різдвяних свят. Вона хоче урізноманітнити асортимент продукції, а саме, придбати настільні ігри та іграшки за помірними цінами. Ірина Вікторівна розуміє, що напередодні свят завжди зростатиме попит на іграшки, тому вона потребує оборотних коштів для того, щоб задовольнити потреби покупців. Позика допоможе Ірині Вікторівні забезпечити якісне обслуговування клієнтів та отримати високий прибуток.

loans.use: To increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Mirian Saturnina

texts.en:
Hello, my name is Mirian and I am a dressmaker and my primary job is the creation of clothing items. I have a tailor shop and where I also sell accessories, located in the center of my city. I have several years experience in this business, which creates enough income to contribute to the family expenses and to take care of other obligations with my suppliers. At this moment in time, I need to stock my business in order to offer a greater variety of items to my clientel.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

Hola mi Nombre es Mirian soy modista, mi actividad principal es la elaboración de prendas de vestir para damas, cuento con un negocio de confeccion y venta de accesorios ubicado en el centro de mi ciudad, cuento con varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio el que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos familiares y demas compromisos con mis proveedores, actualmente necesito surtir mas mi negocio para poder ofrecer a mi clientela variedad.

loans.use: To purchase clothes and sewing accessories.

loans.name: Lourden

texts.en:
Lourden P. buys coconuts from her neighbors and sells them to the large trucks that come to her house twice per week. The trucks then take the coconuts into the capital city of Samana for distribution. Her business supports her four children: Yoham (17), Carolina (15), Yani (14), and Chicho (13). Lourden has repaid her first loan and is applying for this loan to purchase a larger quantity of coconuts to meet the high demand that the trucking shipments provide, and save up to fix the electricity in her home. She lives in the community near Playa Rincon on the north coast of the Dominican Republic, about 800 miles from Miami.

NOTE: Lourden is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, who have all gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $800 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending method strengthens social needs in a community and ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their business and family.

loans.use: Purchase large quantities of coconuts.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 40 years old. She is married with 5 children. Agnes is a member of Nalepo Baptist Church. She is a staunch Christian who believes in helping others. Agnes has been a very strong treasurer of Olkiret Women group. She has been a strong advocate of the need to change some of the negative culture; and has been vocal in bringing out the plight of the women and the girl child. As a community leader in Corner Baridi area, she has led a cluster of the women groups in her village in building of water tank, planting of trees and growing of family foods by advocating the importance of kitchen gardening. Agnes is an advocate of education for the girl child. She has worked hard and has managed to take one daughter to a primary boarding school. Her wish is to have all her children educated. As a member of Olekiret women group, she has applied for a loan of USD 300 to enable her buy 6 steers. She intends to graze the cows for 8 months and sell off. The profits will go to pay for her children’s school fees. She will repay all her dues after the 8 months.

loans.use: Agnes would like to buy steers

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
Leticia is a married mother of six. Her husband is a merchant, and with a big family she saw the necessity to help him with household expenses. She started selling food six years ago, first out of her home and later, little by little, she got her own shop in a better zone and now has many more clients. She wants to continue growing her business and waits for your help.

Leticia is requesting a loan of $275 to purchase ingredients for her goods, and plans to repay it within five months. Leticia and her family are very grateful for your support in growing this business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Leticia esta casada y tiene seis hijos y su esposo es comerciante, como son una familia grande ella vio la necesidad de ayudar con los gastos familiares a su esposo y fue hace 6 años que ella empezó con la venta de comidas desde su casa al inicio y luego poco a poco se hizo de un localcito para ya poner su negocio en una mejor zona en donde tiene ahora mucho más clientes, ella espera continuar con su negocio y seguir haciéndolo crecer y espera su ayuda.

Leticia está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 275 para comprar materia prima para su negocio y ofrece pagarlo en 5 meses, ella y su familia te agradecen mucho el apoyo que le brindes para continuar con el crecimiento de su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Olubanwo

texts.en: Mrs. Olubanwo E. is married with 2 children, she is 36 years old. She lives in Ijaniki, Lagos State of Nigeria. Olubanwo sells childrens' clothing in the Alaba International Market located 3 miles away from her home. She makes that distance every day to join her customers in the market. Olubanwo has many years of experience in  selling clothes for children. She has consistently developed her business over the last two years. She needs an additional loan of $800 to buy more clothing.

loans.use: To buy more children's clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in paper goods, gifts, toys and beauty products

loans.name: Nining

texts.en: Nining A., 39, has four children. Her husband, Bambang, works as a coolie at a workshop, earning very little income. Nining produces and sells fried snack and flavoured ice door-to-door to earn more income for the family. She is asking for a loan of US$100 to increase her business capital, so she can pay for her children's education.

loans.use: Increase of business capital

loans.name: Tweyimbe A Group

texts.en:
Suzan N. is a 31-year-old mother of four young children living Kamuli, Uganda. She makes a living by raising poultry, while her husband runs a welding business. Each week, Suzan earns $15,000 Ugandan shillings, or $9 U.S. dollars, each week. She hope to expand her business; with the extra profits, she plans on meeting basic needs, such as home repairs, school fees for her children, and clothing.

Suzan has applied for a loan of $1,125 U.S. dollars along with three other women. Suzan has taken out a loan before and paid it back on time, so she is confident that she will be able to repay this one as well. In this type of group loan, the money is divided among each woman to invest in her own business. They guarantee each other's loans, so that if one woman can't repay it, the others will cover her share. Rose M. wishes to buy a fridge for her retail store, while Jennifer J. wants to expand her pig-rearing business. Jesca N. hopes to buy staples to expand her small retail shop.

loans.use: To buy materials to expand a poultry business

loans.name: Din

texts.en: Mrs. Din A., 45, has a business milling rice for the local farmers with her rice grinding mill that takes the husks off the rice. She also breeds pigs. On average, she earns around $2.50 a day of profit. Her husband, who is a farmer, grows a rice on a plot of land, earning about $3 a day. They have six children, one of whom is married and lives away from home. Five others help the parents work. To increase the growth of the farmer, they need to buy good rice seed, cows, fertilizers, water pumps and so on to assist the farmer.

loans.use: To buy good rice seed, cow, fertilizers, water pump and so on to assist the farmer.

loans.name: Suliana

texts.es:
Thanks to legacy of her parents and her grandparents, Suliana and her husband have been able to set up a small tailoring business. They got involved in this business with the help of their children who helped promote their work. They want to grow their business by offering new designs and novelties to their clients in the city.

El legado de sus padres y abuelos han hecho posible la instalación de un espacio de confección de ternos a Suliana y a su querido esposo. Se desenvuelven en este espacio con la ayuda y publicidad de sus queridos hijos y han decidido convertir a su pequeño establecimiento en el más popular con lo arreglos que han decidido incorporar y con las nuevas novedades que van a presentar a las personas de buen gusto y vestir en su ciudad.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE A GREATER VARIETY OF FABRICS FOR THEIR TAILORING BUSINESS.

loans.name: Orn

texts.en: Mr. Orn P. is a farmer and palm juice collector in Kork Meanchey Village in Kampong Speu Province. His wife, Mrs. Tak Mom is also a farmer. Mr. Orn P.’s plantation has faced a problem because he does not have  animals to plough his rice field. In order to improve his plantation, Mr. Orn P. has decided to ask for a loan to buy cows to plough his rice field. Mr. Orn P. has four children, one of whom is construction worker, one is employed in a garment factory, one is attending school and the youngest child is too young to work or study. Previously, Mr. Orn P. has obtained a loan to buy a new motorbike so his oldest child can start a motorcycle taxi-driver. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to buy cows to plow his rice field.

loans.name: Pelagia

texts.es:
Doña Pelagia is a woman of humble heart and position who works very hard every day in her fields to produce her family’s sustenance, planting and tending her potatoes, beans, ulloco, corn, wheat, oats, and barley. Despite the losses Doña Pelagia and her family have suffered, they persevere, motivated by their desire for a better life, and that is why Doña Pelagia is asking for a loan to buy sacks of fertilizer to prepare one of her fields for cultivation. Show your solidarity with this noble but backbreaking cause!

Translated from Spanish by Ian, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Pelagia es una mujer de humilde condición y corazón que trabaja incesantemente en las duras tareas del campo las cuales labra diariamente para conseguir el sustento diario de su familia, trabaja diariamente vigilando sus campos de cultivo donde se dedica a sembrar papa, habas, olluco, maíz trigo, avena y cebada. Con el tiempo y a pesar de las pérdidas que sufrió Doña Pelagia y su familia perseveran motivados por sus deseos de superación, es por ello que solicitan un préstamo para comprar sacos de abono para preparar uno de sus terrenos de cultivo. Solidarízate a esta causa noble de trabajo esforzado.

loans.use:
Compra de abono//

Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Lun

texts.en:
Lun S., 26, has two young children and lives in Kampong Cham with her husband, Suon Seang Ly. She is a farmer. She typically pays to harvest a plot of land, and then sells the vegetables in the local food market for around US$2.70 each day.

Her husband sells large amounts of ice to a variety of local businesses and typically makes US$3.80 each day. Lun S. would like to increase her daily income to better support her young family, by investing in her vegetable business. She has asked for a loan of US$1200 to purchase a larger piece of property from which she can harvest yams. In this type of farming system, she will not actually own the land, but will pay to harvest a portion of the land and sell it in the market to make a profit.

She appreciates the opportunities that this loan provides for her family and is looking forward to reaping the benefits of her investment.

loans.use: Invest in yam business

loans.name: Nesi's Yatakuwa Group

texts.en:
Nesi is 23 years old. She is married woman and has two children, one 3 years old and the other 4 months old. She has been a clothes seller since 2004. Every day, she works from 6:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

In the past, Nesi has had another successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Sikudhani, Rehema, Zainab, Salama, and Zaina.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: la señora Maria M., tiene 51 años de edad, es soletra tiene dos hijos con edades comprendidas entre los 17 y 14 años, ambos estudian en sucundaria, su compañero de vida es juvilado,  señora se dedica a una pequeña puleria ubicada en su domicilio, la cual dad inicio como una alternativa al desempleo y una opcion para poder salir adelante con  sus hijos, para la cual desde hace cuatro años atras desempeña esta tarea. con sus creditos ha podido lograr ir creciendo y fortaleciendo el inventario de su negocio, su mayor sueño es poder ver realizados profesionalmente s sus hijos, su deseo es poder acondiconar su casa de habitacion, los creditos que ha slicitado han sido utilizados para invertir en capital de trabajo como es la compra de detergentes, gaseosa, bisuteria, granos basicos, su proposito es poder mejorar su negocio  y producto de las ganancias ir poco a poco cumpliendo sus deseos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria M. is 51 years old, unmarried, and has two children who are 17 and 14 years old. They both attend high school and her life-partner is retired. She works in a small general store located in her home, which she began as an alternative to unemployment and an option to be able to improve the lives of her children. The latter is why she has dedicated herself to her work for the past 4 years. With her loans she has been able to successful increase and maintain her business inventory. Her greatest dream is to be able to see her children become professionals, she also hopes to be able to furnish her home. The loans she has requested have been used as business investment capital to buy detergent, cooking-gas, accessories, and household necessities. Her goal is to improve her business and produce the income to, little by little, realize her dreams.


Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Sényébia Afi

texts.fr:
Née le 12 juin 1960 à Kpélé-Toutou localité située à 145 km de Lomé, dame D. Sényébia Afi est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Toutes les charges de la famille reposent sur elle puisque son mari est un policier en retraite et à une faible capacité financière. 
Elle a pour activité, la vente des tubercules d’ignames, des céréales et des fruits. 
Elle a une fois bénéficié du crédit et a bien remboursé.
Ce second crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 10 sacs de maïs, 60 tubercules d’ignames et 5 paniers d’orange.
texts.en:
Born on June 12, 1960 in Kpélé-Toutou, a town located 145 km from Lomé, Ms. Sényébia Afi D. is married and the mother of two. All household expenses fall upon her shoulders because her husband is retired from the police force and has a low capacity for income. Her work involves selling yam tubers, grain, and fruit. She once was a recipient of a loan, and she repaid it. This second loan she is requesting will enable her to buy 10 sacks of corn, 60 yam tubers, and 5 baskets of oranges.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, yams, and fruit

loans.name: Umarali

texts.en: Umarali is a father of 4 grown children. He has a small business raising cattle. He raises cattle and then sells them at the market. His kids also help him out in his business. He buys cattle for a cheaper price from the markets and, after fattening them for a month, he sells them. He also has a small business of repairing used furniture. He plans to increase the number of his livestock but doesn’t have a bigger cow-shed. With the help of loan, he wants to construct a comfortable cow-shed for his cattle.

loans.use: Increase the number of livestock and construct a cow-shed

loans.name: Magda

texts.es: Magda tiene 36 años, es viuda, vive independientemente en casa de su familia. Es una mujer muy fuerte, a la cual le gustan mucho los niños, lamentablemente no ha podido tener uno propio, ya que su esposo falleció, teniendo que dedicarse a lo que venia realizando desde hace 10 años, la venta de joyas. Siempre se ha desenvuelto muy bien en el negocio y la venta de joyas le arroja buenos ingresos, los cuales le permiten pensar en expandir su negocio, pero ella necesita ayuda es por eso que recurre a nuestra ayuda para realizar todas sus metas. Magda se encuentra en el 2do préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará más cantidad de joyas para poder vender, y así aumentar sus ingresos económicos, de antemano ella agradece tu gentil ayuda.
texts.en:
Magda is 36-years old and is single, living with her family. She is a strong woman, who very much likes babies. Unfortunately, she does not own property, since her husband passed away. For the last 10-years, Magda has dedicated herself to the sales of jewelry. She has always been able to develop good business and the sales of jewelry has brought in a good profit; so much so that she is now considering expanding the business, but she needs our help to realizes all her goals. Magda is into her second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and with these funds she will buy an inventory of jewelry to sell. She knows that this will greatly increase her income and thanks you in advance for your graciously helping her.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory of jewelery for sales

loans.name: Muharrama

texts.en:
B. Muharrama is 28 years old and is not married. For the past three years, she has been selling vegetables, such as potatoes, onions, and carrots. This business is the economic base that supports her family and generates their savings. 

Muharrama’s working day usually begins early in the morning at 8:00 a.m. She is a teacher by profession. Currently, she teaches at the school until the afternoon, and then goes to market to run her business. Muharrama is planning to increase her working capital, because, in new year, she will have a lot of clients. 

She is requesting 2000 Somoni ($ 600 USD). The loan will be repaid in 9 months. Your support will really help her. Muharrama is counting on your help. Be an important part of Muharrama’s business.

loans.use: To Increase the range of vegetables that she sells

loans.name: Innocent

texts.fr: Innocent U. est revendeur de pièces détachées depuis 4 ans à Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Âgé de 35 ans, il est marié  et père de 3 enfants. Innocent est un vaillant jeune homme qui tient son activité au serieux. Il espère avec ce crédit augmenter la capacité de son commerce en alimentant son magasin. Ce qui lui permettra d’accroître ses ventes et par conséquent ses profits qui lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Innocent U. has been reselling spare parts in Lomé, the capital of Togo, for four years. He's 35 years old, married, and the father of three children. Innocent is a courageous young man who takes his business seriously. With this loan, he hopes to bolster his business by supplying his store. This will enable him to increase its sales volume and therefore its profit, which will enable him to better provide for his family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell spare parts

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en: Mr. Chanthy P. lives in Trapaing Pring village in Kampong Chhnang province. He is a palm juice collector. Aside from this career, he is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, he usually hires a laborer with two oxen to plow the field. He has decided to ask for a loan to buy a second ox of his own to plow the field and to reduce his expenses.
