His wife, Mrs. Sao Eng, is a rice soup seller. Mr. Chanthy P. is 52 years old father of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another is a driver and the other is attending the local school. His wife is presented on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a second ox to plow fields

loans.name: Saer

texts.en: Saer A. A. is a 43-year-old married man with three children. He is a living in Kamed A. Lawz, Lebanon in the Bekaa valley. His first loan with Ameen was used to buy a refrigerator for his bakery. Today, Saer wants to borrow $1,200 to buy stock of flour and oil.

loans.use: Buy stock of flour and oil

loans.name: Yaovi William

texts.fr: Monsieur Yaovi william est un résident du quartier de didjolé à lomé, informaticien de formation, ce monsieur n’a pas pu trouvé un boulot convenable raison pour laquelle il a ouvert une boutique qu’il a appelé « MDI Informatique ». Dans sa boutique il fait du traitement de texte, la vente de matériel informatique et bureautique, il souhaite crée un cyber et faire d’autres activités telles que la gravure. Il s’approvisionne dans une grande boutique de vente de matériaux informatique appelée « SOPTIMEX ». Il demande à WAGES un premier crédit pour acheter 2ordinateurs, une imprimante, 06 graveurs de CD et 02 cartons de CD. Etant marié, il n’a pas encore eu d’enfant.
texts.en:
Mr. Yaovi William A. is married, without children, and lives in the Didjolé neighborhood in Lomé. He's a trained computer specialist, and since he couldn't find a suitable job, he opened a shop called "MDI Informatique". In his shop, he does word processing and sells computers and accessories, as well as office supplies. He would like to open a cybercafé and also start an engraving business. He gets his supplies from a large computer store called SOPTIMEX. He's seeking a first loan from Kiva's partner WAGES to purchase two computers, one printer, six CD burners, and two boxes of CDs.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 2 computers, one printer, 6 CD burners and 2 boxes of CDs.

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Vũ Thị Phượng  29 tuổi. Gia đình chị có hai con nhỏ đang tuổi đến trường. Năm 1996 chị Phượng  tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư mở cửa hàng cắt tóc gội đầu. Chồng chị hiện đang làm lái xe chở hàng thuê. Với thu nhập 5.000000đ từ dịch vụ cắt tóc gội đầu  và lương lái xe của chồng gia đình chị đang ngày càng có điều kiện để cải thiện cuộc sống và đầu tư cho các con ăn học
.Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 20.000.000đ để đầu tư thêm vốn mua ô tô tải phục vụ cho công việc vận chuyển hàng hoá của chồng.
texts.en:
Mrs. Vu Thi P. is 29 years old. She has two children who are going to school. In 1996, Mrs. P. joined TYM Fund and borrowed money to open a hairdresser's. Her husband is a truck driver. With an income of VND5,000,000 from the hairdressing business and from the wages of her husband, her family has financial resources to improve the living condition and pay for the children's tuition and board.

In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND 20,000,000 to buy a truck for her husband's transportation business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a truck for transporation business

loans.name: Delma Gertrudis

texts.es:
La señora Delma O. es propietaria de una moto taxi que circula en el municipio de Telica de la ciudad de León transportando a los pasajeros de un lugar a otro siendo este el único ingreso que esta dama posee en su localidad.

Es de importancia destacar que actualmente ella requiere repara su moto taxi y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra de repuestos y de esta manera proceder con la reparación del medio de transporte siendo esto de mucho beneficio para ella.
texts.en:
Delma O. is the owner of a motor taxi that runs throughout the district of Telica in the city of León, transporting passengers from one place to another. This is the only income that this woman has in her town. It is of importance to emphasize that Delma currently needs to repair her motor taxi. For this reason, she has come to Ceprodel to obtain a loan to buy spare parts, and in this manner, proceed with the repair of this means of transportation which is of such benefit to her.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair her motor taxi

loans.name: Marievic

texts.en:
Marivic D. is 32 years old and resides in Hinaplanan, Claveria, Cagayan de Oro City. She has four children, four of whom go to school. Her husband is a farmer, primarily of corn and cassava. Because farming is seasonal, they need a permanent source of income. Marivic started a variety store that caters to the needs of her village. Her store is in full demand of all the people in their village and she manages to procure items three times a week. In this way, Marivic is a big help to her husband in raising their family well.

Marivic wants to avail herself of the assistance offered by HSPFI, a Kiva partner that supports small entrepreneurs all over the world. Marivic is looking forward to making more improvements to her business.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Wael

texts.en: Wael is a 31-year-old married man. He has been working with decorative balloons for the past six years. Today, he is requesting $1,200 to purchase more inventory for the upcoming summer season.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Timotea Irene

texts.es:
La señora Timotea Irene C. Rubiños tiene 45 años, vive en el Distrito de La Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.  Es socia del Banco comunal Nueva Esperanza  II.
Ella estudió Secundaria Incompleta,  no tiene  hijos que depende económicamente de ella.
Timotea se dedica a la venta de Productos de Belleza, su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa.
Con este primer crédito de 300 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de productos de Belleza como colonias, cremas, champús, lápices labiales para implementar su negocio.
Timotea tiene como sueño implementar su restaurante para crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Mrs. Timotea Irene C. Rubiños is 45 years old and lives in the La Esperanza district of Trujillo in La Libertad, Peru. She is a member of the communal bank “Nueva Esperanza II.” Timotea studied some high school. She has no dependent children. Timotea sells beauty products from her home. With this first loan of 300 soles, she will buy beauty products like: colognes, creams, shampoos, and lipsticks to get her business going. She dreams of having her own restaurant so she can grow as a small business owner.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: La compra de productos de Belleza como colonias, cremas, champús, lápices labiales para implementar su negocio.

loans.name: Salamatou

texts.fr:
A. Salamatou est âgée de 28 ans et est née à COTONOU.  Sa famille est originaire de SAKETE, un petit village du département du PLATEAU où la principale activité est l'agriculture. Salamatou est mariée à un mécanicien et elle a trois enfants tous scolarisés.

Salamatou exerce depuis trois ans l'activité de la vente des chaussures et des habits pour enfants dans le marché Dantokpa, le plus grand du Bénin. Salamatou achète ses chaussures et ses habits en gros à Dantokpa et les revend en détail dans le même marché de façon ambulante. Son travail aide à faire les dépenses de sa famille.  Elle envisage actuellement aller elle-même à Lomé, Togo d’effectuer ses achats afin de réaliser plus de profit. Pour accroître son capital en vue de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Salamatou sollicite un crédit d’Alidé.
texts.en:
Salamatou A. is 28 years old and she was born in Cotonou. Her family is originally from Sakete, a small village in the Plateau department where the main activity is farming. Salamatou is married to a mechanic and she has three children, all of whom attend school. For three years she has been selling shoes and children's clothes in Dantokpa, the biggest market in Benin. Salamatou buys the shoes and clothes wholesale in Dantokpa and sells them retail walking around the same market. The income from her work helps out with the family expenses. She is currently thinking of going to Lomé in Togo to buy her goods more cheaply and thus make more profit. To increase her stock in order to better satisfy her clientele, Salamatou is asking for a loan from Kiva Field Partner, Alidé.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes and cothing

loans.name: Reina Elizabeth

texts.es: Reina Elizabeth B. D. V. resiD. en Cojutepeque departamento D. Cuscatlán. Madre soltera D. 30 años D. edad, vive con su hija Estefani D. 3 meses D. edad, Reina posee un negocio es una venta D. flores naturales en el mercado municipal D. Sensuntepeque , con 10 años D. experiencia en su negocio Reina posee una clientela estable, pero Reina desea aumentar sus ventas surtiendo  su negocio no solo con flores naturales si no que también vender artificiales, es por eso que hoy solita este crédito , para comprar dichas flores por las que sus clientes solicitan a menudo, y así lograra aumentar sus ventas, que le serán D. gran ayuda para la crianza D. su bebé.
texts.en:
Reina Elizabeth B. D. V. lives in Cojutepeque in the Cuscatlán department. She is a 30 year old single mother. She lives with her three month old daughter, Estefani. Reina sells live flowers in the Sensuntepeque municipal market. She has ten years of experience in the business, and Reina has a stable customer base. However, Reina wants to increase her sales by stocking her business with artificial flowers as well as live flowers. That is why she is now asking for a loan to buy artificial flowers. Her customers ask for them frequently. This way she will increase her sales, which will be a big help in raising her baby.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her store with artificial flowers

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Mrs. Carmelita B.'s dream is for her family to live a better life in Brgy. Carmelita is 38 years old and married to Mr. Francisco B.. Together, they are blessed with one child who is now attending college.

With a talent for business, Carmelita only needs an opportunity to test her entrepreneurial skills. This is how she convinced her husband to allow her to join the NWTF-Project Dungganon - so she could earn additional income for their small family. With the initial loans, she set up a "sari-sari" or general store which proved to provide a steady source of income for the family.

Because of her good performance as a member of the NWTF-Project Dungganon, she was able to access bigger loans which she used to invest in fishing. Later, she diversified these funds to purchase dried fish, locally known as "uga," which she delivered around the community. With three businesses that generate income for her, Carmelita's net profit averaged approximately PHP 5,000 per month.

This new loan of PHP 25,000 is Carmelita's 25th loan cycle, which she wants to use as additional capital to buy more fishing equipment. With her child already in college, Carmelita is determined to work harder and earn more to support the education of her only child. 

The attached picture shows Carmelita and Francisco B. inside of their "Sari-sari" or General Store.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few women but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To purchase additional capital for fishing equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat de marchandises

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Refurbish his trucks

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma C., a 50-year-old widow, is requesting her second loan through ASHI which she will use to grow her business of buying and selling rice. This enterprise has great potential to help her achieve her family's goals, the most important one being having her children, currently ranging in age from 7 to 15,  graduate from college and never experience the life of poverty she has endured since her husband's death.  Through the profits of her business, Norma also hopes that someday she will build a house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase rice for the business.

loans.name: Selina Jeruto

texts.en:
Selina is 36 years old, married to a farmer named Isaac, and blessed with four children. She runs a clothing business located in Eldoret Town.

With this loan from KADET, Selina intends to buy more clothing for her clothing sales business. This includes dresses and trousers for children and adults. She was introduced to KADET by a friend.

Her dreams are to improve her clothing business, buy a vehicle, and one day to have the ability build her own house.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey L. lives in Krang Thlang village in Takeo province. She is a 46-year-old widow with three children, one of whom is a construction worker while another is a monk and the remaining child is attending the local school.

Srey L. is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. In addition to her work on the plantation, she is a weaver. Now Mrs. Srey L. is requesting a loan to add to her savings so that she can buy a motorbike for her eldest child to drive to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her eldest child to drive to work

loans.name: Tarek

texts.en: Tarek is a single man living with his parents. He is 27 years old, and he has been supporting his family already for 12 years since he started working in a barber shop at a very young age.  He is the only provider for his parents. In 2007 he decided to open his own barber shop called “Tarek shop” so he could improve his income. Today, Tarek is applying for a loan of $1,200 to buy a vapor machine.

loans.use: To buy a vapor machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Mr. Vet So Of The Village Bank Group

texts.en: This is for a village bank loan, a group which consists of nineteen people, and they all live in Krouch village in Kandal province. Mr. Vet S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. He alS. owns a rice milling machine. His wife, Mrs. Haen Kal, uses the rice to make wine to sell. She is a pig breeder. Since her breeding pigs business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, Mr. Vet S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding. He is 65 years old and the father of a child who helps the parents work. Mrs. Koy Ny M. did not come to take a loan but her husband is, S. he is presented in the picture instead.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna es socia del Banco Comunal Obreras.
Reyna es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 1 hijo, Reyna tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza todos los días, además Reyna junto a su esposo tienen una mototaxi con el cual trabaja su esposo.
Reyna necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Reyna son mejorar su casa, y aperturar un hospedaje y restaurante.
texts.en:
Reyna is a member of the Obreras Communal Bank. Reyna is married (common law), is 30 years old and has 1 child. Reyna runs a store out of her house where she sells general goods, vegetables, and meat. She runs this business every day. Along with her husband, Reyna also has a motorcycle which her husband uses to provide transportation services. Reyna needs a loan of 1000 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of rice and sugar. Reyna's dreams are to improve her house and open a bed and breakfast with a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of rice and sugar.

loans.name: Sambat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sambat V. (in the photo), 54, and her husband, Mr. Set Sam, 62, live on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1979 and have five children: two sons and three daughters. Two of their children are married and live in separate homes, two others assist their mother in the weaving business and the youngest daughter is in school.

Sambat has been a silk weaver since 1980, having learned the skill from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in the Phnom Penh market. Her husband is a primary-school teacher. 

Sambat has requested a Kiva loan via Maxima one other time already. She is now requesting another loan in the amount of $100 to purchase more silk materials for continuing her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for continuing her weaving business

loans.name: Tito

texts.es:
Tito, de 44 años, vive en una casa alquilada en compañía de su esposa Esther (31), y sus pequeños hijos: Sheila (11), Josymar (9), Danery (3) y Alison (1).
Desde hace 5 años ofrece el servicio de transporte de pasajeros en una combi (camioneta con capacidad para 12 personas) que comprende rutas locales de su ciudad. Esta actividad le parece muy rentable, ya que su vehículo es propio y sólo debe repartir las ganancias con su cobrador.
Su trabajo es durante todo el día y todos los días de la semana, pues quiere brindarle a su familia una buena calidad de vida. 
Para el futuro, tiene planeado instalar una tienda de comestibles en su vivienda para que su esposa trabaje ahí sin descuidar a sus hijos.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente todas sus cuotas. A su vez, el dinero que solicita lo invertirá en el mantenimiento a su camioneta para seguir trabajando sin dificultad.
texts.en:
Tito, 44 years old, lives in a rented house with his wife Esther, 31, and their small children: Sheila, 11, Josymar, 9, Danery, 3, and Alison, who is 1. For 5 years he has offered passenger transportation service in a combi (a small van with a capacity of 12 persons) that includes local routes in his city. This activity is very profitable, since he owns his vehicle and only has to share the profits with his collector. He works during the entire day and also on the weekends, so that he can provide his family with a good quality of life. In the future, he plans to establish a food store in his home so that his wife could work there and also care for the children. This is his first loan with MFP, and he is committed to making all of his payments on time. The money that he requests will be invested in the maintenance of his van so that he can continue to work without difficulties.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: mechanical maintenance on his van

loans.name: Silvana

texts.en:
Silvana is an 18-year-old single woman. She learned hairdressing in a beauty academy and she started working at the same time in 2006. Starting 1 year ago, after graduating, she opened her own business in her home where she presents hairdressing services in addition to selling beauty products to her clients. 

In the future, Silvana wishes to open her own beauty salon, and she is working hard to make this dream come true. Today, Silvana is requesting to borrow US$ 1,000 to buy new beauty products and hair accessories and supplies to satisfy the needs of her clients.

loans.use: buy new beauty products and hair accessories and supplies

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
En la Ciudad de Carapeguá  en el Bo. San José distante a 300m de la oficina de Carapeguá unas señoras de escasos recursos se enteraron del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y decidieron reunirse para recibir una información sobre el mencionado programa . 
Estas Señoras son activas muy trabajadoras y se dedican a las  actividades ya mencionadas más arriba. Ellas buscando un poco más de apoyo para fomentar a través del crédito sus ingresos familiares y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Necesitan de esta operación crediticia para invertir en sus respectivos trabajos y así poder lograr un crecimiento sostenible que les haga crecer como grupo y en forma individual.
Actualmente cada una realiza una actividad diferente así como la señora Maria Isabel quien se dedica a la venta de bebidas. Esta actividad ella lo realiza en su domicilio desde un salón.
Sus clientes lo conforman los vecinos del barrio y hasta ahora resulta bastante bien por que los fines de semana la venta es muy buena y deja un poco de ganancia que a la vez es muy util para los gastos de la casa. Agradece por el crédito por que mediante ella puede seguir comprando las bebidas que ella vende-.
texts.en:
In the city of Carapeguá in the San José neighborhood 300 meters from the Carapeguá office, some women with few resources joined the program of the “Committee of Entrepreneurial Women”. They decided to come together to get information about this program. These women are active and hard-working and are involved in various types of activities. They are looking for a little more support to be able to increase the family income and improve their standard of living. They need money from this loan to invest in their respective work and to have sustainable growth that will help them grow as a group and as individuals. Currently they each have different activities such as Mrs. Maria Isabel who works selling drinks. She does this from a room in her home. Her customers are made up of people from the neighborhood and until now she has done fairly well because sales on weekends are very good. She makes a small profit which is very useful for the household expenses. She is grateful for the loan that has helped her purchase more drinks to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy different kinds of drinks such as wine, soft drinks, beer

loans.name: Adèle

texts.fr: Née en 1975, H. Adèle est mariée à YEBA Augustin et est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Adèle vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari au quartier Kpondéhou à Cotonou, depuis quatre ans environs. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Adèle a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire, et a appris ensuite la couture. Adèle exerce cette activité, et parallèlement, elle vend des tissus et confectionne également des tenues qu’elle vend à Scoa-gbéto à Cotonou. Adèle a dix ans d'expérience dans cette activité. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Adèle s’approvisionne. Adèle est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui a obtenu antérieurement quatre crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. Très sollicitée par sa clientèle, Adèle sollicite auprès de ALIDé un cinquième prêt en vue de renforcer son activité de vente de tissus et d’accroître son chiffre d’affaire.
texts.en:
Born in 1975, Adèle H. is married to Augustin YEBA and is the mother of two children, both attending school. For about four years she has lived with her children and husband in the Kpondéhou borough of Cotonou. The couple shares family expenses. Adele interrupted school at the secondary level, and afterwards learned sewing. Adele works as a seamstress, and also sells pieces of fabric and tailors clothing she sells at Scoa-Gbéto in Cotonou. She has acquired ten years of working experience. She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, Benin’s international market. Adele is a regular client of ALIDé, and was granted four previous loans, all of which have been repaid in full. Much in demand by her customers, she is now requesting a fifth loan to strengthen her fabric-selling activity and increase her turnover.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pieces of fabric

loans.name: Meris

texts.es:
La señora Meris es dueña de una pulpería que está ubicada en la zona urbana de la ciudad de El Viejo, tiene quince años de tener ese negocio.

Ella va utilizar el crédito para la compra para  la compra de cuatro viajes de leña ya que se aproxima el invierno y se incrementa el precio de la misma, y suele haber escases en dicho periodo.

Doña Meris es una señora de 63 Años, acompañada no tiene hijos, solo vive con su marido el cual el también le ayuda en lo que es la pulpería ya que es su único medio de alimentación diaria.

Este es el crédito No. 25 que tiene con CEPRODEL los cuales todos los ha cancelado muy bien en tiempo y forma por lo cual dice estar muy agradecida con la Institución por haber ayudado a crecer en su negocio y su vida familiar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Meris owns a grocery store located in the urban zone of the city El Viejo, she has had the business for fifteen years. She will use the loan to buy four trips of firewood, as winter approaches the price of it increases and it becomes more scarce. Mrs. Meris is a 63 year old woman, accompanied with no children, she only lives with her husband who helps her with the grocery store as it is the only source of their daily diet. This is loan No. 25 with CEPRODEL, all of which have been repaid well on time, she says she is very grateful for the institution as they have helped her to grow her business and family.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood and basic grains for her grocery store.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad A., is a 29-year-old married man from Gaza with five members in his family.

Mohammad has an advertising project and he wants this loan in order to buy a copying machine for the project. This will develop his project and increase his budget at the same time.

loans.use: To buy a copying machine

loans.name: Virgilia's Group

texts.en:
Virgilia B. is from the town of Cauacan Capirpiriwan Cordon. She is 48 years old. Virgilia is the group leader of a 12-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Virgilia B. Group.

Virgilia is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Virgilia owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Virgilia has been in business for more than four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Virgilia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virgilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Virgilia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which also will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Virgilia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ganhuyag

texts.en:
A. is 30 years old and lives in a 'ger', a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in Arhangai province, Mongolia. She has been living in her current home for 10 years. 

A. has operated a consumer goods business in her town since 2009. She started her business by borrowing 200,000 MNT from a friend. Since then, A. has quickly grown her business and today her working capital exceeds 800,000 MNT. She is an industrious person and focused on the future. A. has been working hard for a better life. She is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan to purchase consumer goods from Narantuul, the biggest market in Ulaanbaatar, with her brother's help.

loans.use: to purchase consumer goods for resale

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher K. W. provides computer services. He also buys old computers, which he repairs and sells to the local people. He has been in this kind of business for the last four years and he says that the business is profitable and the only major challenge is that there are so many people doing the same kind of business as his. So customers are spoiled by the choice. He is using his loan of Kes 50,000 to purchase old computers, repair them and sell to the local people. He plans to grow his business by moving to the ground floor of a busy building where he will stock all computer accessories and later own a computer showroom. He hails from Nairobi and his business is located at the Central Business District of Nairobi. Christopher is married and hasa three-month-old daughter. He describes himself as very hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase old computers.

loans.name: Joje

texts.en:
Joje A. is from the village of Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 39 years old. Joje is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Joje owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling school products such as pencils, pens, and notebooks, as well as food and other kinds of daily necessities, to the local community. Joje has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2010, Joje joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joje is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Joje from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Primero Dios Group

texts.es:
El grupo Primero Dios está conformado por Damaso V., María Luisa Mejía, Sandra de los Ángeles L. personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras. V. es el coordinador del grupo y desde hace cinco años que se dedica al cultivó y pica leña. Este señor de 56 años quien tiene tres hijos de 2, 17 y 19 años invertirá el crédito en la siembra de maíz.

Las integrantes del grupo son María Luisa Mejía quien comercializa sandalias y Sandra de los Ángeles L.  vende ropa a la moda, de diferentes estilos, colores y formas.
texts.en:
The Primero Dios ("God First") Group is made up of Damaso V., María Luisa Mejía, and Sandra de los Ángeles L., who are all hard-working and enterprising people. V. is the group coordinator and he has worked for five years growing and chopping firewood. He is 56 years old and has three children who are 2, 17, and 19 years old. He will invest this loan in sowing corn. The other group members are María Luisa Mejía, who sells sandals, and Sandra de los Ángeles L., who sells fashionable clothing of various styles, colors, and shapes.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sowing corn

loans.name: Sandra Lizeth

texts.es: Sandra Lizeth M. G. tiene 32 años de edad, reside en la Comunidad de Telica Abajo a 40 minutos de Juticalpa, es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos. Tiene un pequeña venta de abarroteria en su casa de habitacion, la cual atiende ella sola de Lunes a Domingo desde las 6:00 am hasta las 9:00 pm. Sandra comenzo este negocio dado a que frecuentemente tenia que viajar hasta Juticalpa a comprar en una bodega la provision de alimentos para su hogar y como siempre mantenia un buen inventario de productos sus vecinos le iban a quitar prestado alguno de estos y luego de un tiempo se los devolvian, asi que se le ocurrio que en vez de prestarselos se los podia vender.
texts.en:
Sandra Lizeth M. G. is 32 years old and she lives in the community of Telica Abajo, about 40 minutes from Juticalpa. She is a single mother of 3 children. She runs a small conveninece store from her home, managing it on her own 7 days a week from 6 in the morning to 9 at night. Sandra started her business because she found herself having to travel frequently to Juticalpa to purchase groceries for their home. She always kept her pantry well stocked and her neighbours used to always come to borrow products from her. She thought of the business this way, so instead of lending out the products she now sells them.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase general grocery items.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom S. (in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Bunthol Teang, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They married in 1975 and have 5 children--2 sons and 3 daughters. Two of them weave silk at home, one is a security guard, one is a goldsmith, and another one studies at a local school. 

Mom has been a silk weaver for more than twenty years. Her husband has been a policeman for more than thirty years. She is requesting a loan of US$ 300 to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Fe Y Amor 5 Group

texts.en:
Claudio is the coordinator of his group Fe y Amor 2 (Faith and Love). He makes his home here in a simple structure with his two children. He says that his most difficult challenge is 'to improve my business'.  In the meantime, he plans to continue to enjoy driving.

Claudio is excited to be taking his first loan with Esperanza. He is starting his business with this loan and he is planning to use it to invest in sport shoes, for men and women.  He will use the profits to invest in his business, which he wants to see improve in a short time.
 
This Esperanza associate began with us, because the facilities in Esperanza are better than other places where he can get a loan and his story is representative of his group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. His group is located in the rural area surrounding Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production, the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity shortages.

loans.use: To buy sports shoes.

loans.name: Rosa Matilde

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa Matilde C. es socia del banco comunal El Tocte, vive en la comunidad Vegaspamba, que pertenece a la parroquia de Jadan,  la mayor parte de su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, también salen a la ciudad para trabajar en diferentes áreas como en la construcción, en fabricas etc.

Doña Rosa tiene 36 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos de 18, 16, 14, 9 y 7 años de edad. Sus dos primeros hijos trabajan y ayudan  económicamente, su tercer hijo  estudia en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos en la escuela. Su esposo trabaja en el área de la construcción ya que es maestro albañil y gracias al trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

La Señora Rosa se dedica a la agricultura, siembra hortalizas las que vende en la feria libre en la ciudad, también  cría de animales como  cerdos, cuyes y pollos que los  vende en la feria del ganado.
 
Este es su séptimo crédito que realiza en la banca comunal y ha llegado a tener una gran amistad con todas las compañeras que lo conforman. Su nuevo crédito lo a va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en el alimento para sus cerdos.
 
Su meta es  crecer con su negocio de animales.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa Matilde C. is a member of the El Tocte communal bank. She lives in the Vegaspamba community, which belongs to Jadan Parrish. The majority of her people make their livings raising animals and in agriculture. They also leave for the city to work in different areas, like construction and in factories etc. Doña Rosa is 36 years old, married and has 5 children ages 18, 16, 14, 9 and 7. Her first two children work and help out financially. Her third child is in high school, and the last two are in elementary school. Her husband works in construction, since he is a master bricklayer. Thanks to his profession, they have been able to build their own home. Señora Rosa makes her living in agriculture. She plants vegetables which she sells in the free market in the city. She also raises animals, like pigs, guinea pigs and chickens, which she sells in the livestock market. This is her seventh loan with her communal bank, and she has come to build great friendships with all the women who are part of the communal bank. Her new loan will be invested in the purchase of chickens and pig feed. Her goal is to grow her business raising animals.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase chickens and feed for pigs.

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en:
Charlotte T. is from the village of San Luis, Gingoog City. She is 31 years old. Charlotte is widowed and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Charlotte owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) shop where she sells food and daily use products. Charlotte has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Charlotte joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Charlotte is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan she has taken from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: San Luis, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Telmo Nestor

texts.es:
Telmo Nestor L. E. tiene 57 anos. Es casado y vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia Bolívar. Tiene 4 hijos de 36 hasta 26 anos. 
 
Telmo es socio de la ventanilla rural El Placer de Ser Amigos, que está ubicada a 20 minutos de la parroquia San Jose del Tambo. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de cacao o tienen sus propios pequeños negocios.  
 
Telmo se dedica a la agricultura. Cultiva todo un poco—cacao, arroz, soya, y maíz. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en Matilde de Ester. Se venden de la cosecha una vez al ano su arroz, soya, y maíz. 
Solicita el crédito para hacer más cacao y pagar los trabajadores de sus cultivos. Con el apoyo del préstamo podría seguir trabajando en la agricultura. Su sueno es superar un poco mas y poco a poco hacer mas cultivos. 

Dice que este año ha sido mas o menos con sus cultivos, y espera que el próximo ano es más productivo. 

No tiene tiempo libre. Su vida es difícil y trabaja 7 días a la semana.
texts.en:
Telmo Nestor L. E. is 57 years old and married.  He lives in the Chillanes canton in the Bolívar Province.  He has four children ranging in age from 36 to 26.  Telmo is a member of the “El Placer de Ser Amigos” (The Joy of Being Friends) Communal Bank.  It is 20 minutes from the San José Tambo parish.  There are 15 members in all.  Most of them grow cacao or have their own small businesses.

Telmo is a farmer.  He grows a little of everything; cacao, rice, soy, and corn.  He makes his purchases and sells his products in Matilde de Ester.  He sells his harvested rice, soy, and corn once a year. 

He is requesting to loan to grow more cacao and to pay his field workers.  With the help of the loan he will be able to keep farming.  His dream is to get a little better and to, little by little, grow more crops.

He says that his crops have been so-so this year, and he hopes that next year will be more productive.

He does not have free time.  His life is difficult, and he works seven days a week.

loans.use: Grow more cacao and pay his field workers

loans.name: Sefako Ayaba

texts.fr: Madame est mariée avec un enfant. Elle est âgée de 30 ans et s’est spécialisée dans le commerce des produits cosmétique.Elle a associé plus tard la vente de boissons. Elle a débuté en 2009 cette activité.  Elle s’approvisionne  à Lomé et revend en détail à côté de la pharmacie djidjolé. Avec le prêt demandé, elle compte acheter 4 cartons de produit cosmétique  et 2 cartons de boissons pour faire face à la demande sans cesse croissante.
texts.en: Mrs. A. is married and has one child.  She is 30 years old.  She originally specialized in sales of cosmetics, then she added sales of drinks.  She started her business in 2009.  She buys her supplies in Lomé and sells at the retail level beside the Djidjolé pharmacy.  With this loan, she expects to buy four cases of cosmetic products and two cases of drinks to meet the ever growing demand for these products.

loans.use: Cosmetic products business

loans.name: Ana Obdulia

texts.es:
Ana reside en San Carlos, departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la venta de ropa, tamales, pan y tostadas de plátano, su esposo se llama Andrés Abelino Amaya y sus dos hijos Glenda Patricia de 8 años, Brenda Beatriz de 10 años de edad, ella sale a ofrecer su mercadería de forma ambulante tiene un día especial para ofrecer cada producto, por ejemplo un día vende ropa, el siguiente tamales, el próximo pan y así sucesivamente  realiza sus ventas.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para invertirlo en ropa, con esta compra ella espera ofrece a los clientes más prendas de vestir, de distintos colores y para todos los gustos. 
Su objetivo es contar siempre con una fuente de ingreso para dar a sus hijos un sano crecimiento sin faltarles la alimentación y la educación  para que se puedan preparar y mejorar su futuro.
texts.en:
Ana lives in San Carlos, in the Morazán department.  She has a business selling clothing, tamales, bread and banana tostadas. She has a husband, named Andres Abelino Amaya, and two children: Glenda Patricia, 8, and Brenda Beatriz, 10.  She goes out to offer her merchandise for sale in the streets.  She has allocates one day a week to sell each product.  For example, one day it will be clothing, the next tamales, the next bread, and so on.  She is requesting a loan to invest in clothing; with these purchases she hopes to offer her customers more garments in different colors for every taste.

Her goal is to always have a source of income so that she can provide her children with conditions that will lead to healthy growth, and so that they will not lack for food or an education that will prepare them for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Beth Njeri

texts.en:
Beth Njeri, aged 29 years, is a single mother of one child, Cynthia Mumbi, aged six, in pre unit. She lives in Kitengela and has her general shop there. She sells cooking fat, sugar, flour, fruit and vegetables among other items. She was introduced to KADET by other KADET clients.

Beth has been running this business for six years and her monthly profit is Kshs 10,000. This loan of Kshs 90,000 is her fourth loan with KADET and she plans to use Kshs 40,000 to buy fruits and vegetable, and Kshs 50,000 to buy sugar, flour and other items. If this loan boosts the business, she will use the anticipated profit to  pay school fees for her daughter.

Beth describes herself as hardworking and dreams of becoming a prominent business lady and grow with KADET.

loans.use: To increase her stock of sugar, flour, fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Hap

texts.en:
Hap B., 33, is a married man living in Takhmao City. He is a local crop farmer, growing rice and vegetables on his land, which came from his grandparents in 2005. His wife is a vegetable seller, and makes a profit of $3 per day on average. Hap B. owns motorbike and he also uses it to take his wife and the vegetables to the local market every morning.

Hap B.’s wife thinks that it is time to sustain her investment's growth and look for extra revenue, which she proposes to do by selling vegetables at the market. She wants to buy a larger quantity of vegetables to sell to retailers in the market, but she complains that she doesn’t have a big enough vehicle to transport more vegetables. To achieve her goal, Hap B. has decided to seek a loan in order to purchase a trailer to connect to his existing motorbike so that he can use it to pick up more vegetables. He will use rest of the loan towards purchasing farm supplies to use on his field.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer, and farm supplies.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther, de 40 años,  de carácter muy amable y solidario, es muy laboriosa, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos. La actividad a la que Esther se dedica, es la compra y venta de bisuterías, concernientes en aretes, collares, pulseras, ganchos y vichas de artesanías y fantasías finas. Estas mercaderías los compran del mercado central de Lima y seguidamente los envía mediante la empresa interprovincial,  a la provincia Pucallpa (la selva peruana), en donde recepciona sus familiares, quienes se dedican a la distribución. Es así, que realiza su trabajo por más de 2 años, buscando nuevos diseños y descubriendo nuevos proveedores; quienes le dejan a precios mucho más asequibles que los tiendas comerciales. Por lo tanto su negocio le  resulta muy rentable a Esther, por lo que se siente muy contenta. Además, tiene mucho más tiempo para dedicarse a sus hijos. En adelante, se ha propuesto  terminar de construir su casa de material noble. Es sus 11avo crédito con MFP, y sabe que le será muy útil para continuar realizando su negocio. Por ello, se compromete pagar todas sus cuotas  como lo vino haciendo hasta hoy en día. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mercaderías en bisuterías, de esa manera cumplir con los pedidos pendientes de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Esther, 40, is a kind, caring and hard-working woman. She lives in her own home together with her husband and two children. Esther works selling costume jewelry such as earrings, bracelets, necklaces, barrettes, hand-made headbands and imitation jewelry. 

Esther buys merchandise from the Lima’s central market and then sends it to the province Pucallpa (Peruvian jungle) where distributors receive the goods. This is how Esther has done business for over two years, looking for new designs and finding new suppliers that allow her to keep prices more affordable than department stores. For the most part, Esther’s business is very profitable, which is why Esther is pleased. In addition, she has more time to devote to her children. 

Going forward, Esther plans to finish construction on her home with quality materials. This is her 11th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma (MFP) and she knows that it will be very useful to her as she continues growing her business. She commits to making timely payments as she has continued to do to date. With the loan she requests, Esther will buy costume jewelry to satisfy the requests of her customers.

loans.use: Purchase costume jewelry merchandise to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Gerelina

texts.en:
Gerelina L. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 43 years old. Gerelina is married and has 3 children aged 16, 14, and 12. To make a living, Gerelina owns & operates a business venture in the food sector, making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from making "puto" (rice cakes) and other delicacies for sale. Gerelina also helps her husband plant and harvest rice crops on their farm.

Gerelina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gerelina is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Gerelina from CEVI.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Mary

texts.es: Mary tiene 30 años, vive con sus 2 hijas en casa de su suegra. Hace más de 3 años se dedica a la costura de cubrecamas, almohadones y colchas, prendas que ella misma elabora con diversos y novedosos diseños. Es entonces que todos los días en su taller de confecciones, negocio que acondicionó en el interior de su casa. Las prendas que  confecciona son ofrecidas a personas conocidas, así como a las tiendas aledañas de su casa,  donde venden artículos para el hogar. De esta manera logra obtener ganancias considerables, y eso satisface sus expectativas y su economía, por tanto espera mejorar su taller y tener mas capital de trabajo. Es su cuarto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más telas y demás materiales que necesita para la elaboración de colchas, cubrecamas y almohadones.
texts.en:
Mary, 30, lives with her two daughters in her mother-in-law’s house.  For over three years she has been making bedspreads, large bed cushions and comforters, items she makes herself with diverse, original designs.

She set up a sewing workshop at home where she works every day.  The items she makes are then offered to acquaintances as well as to the local stores near her house where items for the home are sold.  This way she obtains considerable profits that meet her economic expectations.  She hopes to improve her workshop and have more working capital.

This is her fourth loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support because she’s always been responsible with her payments.  In addition, she enjoys being part of her communal bank because all its members are responsible and mutually supportive people.

She thanks all the people who will fund the loan she’s requesting that will be very useful for her business’ progress.  She will use the requested funds to buy more fabric and other materials she needs to make the bedspreads, comforters and large cushions.

loans.use: To buy fabric and materials for the manufacture of bedspreads, comforters and pillows.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
This is Virginia M., 58, resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Ricardo M., a farmer, and mother to their three children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Virginia operates a variety store where she also sells the fruit that her husband grows and harvests. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Arlene earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She will also invest a portion of the loan for their fruit stall needs. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Virginia hopes to be able to expand further soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Yolima Bibiana

texts.es:
Como madre cabeza de familia, Yolima Bibiana G. B. ha tenido muy clara la ley del rebusque, pues debido a su situación económica y por la falta de oportunidades laborales ha sido vendedora puerta a puerta de diferentes productos. Actualmente esta emprendedora tiene un negocio de frutas donde deleita a los transeúntes con deliciosos sabores. 

Para seguir adelante y continuar cubriendo los gastos del hogar acompañada de sus dos pequeños hijos, Yolita necesita de un préstamo para realizar algunas adecuaciones en su punto de venta, así como comprar más insumos para poder responder ante los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
As head of family, Yolima Bibiana G. B. knows a lot about how hard it can be to get by sometimes.  Due to her economic situation and the lack of jobs she has had to sell different products door-to-door.  Currently this enterprising woman has set up a fruit stand and sells delicious flavors to the passersby.

In order to get ahead and continue covering the household expenses for herself and her two small children, Yolita needs a loan to make improvements to her sales point and buy more ingredients to be able to meet her customers' demands.

loans.use: To improve sales point and buy ingredients

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
La señora Karina es socia del banco comunal Perlas de Pucallpa, del Distrito Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 26 años de edad y es madre soltera, tiene una niña.
Su negocio es la compra y venta de madera por lote, lleve en este negocio 6 años lo cual le ha servido para salir adelante y poder criar a su hija.
Con este nuevo préstamo de s/. 3,000.00 comprará un nuevo lote de 2000 mil pies de madera  para luego revenderlo, el negocio es al instante, compra y vende.
Ser madre le ayudó a madurar y ver la vida de otra manera, sabe que tiene que trabajar  mucho para poder criar y educar a su hija, por un lado tiene la ayuda de su mamá que la cuida a su hija mientras se va a trabajar, es un trabajo pesado porque no tiene horario. 
Manuela Ramos es parte de su vida, el apoyo económico le abrió las puertas a un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Karina is a member of the communal bank named "Perlas de Pucallpa" of the district of Calleria in the department of Ucayali. She is 26 years old and she is a single mother. She has one daughter. 

Her business is the buying and selling of wood by the lot. She has 6 years in the business and it has helped her to get ahead and to support her daughter.

With this new loan of S/3000 she will purchase a new lot of 2000 feet of wood to resell. The business concludes instantly, the buying and reselling.

Being a mother has helped her mature and to look at life from another point of view. She knows that she needs to work hard to raise her daughter and to send her to school.  On one side she has her mother's support because she takes care of her daughter while she is at work. It is difficult work because there is no set schedule.

Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) is part of her life and the financial support opened many doors for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase 2000 feet of timber

loans.name: Kigoyera Marketing Cooperative Group A, Kyenjojo

texts.en:
Saturday B. is the leader of Kigoyera Marketing Cooperative A in Kyenjojo. He is 45 years old, married and has thirteen children, seven still in school. Some of his children work with him in his business.

Saturday deals in produce, which includes maize, beans, cassava and so on from Kigoyera. He has a well-stocked store, and his customers are mostly big grocery owners in the area. He also sells a local brew called “waragi,” which he makes himself. He started his produce business seven years ago and now makes 80,000 UGX weekly.

In the past Saturday had a retail shop where he accumulated capital that, in addition to his loan proceeds, he used to begin his produce business. He needs a new loan to be able to increase the stock in his produce store.

loans.use: To buy more produce to stock his store

loans.name: Rezo

texts.en:
Rezo I. lives in the village of Buknari, Guria Region. He is 54 years old, married and lives with his wife and son. Omar, Rezo’s son, is 26 years old. He graduated from high school and now wants to continue learning and get a Master’s degree. Rezo’s family can’t afford Omar's studies, and they decided to get credit and expand their agricultural farm, to increase their income. 

Rezo has four milk cows and four calves. He sells 80 kg cheese per month. The cheese is sold in Chokhatauri (a nearby town). Along with the dairy farm, the family runs a bee-keeping business; they have 13 bee-hives and sell 250 kg honey per year. Also they have 300 nut trees and sell 500 kg nuts per year. 

With the requested loan, Rezo will purchase 8 additional bee-hives and wax plates. This will give them 150 kg additional honey per year. Taking into account the market price of the honey (8-10 Laris per kg) their annual income will increase by 1200 – 1500 Laris. 

As was mentioned above, the increase in the income will be used for financing the studies of Omar, Rezo’s son.

loans.use: to purchase bee-hives and wax-plates.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda T. is from the village of San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City. She is 43 years old. Erlinda is married and has four school-age children. Erlinda owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1,337 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2010, Erlinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used for feed for her fishpond. This will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her fishpond

loans.name: Amadou Group

texts.fr: A. est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont la présidente (dont la main est levée sur la photo) est nommée Abiba. Les membres du groupe viennent du même village. Abiba est mariée à Issifou et a trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Il y a juste un an que Abiba et son mari se sont installés à Ekpè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Ils y vivent avec leurs enfants. Abiba vient en aide à son mari en assurant avec lui les diverses charges familiales. Pour y parvenir, Abiba prépare de « Kome » (aliment local fait à base de maïs) accompagné de sauce aux poissons, qu’elle vend de façon ambulante. Abiba fait ses provisions dans le marché de Abattoir à Cotonou et aussi à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Abiba exerce cette activité depuis sept ans. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui a bien remboursé les crédits antérieurs qu’elle avait reçus. En vue de renforcer son capital et d’augmenter sa production journalière afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Abiba sollicite un autre financement de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres de son groupe.
texts.en: A. is a group made up of three people, whose president (raising her hand in the photograph) is called Abiba. The members of the group come from the same village. Abiba is married to Issifou and has three children, all of whom attend school. Abiba and her husband moved to Ekpè, in the Sèmè-Podji municipality only a year ago, where they now live with their children. Abiba helps her husband by seeing to the various needs of the family.  To help out, Abiba produces 'Kome' (a local corn-based dish) with fish sauce, which she sells through door-to-door sales. Abiba sources her goods from the Abattoir market in Cotonou, and also from Dantokpa, Benin's international market.  She has worked in this field for seven years, and has already received and repaid several loans from ALIDé. In order to boost her business capital and her daily output so that she can meet her customers' growing demand, she and the other group members are seeking a new loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: To purchase corn, fish and condiments

loans.name: Jardines De Paz Group

texts.es:
El grupo Jardines de Paz lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Milagro de Socorro de 71 años quien en 1996 inicio su negocio de comercio de calzado y ropa con 1,500 córdobas. Ella tiene 7 ciclos de trabajar con Adim en los cuales su negocio ha ido creciendo e invertirá el crédito en el fortalecimiento de este con la compra de calzado y ropa variada.
Las otras integrantes son Felipa de 41 años quien vende tortillas, rellenitas, café, fresco y platanito desde hace 7 años y Marisol quien tiene un modesto taller de costura desde hace 10 años.
texts.en:
The group Jardines de Paz [Gardens of Peace] consists of three hard working and enterprising women. One of them is Milagro de Socorro who is 71 years old. In 1966 she began her footwear and clothing business with 1,500 Cordobas. She has completed seven loan cycles with ADIM, expanding her business. She will invest this credit to further strengthen her business with the purchase of footwear and various articles of clothing.

The other members are Felipa who is 41 years old and has been selling tortillas, black pudding, coffee, drinks, and banana chips for 7 years and Marisol who has run a modest sewing workshop for 10 years.

loans.use: purchase footwear and clothing merchandise.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is 60 years old and married with five children. Estelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Estelita has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 15 years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

Estelita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima, a 26-year-old married mother of two, lives in the Philippines where she has been raising pigs to earn a living for the past three years. A member of PMPC for three years, Fatima is requesting a loan to purchase feed for her pigs.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi 3 est constitué de femmes mariées du village de DIGAN dans la sous préfecture de OUELESSEBOUGOU, région de KOULIKORO (deuxième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles, ont en moyenne 35  ans,  5 enfants et  cultivent de l’arachide, du gombo etc.   
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  et  sont à leur  cinquième  prêt  de campagne.
SALI, la première assise à droite,  compte utiliser son  prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semences d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles,  au grand marché de OUELESSEBOUGOU. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de OUELESSEBOUGOU, BAMAKO et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail, souvent en gros, au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 35.000 à 45.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Benkadi 2 is a group composed of married women from the village of DIGAN in the sub-prefecture of OUELESSEBOUGOU, Region of KOULIKORO (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in traditional families and average 35 years of age and five children. And they grow peanuts, okra, etc.

Concerned about making their plantations profitable, the group members decided to join the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They are now on their fifth farm loan.

SALI, who is seated first from the right in the photo, intends to use her loan to buy a sufficient quantity of peanut seeds, sundry supplies and equipment, and some farm inputs at the big market of OUELESSEBOUGOU.

Following the off-season, the harvested crops are stocked for a certain time, so that they gain in value. And then they are sold retail (often in bulk) for cash at the big market of OUELESSEBOUGOU, BAMAKO, and at surrounding markets. The customers come generally from large cities. 

After selling the produce, the group members plan on making a profit of 35,000 to 45,000 francs CFA that will be used for paying the loan interest and for typical family expenses.

loans.use: to pay for farm inputs, seeds, and sundry supplies and equipment

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is 33 years old and supports three members of the family. He is to married to Ursler, who does some poultry farming to support the family. He has three children. He does a business of buying and selling milk to the co-operative society. He has been in business for six years; his monthly from the business is 255,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

He is borrowing a loan of KES 100,000 with which he plans to buy more liters of milk for sale. He plans to use the anticipated profit from the business to purchase a plot in Tuiyo Centre. This is his second loan, and he successfully paid his previous loan. His hopes and dreams are to buy a plot in Tuiyo Centre and construct rental houses.

loans.use: to buy milk from neighbors for sale to the co-operative society.

loans.name: Karen Lisseth

texts.es:
Karen tiene 28 años de edad trabaja en la ciudad de managua diario como  analista de cobranza desde hace varios años, ella es madre soltera de un hijo este se encuentra en edad escolar.
ella visita las oficinas de ceprodel para solictar un prestamo para la construccion de una vivienda pequeña para ella y su hija.
ella utilizara el dinero en la compra de materiales de construccion como; arena, cemento, hierro y zinc para terminar de construir su casa.
por lo que agradece a ceprodel por aberle brindado ya que ahora ella y su hija gozaran de una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Karen, 28, has worked every day for many years as a Collections Analyst in the city of Managua.  She is a single mother of a school age child.

She visits Ceprodel’s offices to request a loan to build a small house for herself and her daughter.  She will use the money to buy building materials like: sand, cement, iron rods and zinc metal sheeting to finish building the house.

She thanks Ceprodel for granting her because now she and her daughter enjoy a proper home.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie, 47, is married with two children and lives in Guinabot, Sapang Dalaga. She sells groceries and dry goods to earn a living. She has had this business for 12 years and earns 18,000 PHP a month. She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase 20 sacks of rice to sell.

Lenie has been a member of PMPC for half a year. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase 20 sacks of rice for resale.

loans.name: Letty Narcisa

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Amigas De Espoir se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Calceta, ciudad conocida con el nombre de “Calceta la sin par” por la belleza de sus mujeres y porque para sus habitantes no hay ciudad más hermosa en el mundo.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Letty, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 4 hijos de 23, 19, 15 y 13 años de edad, los  dos mayores de edad estudian en Universidad y los menores en colegio. Su esposo es chofer. Nuestra amiga es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque el grupo ha crecido y es muy unido y solidario.

Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta productos por catalogo de Avon y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días ya que a veces sale a recorrer y también vende en su casa, además sus hijas le ayudan con las ventas ya que ellas venden en la universidad a sus compañeras de clases, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada dia sábado. Lleva cinco años que se dedica a esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien, nos cuenta que lo que más vende sin los perfumes ya que son muy buenos.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería.

Sus sueños son ver que todos sus hijos cumplan sus metas y sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The “Amigas de Espoir” (Friends of Espoir) communal bank meets every two weeks in the beautiful city of Calceta, a city known as “Calceta la sin par” (Calceta the unequaled one) due to the beauty of its women and because for its residents there is no more beautiful city in the world.

We met Letty, 45, here.  She’s married and has four children who are 23, 19, 15 and 13 years of age.  The two oldest are studying at university and the two youngest are in secondary school.  Her husband’s a driver.  Our friend is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because the group has grown and is very united and mutually supportive.

She is a housewife who, in order to earn her own income, sells Avon and Yanbal (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumery and women’s accessories) via catalogue.  She works every day and sometimes goes out to sell as a street vendor and also door to door.  Her daughters help her sell since they sell to their classmates at the university.  She sells on credit and collects payments every Saturday.  She’s been in this line of work for five years and has done very well.  She tells us that what she sells the most is the perfumes because they are very good.

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and costume jewelry.  Her dreams are to see all her children reach their goals and be good professionals.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is married with two little kids. She is 29 years old and lives in Capucao, Ozamiz City, Philippines.

Sharon is a farmer and grows edible plants like cassava, root crops, legumes and others, to earn a living. She has been tilling her land for over 10 years; hard work, but Sharon loves her work. Each month, she approximately makes a total of PHP 6,000 from this and along with other irregular sources of income. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to purchase fertilizers for the fast and firm growth of the plants. 

Sharon joined the cooperative earlier this year. This is the initial loan amount taken from GDMPC. In the future, Sharon hopes to expand her business and plant more crop varieties to earn more income and sustain daily needs of the family. She also plans to improve her house so as to have a comfortable place to live in.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has five children. 

Rita has a retail shop that sells clothing like blouses, t-shirts, underwear and shorts. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy shirts, blouses, underwear and shorts for resale.

Rita is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Rita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses, underwear and shorts to resell.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio tiene 40 años, es un hombre muy trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Celedonia de 37 años y sus dos menores hijos Jaime y Yorela a quienes desea brindar mejor calidad de vida. Desde muy joven, Antonio se dedica al cultivo de cacao y café, es conocedor de la agricultura, sus cultivos están bien cuidados ya que sabe que los ingresos de su familia dependen de esta actividad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho esfuerzo y sobre todo con ánimo para obtener buena cosecha. Lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que fumigar sus cultivos para evitar la plaga de insectos que perjudican sus plantas. Con el tiempo, desea abrir un negocio y comprar más plantas de cacao para que pueda aumentar su producción. Este será su décimo sexto crédito con MFP, sabe que con este aporte le ayudará en el progreso de su negocio. Antonio se siente muy contento por trabajar en su banco comunal, él sabe que debe ser responsable con los pagos. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará plantas de cacao y productos de abarrotes como: azúcar, arroz, conservas, etc. Para su nuevo negocio.
texts.en: Antonio is 40 years old. He is a very hard-working man. He lives in his own house with his wife Celedonia, 37 years old, and their two minor children, Jaime and Yorela, to whom he wants to bring a better quality of life. From the time he was very young, Antonio has grown cacao and coffee. He is knowledgeable about agriculture, and his crops are well-cared for, since he knows that his family's income depends on this activity. What he likes most about his job is planting the fields. He does it with great effort, and above all with spirit, in order to get a good harvest. He has been doing this for 30 years, and he thinks the most difficult thing is to have to fumigate his crops to avoid plagues of insects that damage his plants. With time, he wants to open a business and buy more cacao plants in order to increase his production. This will be his sixteenth loan with MFP. He knows that this support will help him in the progress of his business. Antonio feels very happy because he works in his communal bank, and he knows he must be responsible with the payments. With the 3,000 nuevos soles he is asking for, he will purchase cacao plants and grocery items such as sugar, rice, preserves, etc., for his new business.

loans.use: to purchase cacao plants, as well as to purchase products to start his new store

loans.name: Rosetta

texts.en:
Rosetta, age 36, sells coconuts at the local market to earn a living. She and her husband live in the Paynesville area with their four children, whose ages range between five and 14 years old. All four are enrolled in school and live at home. Rosetta's husband works as a driver.

Rosetta has been engaged in her business for the past five years. She makes a good profit from her work, which helps her to pay her children's school fees.

She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more coconuts for her business. She hopes eventually to build a house and send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more coconuts to offer for sale

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah lives in Kampala, Uganda .She is married with six children and all go to school. She has one additional family member.

She sells charcoal on a wholesale basis at the market. She has been in this business for the last five years. Her other source of income is from rental houses. She works six days a week .She has requested a loan of 1,200,000 from Kiva partner MCDT SACCO in order to buy more bags of charcoal. Her goals and aspirations are to own a delivery van to assist in the transportation of charcoal and also to build more commercial houses. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. She lives  in her own house and  the  family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Raising hogs is quite difficult because it requires extra patience and proper maintenance to ensure hogs proper growth and nutrition. Jessie got involved in this kind of business as source of income because she was not able to seek other employment. She only finished high school before getting engaged and married.

She breeds and raises hogs and, upon reaching maturity, sells them to the butchers who come into her village. She has had this business for almost three years now.  

Jessie is 35 years old and has three children, all of whom attend school. She is now asking for a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy livestock feed and vaccines to make her business sustainable. She wants to ensure proper growth of hogs to sell them at a higher price.

In the future, Jessie wants to construct her own pigpen. At the moment, the pigpen she uses for her hogs is owned by her in-laws. She also wants to provide a better living for her family.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed and vaccines.

loans.name: Maura
