texts.es: Maura es socia del Banco Comunal Sarita, tiene 50 años, es madre D. 4 hijos, se dedica a la siembra y venta D. alfalfa, esta en Finca desD. hace 2 años, el primer préstamo que recibió lo invirtió en la compra D. semillas y repuestos para su carro, con la rentabilidad que le dio su negocio y sus ahorros pudo comprar su carro el mismo que lo hace trabajar, gracias a las capacitaciones que recibe D. Finca aprendió a invertir bien su dinero, a valorarse como mujer y educar bien a sus hijos. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. otra parcela D. chacra para sembrar mas alfalfa. Su meta es comprarse otro carro.
texts.en: Maura is a member of the Sarita Communal Bank. She is 50 years old, she has 4 children, she is a farmer and she plants alfalfa. She has been a member of Finca Peru for 2 years she invested her first loan in the purchase of seeds and of spare parts for her car. Thanks to her savings and to the profitability of her activity she has been able to buy a car that she uses in her job. Thanks to the trainings received from Finca Peru she has learnt how to properly invest her money, how to realize herself as a woman and how to give a good education to her children. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of another parcel of farmland to plant more alfalfa. Her goal is to buy another vehicle.

loans.use: To buy another parcel of land to plant alfalfa.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a determined businessman, aged 36. He is married and blessed with three children, all of whom are in school. For the last six years, he has been running a hardware business to support his family. He also does farming to increase his income. He employs one person to assist him in managing the business. 
John is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy paints, spanners, bolts and nuts. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy paints, spanners, bolts and nuts.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 67-year-old businessman who is married to Alice, who is a businesswoman. They are blessed with an adult child who is 34 years old. For the past 11 years, David has been selling cereals. He earns a monthly income of 4,800 KES which he uses to support his family.

David is applying for his fourth loan with KADET to purchase a stock of dry maize and beans for his business. He has successfully repaid his previous loans. With the anticipated profit from his loan David will expand his business. He hopes to build a storehouse for his cereals to be able to capitalize on sales when prices are low to make more profit.

loans.use: to buy dry maize and beans

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 2 children, both of whom are in school. Susan has a grocery store business. She has been in this business for 2 years, and she works 7 days out of every week.  Susan sells her products in a retail shop. She has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, boxes of soap and cartons of salt.
 
The main business challenges for Susan include the increasing prices of commodities and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler and also to educate her children up to university level. Susan lives in a home that she owns where she has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, boxes of soap and cartons of salt.

loans.name: Mutuku

texts.en:
Mutuku is 63 years old, married to Mueni, and has five children. He has been rearing chickens for sale for the last two years, earning a monthly income of Kes 10,000.

He is requesting his first loan with KADET Ltd of Kes 20,000. He will use the funds to buy more chicks and  poultry feed. With the anticipated profits he will expand the flock.

His hope and dream is to become a large-scale poultry farmer.

loans.use: To buy more chickens and poultry feed.

loans.name: Toris

texts.en:
Toris runs a small stall selling snacks and mobile phone airtime credits. She lives north of Bogor, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta.  Toris is married and living with four people in the family home. 

Toris began working with Ruma two months ago because of the good services.  She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. As the business continues to run, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Nartekie

texts.en:
Nartekie is 55 years old and is married with four children and five grandchildren. She is into the sachet water business and has been in business for six years. She supplies other retailers with the cold water for resale at bus stations when the weather is very hot. The income she earns is used to support her children for the payment of her grandchildren's school fees. 
Nartekie has a deep freezer which she has been using for the sachet water business for the past six years, but it has developed a fault, and she needs to replace it. Due to this, she has resorted to her old fridge, which is not able to store enough water for her business. With this loan, she will be able to buy a new deep freezer which will help sell more water, increase her income and help her expand her business in the years to come.

loans.use: to buy a deep freezer and sell sachet water to support her family.

loans.name: Suria

texts.en: Day by day increasing expenditures compelled Suria  to initiate her own business selling animals. She is 44 years old, married woman doing business  with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of 7 children. She is working very hard for providing her family with the basic necessities of life. She has requested a loan of 45000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount  to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater more customers. She is confident that she can further expand her business with the help of future loans

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater more customers

loans.name: Kalib

texts.en:
Kalib lives in Salyan region Yenikend village.He is married, has 3 children. He has his own food market. He has been engaged in this business for 20 years. 
He borrowed the loan amount of $400 to buy the   foodstuffs. The borrowed second loan $600 he spent to increase the foodstuffs in his market. The third time he borrowed the loan amount of $900 and bought the manufactured goods 
( light industry ). 
He applies for the loan of $1850 to be engaged in selling the wholesale trade and retailing the foodstuffs and the manufactured goods 
( light industry ).

loans.use: Expand his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Lucy Wanjiru Mwangi intends to develop her farm through purchase of organic manure and animal feeds for her dairy cows

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is an elderly widow born in 1950. She has a daughter and two sons who have given her nine grandchildren, as well as a younger son who is in secondary school in the nearby city of Kakamega. Sarah started her business in 2002, which includes selling cereals, fruits and vegetables. She does her business in the community’s local trading center on the market days of Sunday and Thursday and out of her home the rest of the time.

She is an active member of PEMCI and she has completed her first loan successfully. This first loan enabled her to increase her stock so that whereas she was selling cereals only, now she has been able to include fruits and vegetables in her stock. She was able to pay her loan promptly and she wishes to get a second loan from PEMCI. With the proposed loan, Sarah plans to not only increase her stock of cereals during this coming harvesting season, but to possibly open and cook for a small food stall on a busy junction road. One day she hopes to even build small houses to rent. She has been able to bring services to the community through her business, and hopes to be able to make a greater profit to help her pay school fees for her youngest son and grandchildren.

loans.use: To increase her stock of cereals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new freezer for her business

loans.name: Armandina

texts.es:
Armandina is married and has 3 children. Her husband is living on a pension, which is paid irregularly and takes a long time to reach them. Due to this situation with his slow pension payments, they have gone through very difficult times. Out of necessity, Armandina began to sell their used clothing (which hadn't been used in two years), in order to help her husband with the children's school expenses and the expenses of their home. Armandina knew many friends who were also experiencing difficult times, who suggested to her that she should venture into the sale of used shoes as well as used clothing.

Armandina is requesting a loan of $375 US, in order to buy merchandise so that she can offer more variety to her customers. She hopes to re-pay this loan within 6 months, and appreciates any help we can give her so that she can improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Armandina es casada y tiene tres hijos, su esposo es pensionado y tardo un buen tiempo en llegarle la pensión pasando momentos muy duros se vio en la necesidad de empezar a vender ropa que ya no usaba hace dos años atrás, para poder ayudar a su esposo en los estudios de sus tres hijos y los gastos del hogar, sabiendo sus amigas que estaba pasando por momentos muy difíciles le comentaron de la posibilidad de vender calzado con todo su esfuerzo se animo a vender el calzado y ropa al mismo tiempo.

Armandina solicita un préstamo por US $ 375 para comprar mercadería y brindar más variedad a sus clientes, ella ofrece pagar el préstamo en 6 meses y les agradece el apoyo que puedan dar para que pueda tener una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: Loan will be used to purchase additional merchandise in order to sustain her business.

loans.name: Hermenegildo Javier

texts.es:
Mr. Javier H., as a young boy, always showed a great ability to build things, and then as a young man worked to refine his craft. With great effort he's turned into a great master builder.

With his hard work, he has been able to provide a good quality of life for his family and the benefit of education for their 5 children, who already have their own homes and share their sorrows and dreams outside the family.

And even now at 53 years old, he continues to work for his beloved wife, Luzmila, who recently had to undergo emergency surgery due to a problem with her uterus. This situation, coupled with his age, has also greatly affected his health. He had thought that planting coffee, which is experiencing a boom at present, would serve to bring in additional income, and would help with his wife's recovery expenses, as well as his own health concerns.

With your support we can help this married couple raise their quality of life and health and help them stay happy and healthy longer.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Don Javier H., mostró siempre desde niño una gran habilidad para la construcción, ya de joven se esforzó para perfeccionarla y con mucho esfuerzo llegó a convertirse en un gran maestro constructor. Con esta actividad durante mucho tiempo les ha otorgado a los miembros de su familia una buena calidad de vida y educación a sus cinco hijos, quienes ya tienen sus propios hogares y comparten sus penas y anhelos fuera del seno familiar. Sin embargo aún a sus 53 años, continúa esforzándose por su amada esposa, Luzmila, quién recientemente tuvo que ser operada de urgencia por un problema en el útero. Toda esta realidad sumada a su edad, ha perjudicado grandemente su propia salud. Por lo que ha pensado incursionar en el cultivo del café, que está teniendo un gran auge en la actualidad. Este nuevo reto le permitirá solventar los gastos de recuperación de su esposa y asimismo le ayudará a incrementar el nivel de su salud. Con vuestro importante apoyo podremos ayudar a esta trabajadora pareja de esposos a incrementar su calidad de vida y salud para que permanezcan juntos por mucho tiempo más.

loans.use:
Additional capital in order to start a new business.

Inyección de capital para iniciar un nuevo negocio.

loans.name: Estervina

texts.en:
Estervina, untiring and hardworking, runs a beauty salon within her house. She has a lot of experiences as entrepreneur since she has been doing that business for more than fifteen years. Estervina and her husband have four children, three of them girls. They all have finished secondary school.

Estervina´s beauty salon is well known in the community, and each two days she receives visits from a lot of customers that use her services.  Hair straightening and hair dying are some of her specialities.  Local women like to go to her salon because of her kindness and great abilities.

The entrepreneur envisions her beauty salon becoming very big salon with many more customers.  She also wants to hire a girl to help in the business so that she can run the salon six days a week.  The loan requested will help Estervina achieve that goals and will help hair maintain a comfortable lifestyle for her family.

loans.use: To buy products that are running down in the beauty salon.

loans.name: Nurasih

texts.en: Nurasih is 27 years old and has a daughter. Her husband, E., is a public transportation 'angkot' driver who earns US$2 a day. To earn extra income for the family, Nurasih opened a booth where she sells food and beverages, and is now earning US$7 a day. The business has been growing very fast since she became a member of MBK. Nurasih is asking for a loan of US$125 to buy more goods for sale. She promises to repay the loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Purchase of goods for sale

loans.name: Bakha

texts.en: Bakha has been in the business of selling clothes for three years. This young man was born in 1985 and is single. He lives in the town of Khachmaz. He is requesting a loan of $725 to buy additional clothing to sell in his business.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Busanzi. A. North E Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Eseza K.. She is currently in the business of retail shop and is requesting a loan to add in stock. Eseza is 31 years old and is married. She has 6 children ranging from age 2 to 10 and her children go to school. Each week, Eseza makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy goats for rearing

Eseza is joined in her small group by Marita N., Beatrice N., Esther N., and Serina A.. Marita N. has a business in selling cabbages and wants to add in business. Beatrice N. is currently operating a business in fish selling and wants a loan to increase purchases. Esther N. operates a business of tomatoe sales and wants to expand business. Serina A. is currently in the business of fish selling and is requesting a loan to increase inventory.

loans.use: To increase stock in retail shop and expand business

loans.name: Percibal

texts.es:
“In the projects where I live the houses are publicly subsidized. If you can tell by the picture, houses are built one right next to the other, only separated by an exterior hallway. I would like to build fences to make my house safer, as presently it can be easily broken into, and I don’t want to expose my family. I am requesting $400 to build the fences.”

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

“En el fraccionamiento donde vivo las casas son de interés social. Si se dan cuenta por la foto, las casas están pegadas una con la otra y solo las divide un pasillo. Me gustaría levantar las bardas para darle más seguridad a mi vivienda, ya que por cualquier parte se pueden meter y no quiero exponer a mi familia. Solicito 400 dólares para levantar las bardas del patio de mi vivienda.”

loans.use: Build a fence in the backyard of my house.

loans.name: Marat

texts.en:
Marat is married with one daughter. He and his family live in Kherson. Marat is a private entrepreneur who sells sports footwear in the central city market. Marat is very disciplined. One of his strong characteristics is his ability to listen and persuade which helps him in his work with customers. Marat has been in the market for 10 years. Today he has about $3000 invested in his business.  

Marat‘s main goal is to provide his family with a decent life and stable future. He has always tried to achieve financial and economic independence and make a career. Marat is hoping to see his business flourish and succeed. He believes this loan of 2500 Grivnas will be one of the steps towards his goal. Marat has repaid 12 previous loans to Nadiya Ukraine without any delinquencies.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of inventory

loans.name: Lucinda Vasco

texts.pt:
Lucinda is 41 years old, married, and the mother of a 25 year old daughter who is taking a nursing course in the capital of Maputo. Lucinda married her husband after her first fiance went to South Africa and never returned. She lives in her own home with her husband, two step sons, and one nephew, and her daughter is in Maputo.

Lucinda is a native of the province of Gaza and moved to Namaacha with her husband when he was transferred with his work. Because it is a mountainous region and on the border with Swaziland they decided to stay permanently in this area. Lucinda studied through the 4th grade and stopped due to the difficult financial condition of her family.

She has been a trader for many years having decided to start a business to help her husband with the household expenses. She has a stand in the front yard of her home and works from 7:00am until 7:00pm. The products with the most sell-through are the basic necessities like rice, peanuts, beans, and corn flour.

Lucinda has a monthly income of approximately 2,000MTn. Through a neighbor who is already a client, Lucinda discovered Hluvuku. As her money for moving stock was low, she contacted Hluvuku to solicit this loan for 25,000MTn with which she will grow the volume of her business. The primary objectives are to improve her business and enlarge her stand. In the future Lucinda would like to see her daughter and her step sons enrolled in college, and she would like to expand her home to make her family more comfortable.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Lucinda tem 41 anos de idade, é casada e mãe de uma filha de 25 anos de idade que freqüenta um curso de enfermagem na capital Maputo. Lucinda se casou com o atual marido depois que seu primeiro noivo foi para a África do Sul e nunca mais retornou. Lucinda vive em sua própria casa com o marido, dois enteados e um sobrinho, dado que sua filha mora em Maputo. Lucinda é natural da província de Gaza, e mudou-se para Namaacha com o marido, que foi transferido no trabalho. Por ser uma região montanhosa e na fronteira com a Swazilandia, decidiram fixar-se definitivamente nesta zona. Lucinda estudou somente ate a 4a classe e parou devido a difícil condição financeira de sua família. Lucinda é comerciante faz muitos anos, decidiu abrir um negocio para ajudar o marido com as despesas de casa. Ela tem uma barraca no quintal em frente a sua casa e trabalha das 7:00 horas as 19:00 horas. Os produtos com mais saída são os de necessidade básica, como arroz, amendoim, feijão e farinha de milho. Lucinda tem um lucro mensal de aproximadamente MTn 2,000. Através de uma vizinha que já é cliente, Lucinda soube da existência da Hluvuku. Como o dinheiro para a movimentação do estoque era baixo, contatou a Hluvuku para solicitar este empréstimo no valor de MTn 25,000 com qual vai aumentar o volume do seu negocio. Os objetivos primários de Lucinda são melhorar o seu negocio e ampliar a sua barraca. No futuro Lucinda gostaria de ver sua filha e seus enteados formados na faculdade e também gostaria de ampliar a sua casa para dar mais conforto a sua família.

loans.use: Purchase goods to restock her store

loans.name: Kumrikhon

texts.en:
S. Kumrikhon is 47 years old. She is married with four children, and one of her sons is pictured here in her place. Because of a difficult living condition and the fact that her husband left for Russia to earn a higher income, Kumrikhon is facing hard financial times. She currently sells produce and fruits in the local village market, and has been doing so for the past six years.

Every morning at 5 AM Kumrikhon purchases vegetables from local farmers, and sells them wholesale at the market. She is well known not only for her good service, but also her fair prices. Because of this, she is able to generate a steady income and help support her family.

Kumrikhon would like to borrow $450 in order to expand and maintain her business. She has had an excellent loan history in the past, and is sure that she can repay her credit in 12 months.

loans.use: Increasing of the range of fruits and vegetables for selling

loans.name: Un

texts.en: Un C. is a 38-year-old mother of six living in the Siem Reap province in northern Cambodia. She and her husband, Sean Teung, make a living by selling a traditional Khmer noodle dish from a food stand. To grow her business, Un has applied for a loan of $850 to buy a noodle-making machine. She believes that the machine will be an investment and will help her reach more customers. She hopes to use the additional profit to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a noodle-making machine for a food stand

loans.name: Nary

texts.en:
Mrs. Nary S., 25, is a single mom with one son. She has eight brothers and sisters. Currently she lives with her parents in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Nary has been a hairdresser for one year, a skill she learned from a beauty salon school in Phnom Penh city. After finishing her skills training, she rented one shop near a market in Phnom Penh to operate her business. Her business is running so well because many customers come to her shop. For almost one year, Nary has saved some money to buy her own shop but still lacks part of the amount. Therefore, Nary is requesting a loan of $1200 to add to her own money to buy a beauty salon shop.

loans.use: To add to her own money to buy a beauty shop.

loans.name: Fezret

texts.en: Fezret A. is a 52-year-old butcher. He is married and has three children. Fezret started his business in 1995 and since that time he has gained the respect of his permanent clients. He runs his business in the heart of the central bazaar. Every day local farmers bring him livestock for meat, but Fezret’s working day finishes too fast because he sells all the meat in about four hours. Fezret wants to improve his financial situation by purchasing more meat each day. To do this, he needs more funds, so he is applying for a loan of $1200 USD. You can be a helping hand to Fezret’s business.

loans.use: To buy meat

loans.name: Avancemos Juntas Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal Avancemos Juntas esta ubicado en el departamento D. Huancavelica, en L. comunidad D. Yauli, esta es una zona muy hermosa con paisajes muy hermosos y zonas turísticas como Tintay panco, Incañan, Bosque D. las piedras (qampata), sopa D. piedras en Ambato. Las vestimentas son D. muchos colores D. los Chopcca Las actividades principales D. L. comunidad son L. agricultura, se produce papa, cebolL., trigo, olluco, en L. ganadería, pequeña cantidad ganado vacuno porcino, vino ente otros.

Teresa A., elL. es analfabeta vive en una casa muy pequeña, es Padre y Madre para sus tres hijas D. 15, 28 y 20 años, que estudian en el tecnológico. Ha pasado su vida tejiendo medias y chalinas, Su mayor dificultad es un accidente que tuvo pasteando sus cabras, se cayo del cerro y se rompió el brazo por lo cual no pudo continuar tejiendo, su negocio bajo y elL. necesita el dinero para que sus hijas estudien. Con el apoyo D. FINCA Peru logró conseguir un préstamo y con L. ayuda D. su promotora salió adelante, le gusta FINCA Peru por que encuentra mucha a alegría en las promotoras y socias, ha aprendido ahorrar y confiar en otros. Su sueño es lograr que sus hijas sean profesionales y que saquen su titulo. Teresa va invertir el préstamo en comprar más mercadería como lanas y darle trabajo a su vecina para que teja medias y chalinas

L. M., es casada con tres hijos pequeños D. 2 meses, 6 y 8 años, vive en casa D. su madre. L. tiene negocio D. venta D. gasolina y trasporte D. ómnibus entre Huancavelica y Yauli y alrededor D. su pueblo, con sus prestamos y ahorros compro un ómnibus D. segunda que estaba en oferta, L. es socia antigua D. Finca. Los problemas que elL. enfrenta son que su mamá le dió parálisis facial y estuvo a punto D. morir y con sus ahorros pudo ayudarL.. ElL. obtuvo un préstamo D. 500 nuevos soles D. Finca Perú va invertir su dinero comprando llantas traseras y gata para su trasporte. Su sueño es comprar su casa propia y para ello esta ahorrando.

Rebeca T., es casada con cuatro hijos D. 6, 9, 11, 12, todos estudiando en el colegio, gracias a Dios no tiene mayores dificultades. Empezó este nuevo negocio con el préstamo D. 200 nuevos soles D. Finca Perú D. venta D. lanas y cahuas D. lanas, donD. aprendí ahorrar, me capacitaron, ahora soy mujer D. bien, apoyo a mis cuñadas que se han quedado solas. Va invertir su dinero comprando más lanas D. Huncayo. Su sueño es comprar una remalladota, y mas telares, tener una tienda D. lanas, sintética y naturales.
texts.en:
"Bancomunal Avancemos Juntas" is located in the department of Huancavelica, in the community of Yauli. This is a beautiful region with very pretty scenery and tourist areas such as Tintay Panco, Incañan, Bosque D. las Piedras (qampata), and Sopa D. Piedras in Ambato. The garments of the Chopcca are multicolored. The main activity of the community is farming (potato, onion, wheat, olluco) and a small quantity of cattle, pigs, and sheep among others.

Teresa A. is illiterate and lives in a very small house, she is father and mother to her three daughters, 15, 28, and 20 years old who study in the technological institute. All her life she has woven stockings and shawls, but due to an accident she had hearding sheep when she fell from a hill and broke her arm, she could not continue weaving and her business did not go well, and she needed the money so her daughters could study. With the support of FINCA Peru she got a loan and with the help of her promoter she moved ahead. She likes FINCA Peru because she finds much happiness with the promoters and partners. She has learned to save money and to have faith in others. It is her dream that her daughters become professionals and graduate. Teresa will invest the loan in buying more merchandise such as wool and offer work to her neighbor weaving stockings and shawls.

L. M. is married with three children, 2 months, 6 and 8 years old. She lives in her mother's house. L. sells gasoline and bus transportation between Huancavelica and Yauli and around the village. With her loans and savings she bought a second-hand bus which was on sale. L. is an old partner of Finca. Her problem is that her mother had a facial paralysis and almost passed away but her savings helped her. She got a loan of 500 nuevos soles from Finca Peru. The money will be invested in buying back tires and a jack for her bus. It is her dream to buy her own house and therefore she is saving money.

Rebeca T. is married with four children, 6, 9, 11, and 12 years old, all in school with no major difficulty. She started this new business with a loan of 200 nuevos soles from Finca Peru selling wool garments and wool shirts. She learned to save money and prepared to become a good woman helping her sisters-in-law who are on their own. The money will be invested in buying more wool products in Huncayo. Her dream is to purchase a sewing machine and more looms, and to have a store selling synthetic and natural wool,

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The 21 partners will invest in their businesses.

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es: Zoraida tiene 24 años de edad, es conviviente, vive con su esposo y su hija. Su esposo trabaja en la mina, en horas de la mañana ella se dedica sus quehaceres del hogar, pero en horas de la tarde vende productos de belleza a sus clientes que son las mujeres. Empezó a vender estos productos por recomendación de una amiga, quien la motivó a que ingresara a este negocio hace 8 meses, hasta el momento le esta yendo muy bien porque tiene sus clientas muy puntuales en sus pagos, lo difícil para ella que tiene una nena de 9 meses y eso le dificulta caminar y promocionar sus productos, está esperando a que crezca su hija para que trabaje con mayor comodidad. Este es su 5to préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. El dinero será invertido en la compra de más productos de belleza, para incrementar su stock y así le deje un margen de ganancia  mucho mayor.
texts.en:
Zoraida is 24 years old, she is married common-law, and she lives with her husband and daughter. Her husband works in the mine. In the morning hours she does all the house work and in the afternoons she sells beauty products to her clients, all of whom are women. She started selling these products following a friend's suggestion, she motivated her to invest in this business for 8 months. Up to date it has gone very well because she has good clients who are always on time with their payments. The hardest part ofr her is that she has a little 9-mohth old baby, making it hard for her to work and promote her products. She is waiting for her little girl to grow up so that she could work with greater ease. This is the 5th loan she has with Microfinanzas Prisma (Kiva Field Partner). The funds will be invested in the purchase of more beauty products, to supplement her stock and to increase her profit margin.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the quantities of beauty products she sells.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua D. is the mother of four children. She turned fifty last month and she lives with her husband and the children at Atebubu in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. The major occupation of the people is farming through which they derive their daily income to care for their families.

Akua is innovative and pro-active when it comes to business. She was once a farmer who was into the sale of cereals, but she realized that she could divest or venture into a more viable area to generate more income to support her family. So she decided to use the proceeds from her farm business to start her new business: the sale of clothing.

Akua travels to Togo, a nearby country, to purchase her goods. She says it is comparatively cheap to buy in Togo. She has been selling things like linens, clothes, and lace, etc. for six years now. She has a niche market and concentrates on the surrounding villages rather than serving the entire market. There are no competitors for her now, she says. And her reason is that she has not concentrated on the whole market so that competitors would monitor her.

Akua is requesting the loan to buy more materials so as to avoid frequent trips, due to the risk involved. She wants to make more income to provide a better education to enhance her kids' future career. She is a member of a group called ‘The living God’ Trust Group. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan. Akua does not sell on group meeting days and her picture was taken during her group meeting. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: to buy ready-made clothing like lace, linens and clothes to restock her inventory

loans.name: Pai

texts.en: Pai R. is one of the vegetables vendors in a busy market in Siem Reap province and earns US$ 4 to $5 in profit a day. Her husband and her mother both are living with her. Her husband is self-employed as a moto-taxi driver. On average, he makes US$ 15 in revenue a day. Pai R. is asking for a loan of US$ 700 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to use to operate a taxi.

loans.use: To operate a moto-taxi

loans.name: Kimsrean

texts.en: Mrs. Kimsrean C. is a villager in Ty Muoy village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a fish seller. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more fish to resell to earn more profits. Her husband, Mr. Thang Hak, is a policeman. Mrs. Kimsrean C. is 56 years old mother of three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other is a motor taxi driver.

loans.use: Purchasing more fish to resell.

loans.name: Rohat

texts.ru: Рохат Рахматова  1956 года рождения замужем, имеет 4 детей. С Микроинвест сотрудничает с 2002 года. Раньше брала кредит с группой. Теперь расширила свою аптеку и ассортимент медикаментов. Ей нравиться работать  фармацевтом, так как она помогает людям, консультирует прием лекарств. В прошлом году из-за суровой зимы , было много клиентов, она продала лекарства на большую сумму. В этом году ее продажа   стабильная.
texts.en:
Rohat R. was born in 1956, she is married with four children. She has been with MicroInvest since 2002. She used to take out group loans. Now she has expanded her pharmacy and the variety of medicine. She likes working as a pharmacist because she helps people and consults them on how to take the medicine. Last year because of a harsh winter she had many customers and she sold medicine in large amounts. This year her sales are stable.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Angela Presciliana

texts.es:
La señora Ángela Presciliana B. B. tiene 49 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de la Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió hasta el 3° de secundaria, tiene 4 hijos los cuales dependen económicamente de ella. 
Ángela B. se dedica a la venta de menú, tiene un pequeño ambiente de su domicilio destinado a la venta de su negocio, al inicio tenía pocos comensales, por lo que decidió salir a ofrecer su menú a diversas establecimientos que se encuentran alrededor de su negocio, empezando a trabajar con pedidos, actualmente vende su menú en su negocio y a domicilio.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco comunal “Luis Alberto Sánchez II”, lo invirtió en la compra de accesorios de cocina, arreglos de sillas entre otros y compra de víveres.
Con el crédito de 600 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de víveres y neceseres de cocina, para su negocio.
Angela tiene como sueño, alquilar un local para ampliar su negocio y seguir cocinando, también para compromisos.
texts.en:
Ángela Presciliana B. B. is 49 years old, lives in the Moche District, Trujillo province in the Libertad Department, Peru. She didn't finish high school and has 4 children who depend on her financially.

Angela is in the food business and sells meals. She has a space in her house from which she runs her business. At first she had few customers, so she went out to the businesses around hers, looking for customers and she began taking their orders. Currently, she sells her meals at her business and delivers.

With the first loan of 300 Soles (3 Soles = $1USD, approx.) that she received from the Communal Bank “Luis Alberto Sánchez II”, she bought kitchen accessories, fixed chairs and bought food.

With this loan of 600 Soles, which she will repay in 4 months, she'll invest in groceries and kitchen necessities for her business.

Angela's dream is to rent a place to expand her business and continue cooking.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries and kitchen necessities.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es: Su actividad de la Sra. Nieves es la venta de comida tradicional boliviana por ejemplo Fricase de cerdo que consiste en carne de cerdo, chuño que es la papa deshidratada, y mote o maíz cocido.   los fines de semana en una de las calles de su barrio cerca de la cancha donde se aglomera mucha gente a observar los partidos de fútbol que hay en la zona que esta ubicado en la ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz,  ella vende desde hace 8 años con la ayuda del esposo quien ayuda a la economía de la familia con la compra y venta de vehículos a medio uso,  tienen una pequeña niña en edad escolar . El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de utensilios de cocina como ser ollas grandes, platos de fierro enlosado etc, y otra parte lo invertirá en la compra de productos por cantidad por ejemplo el chuño que  se  puede guardar el tiempo que sea necesario ya que no se hecha a perder.
texts.en:
Nieves sells traditional Bolivian food. For example, she sells “Fricase” of pork, which is made of pork, “chuño” (dehydrated potato), and “mote” (cooked corn). She sells on week ends on one of her neighborhood streets, near the field where a lot of people gather to watch soccer games. This is located in her zone on the west side of the city of La Paz. She has been selling for 8 years. Her husband helps with the family economy by buying and selling second-hand vehicles. They have a young, school aged daughter. The loan will be used to buy kitchen utensils like big pots, glazed cast iron plates, etc. The other part of the loan will be used to buy products in bulk; for example “chuño” can be stored for a long period of time without spoiling.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cups and glasses

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es: Santiago tiene 30 años, vive con sus padres y sus hermanos en casa de sus padres. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la fabricación de muebles trabajando en su propio taller de carpintería con la ayuda de su hermano menor que es su mano derecha, gracias a ello puede cumplir a tiempo con los pedidos que le solicitan. Trabaja en su taller todos los días excepto los domingos y por la constancia y buena calidad que ofrece está creciendo en la demanda de sus servicios, esto lo llena de satisfacción, ya que le permite disponer libremente de ganancias para apoyar a sus padres y hermanos. El deseo de Santiago es producir mayor cantidad de muebles que le permitan mayores ganancias y expandir sus horizontes de ventas para forjar una empresa sólida. Esta es la primera vez que viene solicitando un préstamo con MFP, fue invitado a pertenecer a  su actual banco comunal, además tiene un buen concepto de la ayuda solidaria y del trabajo que se realiza, por su parte, se compromete a ser uno de los socios más activos de su grupo. El dinero que requiere lo usará en la compra de madera y telas para el tapizado de los muebles, así como más instrumentos y herramientas para implementar su taller.
texts.en:
Santiago is 30 years old. He lives with his parents and siblings at his parents' house. He's been manufacturing furniture for four years at his own carpentry shop with the help of his younger brother. Thanks to his brother, who is his right hand, he is able to complete the clients' requests on time. Santiago works at his shop every day except Sunday. The consistency and quality of his work has attracted more demand for his services. This increase in demand fills him with satisfaction because he can use his income to help his parents and siblings. Santiago wishes to produce a larger quantity of furniture in order to increment his earnings and expand his sales horizon to forge a solid enterprise. This is the first time Santiago asks for a a loan with MFP. He was invited to belong to his current communal bank and he has a good concept of solidarity. He also knows a lot about his work and is committed to be one of the most active members of his group. He is requesting the loan to purchase wood and fabric for the furniture's tapestry. He also wants to acquire more tools for use at his shop.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for manufacturing furniture

loans.name: Prescilla

texts.en: Prescilla C. is a resident of Hinaplanon, Claveria, Misamis Oriental, in Southern Philippines. She has five children. She and her husband work as fish vendors; they use their motor vehicle to peddle fishes to nearby villages. They also have a small stall in Claveria public market for their established consumers. They desire to expand their existing business to earn more profit. Prescilla is hence availing a loan of PHP 6,000 with a repayment term of five months.

loans.use: additional capital for fish selling business

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
H. Nguyễn Thị is a 36-year-old female living in the town of Mê Linh. She is married and has three school-age children. To make a living, H. raises livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. H. has been engaged in this business for more than years and earns approximately 3000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2006, H. joined TYM Fund, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to build shelter for the borrower's livestock. H. is now requesting a new loan of 10000000 VND, which will be used to purchase breeding livestock.  The will be the fifth loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Soun

texts.en:
Soun T. is age 50 and the mother of four children. Two are married and live separately, while the others are single and are still living at home.

Soun T. is a mobile fish-seller, and is earning around of $3 income a day to meet her family’s expenses. In addition, her husband works building wooden houses.

Soun T. owns a pond that she has been digging for a year. Right now, she hopes to raise fish in her pond during this time when fish are commanding the highest price. Due to the lack of capital to do so, she has decided to seek a loan from Kiva to purchase small fish to breed.

loans.use: To purchase small fish to breed in her pond

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Don Julio N. reside en el barrio dolores  en el Municipio de Carazo, tiene 52 años, casado y su esposa le tiene dos hijos que estudian, su meta es pode terminar de hacer su casa mas amplia ya que es muy pequeña. El se desempeña como auxiliar contable en la Alcaldía. Con este préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar materiales de construcción para hacer un cuarto y poder tener privacidad. Da las gracias Afodenic por los beneficios.
texts.en:
Don Julio N. lives in the Dolores neighborhood in the city of Carazo. He is 52 years old, married, and has two children who are students. His goal is to finish adding more living space to his tiny house. He works as an assistant accountant at City Hall. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy construction materials to build an additional room for more privacy. He thanks AFODENIC for providing these benefits.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to finish a room

loans.name: Joylyn

texts.en:
Joylyn A. is from the village of Taglimao, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 23 years old. Joylyn is married and has 3 very young children. To make a living, Joylyn owns and operates a variety (sari-sari) store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling variety products in the local community. Joylyn has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In February 2009, Joylyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joylyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Joylyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase needed products for sale. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Joylyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory

location.town: Taglimao, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Luz Y Progreso Group

texts.en:
Elba M. M. (far right, second row) is the group coordinator for the Bank of Hope: Luz y Progreso (light and progress).

Elba owns her own beauty salon, which she operates out of her house. With this loan, she will be able to purchase more shampoo, conditioner, and other hair products so she can better meet the demands of her clients. Like many of Esperanza’s clients, Elba is a single mother and the sole breadwinner for her household. She looks forward to a brighter future of more stability and peace.

Following the Grameen model of microfinance, Esperanza primarily lends to groups. Thus, if one person in the group defaults, the others in the group are responsible. It is important that all members of the group know and trust each other. This community of women has an advantage in that they already know each other well and trust one another. Since they have this strong foundation, they can build from there, talking and planning about how to improve their businesses. As the coordinator, Elba is responsible for facilitating these conversations and making sure that all the women properly use their loans. 

On behalf of Elba, the Bank of Hope: Luz y Progreso, and the microfinance institute Esperanza International, thank you for providing opportunities for those who need them most.

loans.use: To buy more hair products including shampoo and conditioner

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en: Beauty is 33 year old she is divorcee and mother of fourteen year daughter. She lives with her child. Currently her child is in the junior high school at the community educational complex. She works very hard as a single mother in providing for her child. She is a local manufacturer of Soaps for two years now. She combines materials like palm oil, soda powder, cocoa pods and coconut oil to obtain her soaps. She is not able to produce in large quantities for lack of funds. She wants to take advantage of the loan facility to buy more raw materials and processing equipment to scale up production. She hopes to raise improved income to support her children education. It is her desire to provide quality education to the children and she would be grateful for that support.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials like palm oil, soda powder, cocoa pods and coconut oil etc.

loans.name: María Esmeralda

texts.es:
María es una madre de familia de 28 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos en el distito de Santa Rosa, ubicado a 25 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
 
Su esposo se dedica a la pesca de anchoveta, pero debido a las contínuas temporadas de veda, ella se vio en la necesidad de trabajar, fue entonces cuando empezó a distribuir pescado a los comerciantes de la región.
 
María y su esposo van a los puertos de Pimentel, San José y eventualmente a la caleta La Cruz (en la región Tumbes, ubicada a seis horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo) para comprar pescado fresco a los pescadores que recién están desembarcando, luego lo transportan hacia el terminal pesquero ECOPHINSA (el principal terminal pesquero de la región) y  lo venden a los comerciantes de la zona.
 
Anteriormente, con las ganancias de su negocio creó una pequeña bodega – tienda en su casa con la que también se ganaba el sustento diario, pero su esposo en uno de sus viajes a Tumbes enfermó gravemente de dengue y ella tuvo que invertir el poco dinero que tenía para pagar su tratamiento, desde entonces no ha tenido oportunidad de mantener ni implementar la bodega.
 
Ahora que su esposo se ha recuperado ella se encuentra trabajando con muchas ganas para seguir saliendo adelante, tiene planeado comprar más mercadería para hacer crecer su negocio de distribución de pescado y poder comprar sus propias cubetas (cajas para guardar pescado) ya que las que usa por ahora son alquiladas, por este motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1300 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
 
María sueña con poder terminar de construir su casa e implementar su bodega, sus vecinos dan muy buenas referencias de ella, la consideran todo un ejemplo ya que supo salir adelante a pesar de la enfermedad de su esposo.
texts.en:
María is a 28-year-old mother who lives with her husband and four children in the Santa Rosa district, located 25 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Her husband dedicates himself to fishing for anchovies but, due to the times the anchovy fishing season was closed, she saw the need to work. It was at this time that she started to distribute fish to the merchants of the area. María and her husband travel to the Pimentel and San José harbors and, eventually, to the La Cruz cove (in the Tumbes region, located six hours from the city of Chiclayo) to buy fresh fish from the fishermen just off their boats. They then transport their fish to the ECOPHINSA fishing terminal (the primary fishing terminal of the region) and sell them to the dealers of the area. Previously, with earnings from her business, she started a small general store in her house that also generated income for their daily living needs. However, her husband fell gravely ill with dengue fever on one of his visits to Tumbes. She used the little money she had to pay for his treatment and, since then, she hasn’t been able to maintain or stock her store. Now that her husband has recovered, she finds herself working with great enthusiasm to get ahead. She plans to buy more products to help her fish distribution business to grow and to buy her own tanks (containers to store fish), since currently she rents them by the hour. For this reason, she finds herself approaching Edpyme Alternativa for the first time to request a loan of 1,300 soles to help her reach her goals. María’s dreams include finishing the building of her house and stocking her store. Her neighbors provide very good references for her, and consider her a good example since she was able to forge ahead despite her husband’s illness.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fresh fish to sell.

loans.name: Marben

texts.en: Marben is married to Rose and they were gifted with a daughter named Marrian-7 days old. Marben is a maker of stove made of cement and some of it was made of can.  According to him, he would like to continue improving and developing it so he can encourage more costumer to buy his product.  With this, he is asking to avail a loan amounting to PHP5,000 from the KIVA lenders.  The amount will be used to buy the necessary materials she needed in making stove.

loans.use: Additional capital for business development

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela A. is from the village of Lower Dicayas. She is 51 years old. Carmela is married and has 3 children. Two of her children are adults and the youngest is school-aged.  To make a living, Carmela raises and sells pigs. Carmela has been engaged in her business for over 5 years with an approximate average monthly earnings of 3,000 PHP from these activities.

In 2008, Carmela joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmela has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Carmela is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase grocery stocks for her sari-sari store business.Carmela manages pig raising and a sari-sari store at home for an income. This will be Carmela's 3rd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions and support her children education. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase grocery stocks for the  business

loans.name: Rozel

texts.en:
“If you have patience, you will survive” is an inspiring quotation shared by Rozel from the village of Paniki, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Anthony and they are blessed with two children. As parents, they want their children to finish their college education and find a good job someday. They endure hardships and difficulties to earn income and provide for the needs of their children and family.  

As a way of gaining income, her husband cultivates their farm twice a year by planting rice and vegetables. Aside from that, they also buy and sell animals like carabaos, cows, goats, pigs and others. They want to continue this business since it is beneficial to them but they need business capital.  Therefore, they decided to seek financial assistance from the KIVA lenders with a loan of PHP9,000.00.  This amount will help them buy additional animals that they can sell later on.  They hope that with this financial assistance, they can improve their business.

loans.use: To buy animals to sell.

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en: Nidal is a 30-year-old single man. He has owned a school bus since 2008. He presents his transportation services to the children in neighboring villages. Today Nidal is asking to borrow $1,200 to perform maintenance and security on the bus.

loans.use: To perform maintenance and security on his bus

loans.name: Altin

texts.en: Altin D. is 55 years old and lives with her two children in Bayan-Ulgii Province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a "ger," which is a yurt, or traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her oldest daughter is 25 years old and helps with the family business, and her youngest, age 21, is a university student. Altin sells clothing business in her town. She started her business in 2001 after working as a salesperson for a private company. She has made progress with her business over the years and has found success ever since her oldest daughter started helping her after graduating high school. When Altin first started business, times were rough and she was unable to cover her daughter's school tuition fees. However, today, her earnings are stable and her daughter is able to continue her education. Altin is focused on the future and is working hard to keep up with her fast growing customer base. She is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug (~$2100 USD) loan to import clothes from China to sell in her business. About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: Kiva Lending Team - XacBank-Mongolia. To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click: Mongolian Borrowers on Kiva.

loans.use: To import clothes from Chine to resell

loans.name: Merasol

texts.en:
Merasol D. is from the village of Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro. She is 30 years old. Merasol is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Merasol owns & operates a retail store where she buys and sells coconut in the local community. Merasol has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Merasol joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merasol is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Merasol from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Melida Victoria

texts.es:
Melida M. de 54 años, vive en una casa de cemento con agua y luz como servicios básicos su vivienda esta ubicada en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, esta casada pero su esposo es incapacitado tiene con el 3 hijos solo uno estudia en la universidad leyes.

Melida comenzó a los 26 años aprendiendo a coser así poco a poco lo hizo un medio para vivir. Ahora ella con los ingresos que tiene ayuda a sus hijos en los gastos, trabaja todos los días pero no tiene horario fijo por lo que trabaja en su casa. Una de las mayores complicaciones son los racionamientos de electricidad y tiene que esperar para trabajar en la noche.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar tela, flecos y otros implementos para la costura y poder tener más variedad. En el futuro quiere tener su propia empresa de costura con muchas maquinas.
texts.en:
Melida M. is 54. She lives in a cement house with basic water and electricity that is located on the edge of Guayaquil. She is married but her husband is disabled. She has 3 children but only one is studying and he is in law school. Melida began learning to sew when she was 26, and little by little this became her way to earn a living. Now she uses her profits to help her children with expenses. She works every day but she doesn’t have a set schedule because she works at home. One of the biggest problems is the rationing of electricity so she needs to wait and work at night. With the loan she wants to buy fabric,fringe, and other supplies she needs for sewing, and to be able to have more variety. In the future she would like to have her own tailoring business with many sewing machines.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics, fringe

loans.name: Ya

texts.en: Mrs. Ya F., 55 years old, is a cake seller in the Bei Village in the Chrung Comres I Sangkat in Phnom Penh City. She takes care of 11 children and earns about $3 a day. Her husband, Mr. Rim Ly, is a 62-year-old motorcycle taxi driver who earns about $2 a day. Ya F. has three children who help support the family by working in a garment factory. Ya F. wants to encourage her unemployed children to have a suitable job but they don’t have money to invest in a job. So Ya F. is requesting a loan for her children to use as capital to begin selling fruit and fish paste in the market.

loans.use: To finance a business selling fruit and fish paste

loans.name: Rosa Mercedes

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal “María Auxiliadora”, Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia D. San Martin y Departamento D. San Martín. Es Viuda tiene 71 años y es madre D. 05 hijos todos ya independientes. Estudio Secundaria Completa, por problemas D. salud no siguió estudiando.

Rosa, a su edad que tiene se siente con muchas ganas aun D. trabajar, hace 08 años se viene dedicando a la venta D. abarrotes, se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa un local amplio y acondicionado, donD. a diario atienD. a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza y con su primer préstamo D. 300 Nuevos Soles que Manuela Ramos le brindo; implemento más su negocio, comprando arroz y azúcar en sacos, leche en cajas, así empezó vendiendo y poco a poco fue sobresaliendo.

Actualmente continua con el mismo negocio es muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes que a diario acuden a su negocio a comprar, cuenta con todo lo necesario que el ama D. casa necesita.

Con este crédito D. S/ 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, galletas D. todos los sabores en cajas,  bebidas gasificadas D. diferentes tamaños y marcas, utensilios D. aseo para el hogar y D. higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Rosa, se siente una mujer realizada, con más ganas D. salir siempre adelante. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio, tanto a ella como a otras mujeres que lo necesitan.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank "María Auxiliadora," in the Tarapoto District, San Martín Province, San Martín Department. She is 71 years old, a widow, and mother of five children, all of whom are grown. She finished high school, but due to health reasons, could not continue her studies. Rosa, despite her age, would love to continue working. For the last eight years, she has been selling household goods out of her home. In a big and well equipped room, she meets her customers daily and displays her charisma and charm. With the first loan (PEN 300) that Kiva partner Manuela Ramos Movement gave her, she bought bags of sugar and rice, and milk. Today, she continues the same business, and her customers know and love her; they come to her store every day because she has everything a homemaker may need. With the new loan of PEN 1,000, she will buy bags of sugar and rice, boxes of cookies, soft drinks, house cleaning supplies, and personal hygiene products. Rosa feels fulfilled and wants to continue succeeding. She thanks Kiva partner Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her and other women who need it start their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying goods to stock her business

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Altantsetseg is a 53 year-old widow who lives and works in Ulaanbaatar. She lives with her two children and a grand-daughter, and is also raising her two nephews. Her brother died in 2007 and Altantsetseg took in his children, ages 11 and 13 years. 

For the past several years, she has run a little bookstand that she moves from place to place depending where people are. She has sold books at the Naadam field, as well as the children’s park. She also sells at bus stops. Last fall her son Turbat (who is 25) built her a little store from which to sell her books. With a loan, Altantsetseg wants to buy writing instruments, like pens and pencils, so that she can sell them along with the books to make a little more money. Because her husband died several years ago, the family depends on her little shop. 

Altantsetseg is a little deaf but that doesn’t affect her in any way.  She is a very intelligent and clever person. She lives for those she provides for and her goal in life is to raise them to be good people.

loans.use: To purchase writing instruments to sell along with the books.

loans.name: Freddis Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Freddis Antonio G. J., tiene la edad de 28 años vive en el Barrio Juan Ramon Padilla es acompañado y su esposa es comerciante, apoyandole en los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen dos hijos de las edades de 5 años que estudia la primaria y uno de un año. 

El señor es dueño de una moto taxi, y la utiliza en los alrededores de Ticuantepe, dentro de los principales proyectos que tienen esta la remodelación de su vivienda, debido a que aun no presta las condiciones de hábita para sus hijos, esta es la razon fundamental por la que solicitan de un prestamo para la compra de materiales de construcción, y de esta manera ayudarlos como familia a prosperar sus niveles de vida.
texts.en:
Freddis Antonio G. J., 28, lives in the Juan Ramon Padilla neighborhood; his wife is a merchant and helps him with household expenses. They have two children: a 5-year-old in elementary school and a one-year-old. He owns a mototaxi (three-wheel vehicle used to transport passengers and cargo) that he uses all around Ticuantepe. Among his main projects is home improvements because his house still does not have the ideal conditions necessary for his children to live in it. This is the fundamental reason why he is asking for funds: to buy building materials and supplies so that he can help them to prosper as a family and improve their living standard.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Francois

texts.en:
Francois is 26 years old and is still single. He has two years of experience in the business of selling goods in his shop. His shop includes a variety of goods as his photo indicates. His shop is open from early in the morning until late in the evening hours.

Francois is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company so that he can expand his business by purchasing a variety of products which seem to be highly in demand in his village. Those goods will include foodstuffs - mainly rice, sugar, beans, Irish potatoes, sweet potatoes, etc.

With these additional goods, Francois hopes to earn more profits which, in turn, will allow him to start saving for further reinvestment in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs for his store

loans.name: Analllely

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Anallely L. le está haciendo falta las bardas al frente de la casa, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material que necesita.
Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo y así realizar la mejora que le hace falta a su casa, ya que su esposo trabaja todo el día y solo sequedad ella y su pequeño hijo.
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene su esposo el señor Brayan Jesus Gómez, como empleado de una agencia aduanal en el aria de tramitador.
texts.en:
Señora Anallely L. needs a fence around the front of her house, but she lacks the money necessary to be able to buy the required materials. For this reason she is requesting a loan so that she can make this needed improvement to her house, since her husband works all day and she is there alone with her small son. She plans to pay for the loan with income that her husband, Señor Brayan Jesus Gómez, earns working as an expediter for a customs brokerage.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to make a fence around the front of her house

loans.name: Renuka

texts.en:
Renuka is a 36-year-old married woman living with her husband, three sons, and one daughter in the town of Hikkaduwa, Sri Lanka. Her husband has a business in which he sells firewood made from rubber trees. Renuka works with her husband in this firewood-selling business. In addition to working together, they employ two others to help run the business, which has now been in operation for a few years. Renuka is a very active lady and she and her husband make a very good team in their business.

Renuka is seeking a 20,000 rupee (LKR) loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to buy rubber wood. They desiccate the rubber wood until it is dry enough to burn. Then they bundle the wood to sell as firewood to local customers. Every day Renuka's husband goes to town to selling this firewood. Eventually, she hopes to buy a new machine to help split and bundle the firewood.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To purchase rubber wood

loans.name: Gulmurod

texts.ru: Абдиназаров Гулмурод проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 48 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Образование - среднее. Более 7 лет занимается животноводством. Он в основном разводит и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа крупно - рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Gulmurod A. lives in the Yavan district. He is 48 years old, married and has 4 children. He has a secondary education. Gulmurod has been involved in animal husbandry for over 7 years. He primarily breeds and sells livestock. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia S. is from the village of Brgy. Tuao North, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 48 years old, married, and has three infant-aged children. To make a living, Amelia owns and operates a specialized store selling a variety of vegetables, such as onions, in the local community. Amelia has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 4,700 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2007, Amelia joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Amelia is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her sixth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 49-year-old determined lady who does tailoring.  Previously, she was earning a living from her grocery shop.  She started tailoring so that she would get more income.  She hopes to expand her business, which she has been running for two years.  Jane is very skilled in tailoring and desires to open a tailoring college to help young girls who cannot afford a university education.  Jane is glad to be associated with a group in Faulu Kenya because she has gained business ideas with fellow group members. She has requested a loan of Kes. 30,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy fabric and thread for making clothes.

loans.use: To buy fabric and thread for making clothes

loans.name: Soeng

texts.en:
Mr. Soeng T. is a humble villager residing in the province of Kompong Tom in Cambodia. He has a life partner in his wife who appears in the photo. She raises pigs and rice crops and sells them to buyers when they come to maturity. The couple has three kids, two of whom are no longer in school and are working, and the other one is going to school.

To pursue a daily income, Soeng T. travels to buy chop-wood (firewood) from the forest people and returns with it to retail at his home. He faces an obstacle: he has always hired a neighbor’s buffalo at a high price in order to transport his chop-wood from the forest. He wants to cut down this hiring fee by requesting a loan to purchase a couple of water buffalo that he will use to pick up his chop-wood.

loans.use: To purchase a couple of water buffalo that he will use to pick up chop-wood

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria tiene 62 años de edad, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo y sus 2 hijos. El negocio al que se dedica es la venta de objetos artesanales y  artículos para el hogar, dejando primero a crédito, y luego de un tiempo considerable, sus clientes le van pagando. Este trabajo le genera satisfacciones económicas, además le agrada mucho la actividad que hace, lleva ya 15 años apoyando a su madre, desde entonces jamás renuncio a ello, y cuando se casó; su horario lo adecuo de acuerdo al tiempo que dispone, para ofrecer sus productos. Sus planes a futuro es ampliar y diversificar su negocio, con la finalidad de introducir mayor cantidad productos, para satisfacer a sus clientes. Este es su quinceavo crédito con MFP, y su compromete en pagar como en anteriores ocasiones, además está conforme con sus compañeras, ya que son responsables. Gloria piensa invertir el crédito que solicita en comprar cajas de cervezas, así podrá aumentar las utilidades de su negocio.
texts.en:
Gloria is 62 years old. She lives in her own house in the company of her husband and 2 children. The business in which she works is the sale of artisanal objects and household items, allowing on credit first and her customers pay her later, after a considerable amount of time. This job brings her economic satisfaction. In addition, she likes very much the work that she does. She has been helping her other for 15 years and since then, she has never stopped. When she got married, she adjusted her schedule to her time available to sell her products. Her future plans are to expand and diversify her business, with the end goal of bringing in a larger quantity of products to satisfy her customers. This is her fifteenth loan with MFP and she promises to make her payments just like in the past. In addition, she is happy with her fellow members since they are responsible. Gloria plans to invest the loan that she is requesting in the purchase of crates of beers to increase the profits of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase crates of beer to diversify her merchandise.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma B. is from the town of Bonifacio. She is 42 years old and is married with two school-aged children. Emma owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Emma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Emma is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Saveoun's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Savoeun N., 49, is the president selected by the nine members of this village group loan, located in Samraong Káe village in Kandal province. The members of this group will use their portions of the loan to support their different purposes.

Mrs. Savoeun N. breeds fish at home while her husband, Mr. K. Khoem, is a fisherman. With these occupations, they are able to earn a small income to support their family. In order to support her husband's fishing business, Mrs. Savoeun N. has requested a loan from AMK to buy fishnets. This couple has five children: one is a seamstress in a a garment factory and the other four are students who also help out with their parents' businesses.

loans.use: To buy fishnets

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Ines es socia del Banco Comunal Pureza.
Ines es casada y tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 5 estudian, Ines tiene un lavadero de carros en su casa, actividad que inicio hace 2 años, actividad que realiza todos los días. Ines sueña con tener una tienda de lubricantes, lo cual complementaria al negocio que ya tiene.
Ines necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de champú y escoba.
Ines sueña que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Inés is a member of the Pureza (Purity) communal bank. She’s married and has 6 children 5 of whom are in school. Inés has a carwash at home, a business she started two years ago. She is open for business every day. She dreams with owning a vehicle lubricant store which would complement her current business. Inés needs a 1000 sol loan to buy shampoo and a broom She dreams with her children becoming professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shampoo and a broom.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony N. is from the village of Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 24 years old and single. To make a living, Anthony owns and operates a specialized retail store buying and selling seafood products, such as salted and dried fish, in the local community. Anthony has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 2,500 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Anthony joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anthony is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional salted fish to sell. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional salted fish to sell

location.town: Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Ori

loans.name: Passy

texts.en:
