Passy Nakyeyune is 21 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is married and has one child.  Her child is not currently in school. Passy has a business of selling drinks, which she has had for less than one year.         

To help expand her business, Passy has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more drinks like soda. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Passy hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, Passy hopes to get a second loan and buy a fridge.  

Passy is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save and how to handle a business.

loans.use: To buy more drinks like soda

loans.name: C5285 Indatwa Group

texts.en:
Julienne is 32 years old and married with one child, who is 3 years old. Julienne is the only one who works in her family. That's the reason she has to work hard, so that she can provide whatever her family needs. She owns a small business selling various styles of clothes. She has 2 years of experience in this business. The hours of her daily activities are from 8 am to 5 pm every day except on Saturday. In addition, Julienne is the leader of a group of five people with different businesses.

Julienne and her group are requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand their businesses by purchasing more products needed by their customers. With this loan, the group members will be able to earn enough profit to allow them to save money for their future.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Nkitei Sipaai

texts.en:
Nkitei has been raising animals to sell in Naivasha for one year.  He is 37 years old, married to Loise Nkitei, and they have three children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan to buy 10 goats and 15 sheep which he will raise and sell later at a profit, when they mature.

In the future, Nkitei hopes to own rental houses which he considers to be more stable in income.

loans.use: To buy 10 goats and 15 sheep which he will raise and sell when they mature.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: This is 47-year-old Nancy. She is a widow and has 2 children ages 29 and 26. She has another child who lives with her who is part of her extended family. In 2004, Nancy established her drinks business because she wanted to be self reliant. Working 7 days a week and 15 hours a day, she earns about Le 2809680 every month. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3000000 to buy additional drinks. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 561936. In the future, Nancy plans to complete construction work on her home from the proceeds of the loan and would also like to educate her children to university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: The loan is used to buy additional drinks

loans.name: Adrien

texts.en:
Adrien is 26 years old and is single. He owns a boutique in the Gasabo district in Rwanda.  Adrien has two years experience owning his small business and works from 6am until 9pm every day. His store is very well-organised

This is Adrien's first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company.  He has requested a loan to purchase more products for his small boutique, he would like to expand his business and use the profits to open other small boutiques.

loans.use: To purchase more products for his small boutique

loans.name: C5501 Twitezimbere Group

texts.en:
Alise is 27 years old and is married with two children who are 4 and 8 years old. She is the president of a group called “Twitezimbere”, and in the picture she has her hand raised. Alise sells bananas. This is their third successful year in this business.

Alise has requested a loan to purchase a large quantity of bananas to sell at the market. Alise hopes this will help her to earn a good profit from the sale and allow her to provide for her family, pay school fees, and save some money for the future.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of bananas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Complete the construction of a room and other home remodeling projects

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng S., 39, is married and resides with his wife in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. He is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 5 per day, while his wife is a farmer earning an income of USD 1 per day to help cover the family's expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 50 on food and USD 38 on other necessary expenses.

Heng is now requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase a new motorbike for family use. In the future, he would like to use any additional income to repair his house. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “EL MOLINITO II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maribel; ella tiene 30 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de venta de boletos en una empresa de transporte, ella trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, la socia quiere tener un negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para uso personal.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Maribel belongs to El Molinito II community bank in the district, province and department of Cusco, Peru. She is 30 years old, single and has one son. She makes a living selling tickets at a transportation company. She works from 9 a.m. until 8 p.m. She wants to have a business selling groceries. Maribel is requesting the loan for personal use. She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: Personal use

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina T. is from the village of San Jose, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 48 years old. Justina is separated from her spouse and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Justina owns & operates a specialized retail store, selling cologne, lotion and other products in the local community. Justina has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Justina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Justina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Justina is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the third loan taken out by Justina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

location.town: San Jose, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase fabrics and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Elupina

texts.en:
Elupina is one of our woman entrepreneurs and she is requesting an individual loan. This is her 11th loan, after being with us for seven years. She started her business with her Esperanza first loan, being part of a group that was created in her community and after many years and great investment, she was able to take her business to a next level, taking out the biggest loan amount. She operates a miscellaneous business, which is a small store where she sell clothes, shoes, accessories, and cosmetic products. She is located in a community near Hato Mayor.

Elupina will use this loan to buy men's and women's clothing, shoes, accessories and  cosmetic products. She will use her business profits to remodel her small local business venue next to her house and to save for make change in her house structure. She plans to rebuild some areas. She is the mother of five children and her dream is to see them to become professionals with stable lives.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's clothing, shoes, accessories and  cosmetic products.

loans.name: Serigne Moustapha

texts.fr: Monsieur Serigne Moustapha N. est un technicien supérieur en bâtiment  qui a fait beaucoup de stages  dans plusieurs entreprises de la place. Après l’obtention  de son diplôme de bac on lui a conseillé d’intégrer le secteur du génie civil. Par conséquent  il est beaucoup intéressé  par la supervision du travail des manœuvres. Monsieur N. est membre du guichet de Yoff depuis octobre 2008, mais n’a jamais bénéficié de crédit au sein de l’institution. Il sollicite un crédit de 50 000frs prévu pour l’achat de quelques thioubs destinés à la vente. Son objectif est d’accroitre ses revenus et d’améliorer  ses  conditions  de vie sociale.
texts.en: Mr. Serigne Moustapha N. is a high-level construction technician who has completed many internships in several local enterprises. After obtaining his high school diploma, he was advised to enter the sector of civil engineering. Consequently, he is highly interested in works management. Mr. N. has been a member of the Yoff branch since October 2008 but never obtained a loan with this micro-finance institution. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 francs for buying some thioubs (dyed cloth) for resale. His goal is to increase his revenues and to improve his situation in life.

loans.use: to buy thioub cloth

loans.name: Parvin

texts.ru: Parvin H. 22 qoda. Ona ne zamujem i ne imeyet detey. Parvin jivet v Avbsehron regione vmeste so svoimi roditelyami, ona pomoqayet svoyey semye. Parvin Uje 2 qoda kak zanimayetsya vipechkoy sladostey, imeyet svoyu malenkuyu pekarnu. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupit novuyu pechku dlya vipechki sladostey.
texts.en: Parvin H. is 22 years old.  She is single and childless.  Parvin lives in Absheron with her parents.  She helps her family.  For the last two years, Parvin has been baking sweets.  She has her own bakery.  Now, she needs 2300 AZN to buy a new oven for baking sweets.

loans.use: to buy a new oven for baking

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is married and a father of four.  For a living, he sells charcoal.  He has been in the business since 1996.  Apart from selling charcoal, he is a photographer.  Samuel joined a group in Faulu Kenya so that he would save his money and access loan easily.  So far, he has serviced four loans which he has paid successfully.  He has requested another loan of 50,000 Kes.  With the loan, he will buy charcoal.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Célibataire à 27ans, Koffi  tient une blanchisserie de lavage à sec depuis 2010. Pour les besoins de sa boutique, il s’approvisionne à Lomé. Ce prêt lui servira à réaménager sa blanchisserie et acheter certains produits pour améliorer son travail. C’est un jeune homme sérieux  qui cherche à s’établir financièrement avant de s’engager dans la vie maritale.
texts.en: Koffi is a single 27 year-old who has been running a dry-cleaning business since 2010. He sources his goods from Lomé. He is seeking a loan in order to re-fit his business and to purchase dry-cleaning products. He is a sensible young man who is seeking financial stability before settling down to married life.

loans.use: to purchase items to re-fit his business, and dry-cleaning products

loans.name: El Aguacate Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Aguacate lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras ellas son Silvia del Carmen, Blanca Carolina y Eloísa de los Ángeles. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Silvia del Carmen de 38 años quien se dedica a la venta de ropa, enchiladas, tamales rellenos (de dulce) y nacatamales. Este negocio lo inicio con hace 7 años con unos ahorros luego empezó a prestar para que su negocio progresara.
Ella tiene dos niños de 6 y 13 años por los cuales trabaja arduamente para que estudien y se preparen ya que ella no pudo hacerlo desea que sus hijos tengan esa herencia. Con el crédito una parte la invertirá en materia prima (ropa, maíz, cerdo, dulce, leña…etc.) y otra parte para construir un cuarto.
Las otras integrantes doña Blanca Carolina de 34 años vende ropa, zapatos y cosméticos y Eloísa de los Ángeles desde hace 5 años comercializa ropa.
texts.en:
The “El Aguacate” (The Avocado) group is composed of three hard working, enterprising women.  They are: Silvia del Carmen, Blanca Carolina and Eloísa de los Ángeles.  

Silvia del Carmen, 38, is the group Coordinator.  She sells clothes, enchiladas, stuffed tamales (sweet) and nacatamales (Nicaraguan style tamales).  She started this business 7 years ago with savings and then started to borrow so that her business would progress.

She has two children who are 6 and 13 years of age for whom she works hard so that they will study and prepare themselves since she was unable to do so; she wants her children to have that inheritance.  

She will use the loan in part to buy raw materials (clothes, corn, pork, candy, firewood, etc.) and in part to build a room.

The other group members are Blanca Carolina, 34, who sell clothes, shoes and cosmetics and Eloísa de los Ángeles who has sold clothes for the last five years.

loans.use: to buy clothes, corn, firewood, pork, candy, etc. and to build a small room.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea is 54, married, and has three children who are in school. 

Andrea has been raising pigs for 25 years now, and has borrowed 19 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. Andrea requested an 18,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. 

In the future, Andrea would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is 38 years old and married with four children. Her youngest child is five and the oldest is 14.  Juvy is a farmer who helps her husband till their land in the town of Banga, South Cotabato. Their primary crop is rice. Juvy rents a stall at the market to sell their harvest and works hard to help improve her family’s living conditions. 

Juvy is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer and insecticide. This will help Juvy achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is married with 4 adult-aged children. She is 55 years old and she has a retail shop where she can sell a variety of products in the community. Margarita has had this business for 3 years and she earns approximately 6,000 PHP (~$142) monthly.

Margarita is requesting a loan of 18,000 PHP to buy soft drinks, noodles and canned goods to sell.

In the future, Margarita plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her selling activity.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, noodles and canned goods to sell.

loans.name: Mukene Women's Group

texts.en:
Nusula has been selling fish for the last decade in Lugazi. Nusula is 45 years old and she is a mother to six children. She says she joined this business with the persuasion of close friends. Before that, she was involved in a food sales business. The ten years have been years where she has not only learnt the fundamentals of doing business, but also learnt the ways and means of making it profitable and successful.

The fact that Lugazi is near Lake Victoria is an advantage in her business in that she does not have to spend much in transport costs. The fact that fish sells highly on the markets in Lugazi and the surrounding towns is also another merit. Her biggest challenge, however, is the tight competition manifest in this trade. In some seasons too, the fish stocks in the lake go scarce, meaning the fishermen will not make many a catch. This, needless to say, adversely affects her business.

Nusula says she makes sales profits totaling up to Ugandan shillings 30,000 on a weekly basis. With this Kiva loan, Nusula says she is going to purchase more fish to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell.

loans.name: Nieve Piedad

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal La Dolorosa Del Pechiche.

La señora Nieve es socia fundadora del Banco comunal, le gusta porque los créditos han sido como una bendición. Tiene 72 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 4 hijos, todos  ya son mayores de edad, en su casa aun vive un hijo que ya está casado pero vive allí junto a su esposa y dos pequeños hijos. Su esposo  está enfermo y ya no trabaja.

Ella realiza el crédito para el negocio familiar,  su esposo tiene una fábrica de ladrillos pero que por motivos de enfermedad ahora su hijo se hace cargo del negocio, por eso ella realiza el crédito ya que ahora ellos trabajan en sociedad pues él se encarga de la elaboración de los ladrillos y ella en su casa de las ventas, ya que hasta su casa llegan los comerciantes que luego se encargan de llevarlos a otros lugares a entregar, trabajan de lunes a viernes desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00 y llevan dedicados a esta actividad por más de 40 años desde que su esposo trabajaba.
 
Este crédito es para comprar leña, aserrín, agua, palmito que son los materiales que emplean para elaborar los ladrillos.
 
Sus sueños son seguir con el negocio y tener fuerzas para continuar trabajando.
texts.en:
In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its great diversity of typical products, like, for example, the straw hats known inside and outside the country, the members of the Dolorosa Del Pechiche community bank meet every 15 days.

Nieve is a founding member of the community bank. She likes it because the loans have been like a blessing. She is 72 years old. She is married and, from this relationship, has four children, all of whom are adults. One son still lives in her house even though he is married but he lives there with his wife and two small children. Her husband is sick and does not work anymore.

She requested the loan for the family business. Her husband has a brick factory but, due to illness reasons, now their son is in charge of the business. As a result, she has requested the loan since now they work in partnership as he is responsible for making bricks and she is at home selling since traders come to the house and are responsible for taking them to other places for delivery. They work Monday to Friday from 8AM until 6PM and have been dedicated to this activity for more than 40 years since her husband worked.

This loan is to buy wood, sawdust, water and palm which are the materials they use to make bricks.

Their dreams are to continue with the business and to have the strength to continue working.

loans.use: to buy wood, sawdust, water and palm.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is a hardworking, 33-year-old business lady. She is single and a proud mother of two children who are school-going. For the last one year, she has been making ends meet by operating a cosmetics shop. Previously, she used to sell second-hand clothes. In the next five years, she wants to have opened up another shop. Her dream is to have a comfortable life. 

She is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy hair pieces, hair oil, shampoo and beads. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy hair pieces, hair oil, shampoo and beads.

loans.name: Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es:
El grupo CORAZON D. JESUS  ya tiene formado cerca D. 1 año  este es su tercer desembolso y lo que mas agradecen a EDAPROSPO son sus prestamos que las ayudan a seguir progresando, cada una en su negocio particularmente L. Sra. Eusebia  siente que ha crecido mucho su negocio D. venta D. gas domestico va viento en popa  ya son 8 años que tiene en este rubro recuerda sus inicios cuando solo tenia 03 balones D. gas  las ventas eran mínimas  pero gracias a su persistencia salio adelante ahora tiene una distribuidora D. gas “BETHEL”  tiene un capital ganado que le permite tener buena solvencia y sobretodo  ayudar a sus hijos  en sus estudios para que sean buenos profesionales, L. Sra. Eusebia es L. secretaria del grupo en esta oportunidad elL. usara su préstamo para abastecerse D. gas para D. esa manera estar vigente ante L. demanda D. su clienteL..

* L. Sra. Eusebia esta con chompa marrón es L. 5ta D. las paradas.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Corazon D. Jesus" has been together for a year.  This is their third loan, and what they most appreciate about EDAPROSPO has been the access to loans that have helped them to continue to make progress.  Each one of them has a business.  Eusebia feels that her business selling domestic gas has grown a lot.  It is now booming, but she remembers that when she started in this line of work 8 years ago she had only 3 gas tanks and her sales were minimal.  But thanks to her persistence, she has managed to get ahead and now she is a "BETHEL" gas distributor.  She has had capital gains that have allowed her to have good solvency and, most importantly, to help her children in their studies so that they can become good professionals.  Eusebia is the secretary of the communal bank, and at this time she will use her loan to stock up on gas so that she will be able to meet the demands of her customers.

Eusebia is in the brown sweater, and is the fifth standing person from the left.

loans.use: to buy domestic gas

loans.name: Rosma

texts.en:
Rosma is 22 years old and married. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like sugar, groceries, etc. 

Rosma has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for six years and also earns an income from retailing charcoal.

Rosma aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with one child.  Mylene has a retail shop that sells souvenirs, like bracelets, key chains & carved wood with designs & prints. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stock of souvenirs to sell.  Mylene is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Mylene hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of souvenirs to sell

loans.name: Jose Mercedes

texts.es:
José de 52 años de edad, es soltero, reside en su casa propia junto a unos  familiares, ubicada  en la zona rural de Olmos que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque. Es una zona agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

El cuenta con un terreno agrícola en donde suele sembrar mango y limón, el ya tiene varios años de experiencia en esta actividad y durante este tiempo ha llegado a conocer mucho sobre el manejo de cultivos. Los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades los utiliza para solventar la economía diaria de su familia.

José desea comprar fertilizantes para así brindar mantenimiento a su terreno de cultivo para instalar una nueva plantación de limón. De esta manera obtendrá una buena cosecha. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
José is 52 years old, single and living in his own house with some relatives in the rural part of Olmos which belongs to Lambayeque Department.  It’s a farming, livestock raising and crafts making zone.

He has a field where he tends to grow mangoes and lemons.  He has several years experience in this activity and during all this time he’s come to learn much about managing these crops.  Income he receives from these activities is used to cover his family’s daily needs.

José wants to buy fertilizer to provide maintenance to his growing fields and to plant a new lemon crop to obtain a good harvest.  To reach this objective he’s needed to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar, age 26, has been engaged in an agricultural business, specifically animal breeding, for about six years. He lives in Ddmashen village in the Sevan area with his parents, his brother, and his sister. All the members of Edgar's family help him with his business. The family owns their own plot of land, where Edgar breeds cows, pigs, chickens, and lambs. The milk is used for family needs, but the meat is sold to local meat dealers. 

Edgar is a graduate of Sevan Industry Technical School, where he specialized in the area of road transport. Edgar’s father works as a dyer. His mother maintains the home but does not otherwise work. His sister has graduated from medical college but is as yet unemployed. His brother has recently returned from the army and is also unemployed for the moment.

Edgar has decided to add to his number of animals. This addition will help him to grow his farming business. He has requested a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy a cow and purchase pig fodder. Adding a cow will help develop the business and add to the family's milk production. 

Edgar is a second-level client in Nor Horizon and has never been delayed in his loan repayments.

Edgar is a very hard-working person and he likes his farming business very much. Thanks to his farming income, Edgar helps to support the family and is committed to improving the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a cow and purchase pig fodder

loans.name: Gbenonkpo Group

texts.fr: GBENONKPO est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Matilde Simplicia (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 37 ans et est mariée à un comptable du nom de Nicolas. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Matilde Simplicia vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Matilde Simplicia n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Depuis cinq ans, Matilde Simplicia vend des savons et des conserves dans son quartier. Matilde Simplicia achète ses produits au Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Matilde Simplicia et les autres membres du groupe GBENONKPO sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en: Gbenonkpo is a group of three people whose members live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, Matilde Simplicia (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 37 years old and married to an accountant by the name of Nicolas. The couple has three children, all at school and in their care. Matilde Simplicia lives with her husband and children. The couple cover the various family expenses between them. Matilde Simplicia did not go to school and for the past five years she has been selling soaps and canned foods in her neighborhood. She buys her products in Benin. This is the second time that Matilde Simplicia and the other members of the Gbenonkpo group have requested financial aid from Alidé with the aim of strengthening their working capital and business in order to respond better to customer demand.

loans.use: to buy cartons of soaps and canned foods.

loans.name: Hamdam

texts.ru: Хамдам занимается перевозкой людей более 15 лет. Он женат и имеет четверо детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Его бизнес приносит ему хорошую прибыль, и он улучшил свое жилищное условия. Прибыль, который он получил от данного бизнеса, он строил один дом. Он хочет продолжать свой бизнес и улучшить свое благосостояние семьи. Хамдам хотел бы получить займ на устройство газового оборудования для своего автомобиля.
texts.en: Hamdam has been involved in transporting people for over 15 years.  He is married and has four children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Hamdam's business brings him a good profit, which enabled him to improve his living conditions.  He used the profit from this business to build one house.  Hamdam wants to continue his business and improve his family's livelihood.  He wants to obtain this loan to install gas equipment for his vehicle.

loans.use: to install gas equipment

loans.name: Luz Mery

texts.es: La señora Luz Mery tiene como negocio una cafetería, en la cual trabaja hace cuatro años, en esta, ella trabaja sola en la semana y los fines de semana le colaboran dos personas más.   La señora Luz Mery desea comprar surtido para su cafetería como snaks, gaseosas, gomas de mascar, café, galletas dulces y de sal, dulces, entre otros productos. Lo anterior le permitirá aumentar sus ingresos y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida tanto personal como laborar y a futuro adquirir una casa propia donde pueda tener su negocio.
texts.en: Luz Mery has a cafeteria business that she has been running for 4 years. She works alone during the week and at the weekends she has 2 other people who work with her. Luz Mery wants to buy supplies for her cafeteria such as snacks, sodas, chewing gum, coffee, cookies, crackers, candies, and other products. This will enable her to increase her income and so improve her quality of life, both her personal life and work life. In the future she hopes to have her own home and run her business from there.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as snacks, sodas, candies, and coffee.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie has practiced livestock farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last three years. She is 31 years old, married to Joel, and they have three school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our existing clients and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan to buy a cow which she will rear and use to produce milk. 

Due to the ready and stable market for milk in the area and beyond, Winnie hopes in the future to become one of the leading dairy farmers in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Benadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is a 34-year-old mixed crop farmer who is married to Joseph, a business man. They are blessed with three children aged 17, 15 and 12 years old respectively. She has been in the farming business for ten years and makes a monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her second loan term with KADET after repaying her previous loan on time. Bernadette will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. With the anticipated profit from the business she plans to buy a dairy cow. 

Her hopes are to own a big tea farm which will improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Esperance Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ESPERANCE est formé de quatre personnes qui appartiennent tous au même groupe d'artisans. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Honorine, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Honorine ne vit plus avec son mari, mais a un enfant qui est scolarisé et qui vit avec elle. Honorine a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire et a appris la décoration. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et assurer les différentes charges de son enfant, Honorine exerce cette activité de décoration depuis une douzaine d'année. De façon secondaire, Honorine vend des sacs de riz et des boissons devant son atelier. Honorine s'approvisionne au Bénin. Dans le but de rehausser leur activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle, Honorine et les autres membres du groupe ESPERANCE sollicitent l'appui financier de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur servira à renforcer leur activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
The group Esperance is made up of 4 members who all belong to the same team of craftspeople.

Honorine, whose hand is raised in the picture, is the group's representative. Honorine no longer lives with her husband and is raising a child who attends school. She herself left school during her secondary education and learnt how to be a decorator.

In order to be able to meet her needs and cover the various expenses for her child, Honorine has been a practising decorator for about 12 years. She also has a sideline business selling bags of rice and drinks in front of her studio. She gets her supplies in Benin.

Honorine and the members of the Esperance group are seeking financial support from ALIDé in order to better satisfy customer demand and increase their business. The loan will enable them to buy new stock, strengthen their business activity and better meet their customers´ needs.

loans.use: to buy ink, decorative Plexiglas® and other products like cans and rice.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 40 years old and a married woman with three children. All of them are in school. She has had a business selling fish in Yei, South Sudan for two years.

Susan is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of the children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Janviere

texts.en:
Janviere is 47 years old. Her husband is a pastor. They have seven children between the ages of 23 and 8, and all go to school. 

For the past three years, Janviere has sold food such as bananas. She has requested the loan to buy more bananas to sell. She plans to use the profits to pay school fees for the children. 

In the future, she would like to add new items such as soft drinks in her business.

loans.use: To buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes is married and has three children. She is 45 years old and lives in Poblacion 2, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. Lourdes had a general store business to earn a living and has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase more stock such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap,vinegar and salt for her general store business. Lourdes has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Lourdes hope to have more savings for her children education.

loans.use: to purchase more stock such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap,vinegar and salt for her general store business.

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Lay is 25 years old (she is not available in the picture). She is married and resides with two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been selling souvenirs for more than a year, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband (who is in the picture) is a construction worker. He makes an income of $5 each day. 

Due to lack of funds, Lay is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase timber to build her house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase timber to build her house

loans.name: Rosette

texts.en:
Rosette aged 37 years. She is married with 4 children aged between 4 and 11 years. 3 of them go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 5 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare and pay school fees of her children and to buy a house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a single mother with five children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She is hardworking and, therefore, takes sole responsibility of looking after her children, two of whom are in school. She deals in buying and selling cocoa mainly to cocoa companies for 10 years now with an aim of family up keep. She hopes to expand her business and construct rentals for generating income.  Jane intends to use the loan facility to buy more cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Pili

texts.en:
Pili runs a small grocery store on the main road that crosses the island of Upolo. His main customers are the school children that attend the primary school directly across the road from his store. They mainly buy sweets, packaged snack food and locally made biscuits. Pili also relies on the custom of local villagers who come to buy preserved milk, canned fish, sugar, oil coffee and cigarettes.    
With his last loan , Pili bought more stock for his store. He broadened the range a little on small items but used most of the proceeds to increase his stock size.

Pili’s family consists of 5 adults and 3 children. His brother is the only other family member to regularly contribute to the family’s income. The family’s quality of life has improved with each loan. Benefits are demonstrated in coverage of the children’s school uniforms and fees, more regular staple foods and the construction of a new inside bathroom.

Pili is the leader of his village lending group and recieved an award for this in 2005

loans.use: Purchase stock and improve the shop

loans.name: Felisa Elizabeth

texts.en:
Felisa Elizabeth is married and a mother of two: a 22 year old son and a 14 year old daughter. They live in Mérida, Yucatán. Her husband is a retailer; he sells electronics, but the income he receives from this activity is not enough to cover the family’s basic needs. This is why three years ago, Felisa decided to start selling watches, so she could help her husband with the family’s expenses and her son and daughter’s education. Now, Felisa needs a loan of $250. She will use this money to purchase more merchandise thus increasing her sales. She believes in the generosity of people who help those in need. She needs your support and is grateful for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

Felisa Elizabeth es una mujer casada y madre de un hijo de 22 y una hija de 14 años, ellos viven en la localidad de Mérida, Yucatán. Su esposo es comerciante y vende artículos electrónicos, sin embargo el ingreso que obtiene no es suficiente para el sustento de su familia, por lo que Felisa hace tres años decidió iniciar con la venta de relojes, con el propósito de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares y la educación de sus hijos.

Ahora Felisa necesita de un crédito por la cantidad de $250 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para incrementar sus ventas, ella confía en la generosidad de las personas para ayudar a quién más lo necesita, ella necesita de tu apoyo y agradece sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use: surtir mercancía

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The loan will be invested in the purchase of school supplies such as textbooks, notebooks, pencils, erasers, paper, etc.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is a 34 year old, single mother living and working in Juliaca. She has been working on her own for eight years. When she first started off, she would travel to Tacna every month to purchase clothes and bring them back to Juliaca to sell. After some time selling clothing, she decided to sell sodas and snacks on the weekends in Puerto Maldonado. Magdalena would leave on Thursday and arrive in Puerto Maldonado on Saturday, leaving her just enough time to sell at the ferias, weekly markets, on Sunday. The hectic traveling proved to be too demanding, especially with a new born.

Magdalena now has a bookstand by the Colegio Cesar Vallejo at which she works at from 6:30 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. during the week. On weekends and during holidays she sells pasamanerias, which are braids, ribbon, hair ties, and other goods for festivals. Magdalena is always traveling and working with her two-year-old daughter. She hopes that with a $1,200 loan she will be able to purchase a Remalladora, which she would use to produce large quantities of clothing. She hopes to be able to design, produce, and sell her own clothing in the near future.

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine to produce larger quantities of clothing.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manual is married. His wife is a homemaker, and they have no children. He began selling hardware in a company; When it was sold, he began his own business with the money from the deal. It has grown a lttle at a time and now he wishes to expand his hardware selection to include refurbished parts, which are often requested. He wants to progress with his business to create a better quality of life for him and his wife. Manuel is a hard-working, enterprising man, and he has a vision for how to grow now that he hears what his customers want.

So he is requesting a loan for US $925 to purchase refurbished merchandise and better hardware supplies for his base business. He is offering to pay the loan in six months. He and his family thank you for the support that you grant to continue growing his business.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva Volunteer.

Manuel está casado y su esposa se dedica a su hogar, no tienen hijos, y él empezó vendiendo artículos de ferretería en un negocio y cuando lo liquidaron fue cuando inició su propio negocio con el dinero de su liquidación, ahora el ha ido creciendo poco a poco y desea ampliar sus artículos de ferretería a también vender refacciones que le son muy solicitadas, y desea progresar con su negocio para tener una mejor calidad de vida para él y su esposa. Manuel es un hombre trabajador y emprendedor, y tiene la visión de cómo crecer ya que escucha lo que sus clientes le solicitan.

Por ello, él esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 925 para comprar mercadería nueva en refacciones y mayores artículos de ferretería que es su fuerte, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Él y su familia te agradecen mucho por el apoyo que le brindas para seguir creciendo con su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of hardware merchandise

loans.name: Angélica

texts.es:
Angelica Q. es an entreprising woman who day after day finds herself submerged in the sale and commercialization of delicious cheeses which she sells to the public. This work has allowed her to begin a second business selling clothing items, even though the quantities may be limited. The great welcome that he has received for her job performance in this commercial activity has enticed her to increase the quantity of products that she sells, with the end goal of improving her family's standard of living. Nevertheless, these goals are only wishes and cannot be realized without the support of such kind and generous hearts as yours. Help us to support this noble woman to fulfill her goals for her gratifying business.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Angélica Q., es una mujer emprendedora que día a día se encuentra sumida íntegramente en la venta y comercialización de deliciosos quesos que muy diligentemente expende al público, este esfuerzo le ha permitido iniciar también el negocio de la venta de ropa, aunque en una cantidad limitada.La gran acogida que ha obtenido por su desempeño en esta actividad le ha generado el deseo de incrementar la cantidad de productos que comercializa con el fin de elevar su nivel de vida familiar.Sin embargo estas metas anheladas no serán realizables sin el apoyo incondicional de corazones generosos como el de vosotros.Ayudemos a esta noble mujer a consolidar este gratificante negocio.

loans.use: An increase in earnings in the second job that this devoted mother works.

loans.name: Rasheed Un Nisa

texts.en:
I request a loan of $900 for my husband’s rickshaw workshop and spare parts business. He has made a small cabin within his workshop to sell these spare parts. Earlier, he was a rickshaw driver then, about 15 years ago he decided to start a workshop of his own to increase his income and fulfil his dream of running his own workshop. He buys spare parts from the spare parts market here in Lahore, Pakistan. A couple of years ago, he acquired loans for his business which turned out into increased profits and enabled us to repair our house. My husband works very hard to grow his business by leaps and bounds.
I am a mother of four girls and four boys. Two of my daughters are married and my elder son helps his father in the business. We hope that by investing your loan in our business, we will turn out even better profits, which we will save for when our children marry.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts in bulk to expand our business

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie has five children. She runs a business selling palm oil and has been doing the same business for a long time.  With previous loans from SMT, she increased her stock and made a good profit.  She is able to send her children to school.  Married and 43 years old, Marie would like to expand her business by purchasing 80 gallons of palm oil. Marie believes that increasing her business will enable her to generate more income to build strong business capital to diversify the business.  She is requesting a $275 loan.

loans.use: She would like to purchase additional gallons of palm oil to meet the local demand

loans.name: Avliyokul

texts.ru:
Avliyokul A. lives in the city of Yavan. He is 59 years old, not married and has 7 children. He has a high school degree, but no profession. He has been raising cattle for milk and meat sales for the last 20 years. He mainly purchases calves at Yavan's markets, fattens them and sells them at the same markets for profit. Mr. A. is planning to use the loan to expand his business and increase animal turnover. This loan will not only help Mr. A. support himself and his family, but will also expand agriculture in the region and provide a source of meat, milk and sour milk products to the local residents. Mr. A. is planning to pay back the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Асторнаев Авлиекул житель города Яван.Возраст 59 лет. Неженат , имеет 7 детей.Образование среднее, специальной работы не имеет. Основной вид деятельности животноводство.Опыт в данной сфере 20 лет.Кредит планирует получить для расширения деятельности. То есть хочет увеличить товарооборот.Место ведение бизнеса Рынки города Яван. Приобретает крупно рогатый скот, откармливает и продает на тех же рынках. Данная деятельность является не только источником дохода клиента но и помогает развитию сельскохозяйственного сектора , а также обеспечить население молоком и кисломолочными продуктами. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Valentin

texts.en:
Valentin is divorced with an 11-year-old son. He lives in Ivano-Frankivsk and works as a taxi driver. He loves being self-employed and managing his own time. Valentin has a nice car and offers transportation services around the territory of Ukraine. He is a workaholic and is ready to work non-stop including weekends. Valentin has been in this business for 5 years. His daily profit is about $25-30. 

Valentin is really excited that he has had the chance to repair his old car, sell it and buy a newer vehicle. Now he doesn’t have to spend as much time in the mechanics shop as before when he had all different kinds of technical problems with his old automobile. Today Valentin is requesting a loan of $500 to cover some of the expenses connected with purchasing his new vehicle and pay for some of the paperwork that has to be done.

loans.use: Cover expenses for new automobile for taxi business

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Juana started her business 2 years ago. She used to help her mother sell jewelry, but then decided to set up her own business. The jewelry business requires a long investment, though, and she hasn't been able to stand out because she only buys small amounts of merchandise. With the help of loans, though, she wants to invest in more merchandise. Her husband is a construction worker and they have 3 children, 12, 8, and 2. Faced with the need to help her husband with household expenses, she decided to start the business.

Juana is now applying for a US$400 loan, to be repaid in 3 months, to buy merchandise. With your contribution, Juana will prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Juana inició su negocio hace 2 años le ayudaba a su mama a vender joyería, después decidió emprender un negocio propio pero la joyería requiere de mucha inversión por lo cual no ha podido sobresalir mucho porque compra poco mercancía pero con la ayuda del crédito quiere invertirlo todo en esta. Su esposo es albañil y tienen 3 hijos de 12, 8 y 2 años, ante la necesidad de apoyar a su marido con los gastos familiares fue que decidió iniciar el negocio.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $400 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía. Con tu contribución Juana prosperara.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.en:
Rosa María is the proud mother of two children, both in school. Her husband works as bus conductor for a private company. Rosa María has been cooking for two years, and she has attracted a faithful clientele in her sector. Each day, a lot of people visit Rosa María’s cafe to enjoy her delicious dishes. She carefully prepares sandwiches, hamburgers, and fried dishes in the morning. For lunch, she prepares typical Dominican dishes and natural juices. The entrepreneur says that her business is growing and more people are visiting the cafe.

Rosa María is requesting a loan to buy ingredients for the dishes she prepares so that she can attract more customers and move her business forward.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for meals served in her cafe.

loans.name: Gulasal

texts.en:
M. Gulasal is 53 years old. She is married with five children.

Gulasal sells dried fruits in the central local market. She has been in this business already for 11 years and has gained rich experience in this business. In Tajikistan people are extremely hospitable. When there are visitors, every hostess serves the national bread, “lepeshka,” tea, candies, and dried fruits. Thus, dried fruits have always found a market, and day by day the price for this kind of fruits is raising. Gulasal tries to have a wide range of goods, and serves the clients with a smile. The business is stable and generates a considerable income for the family.

Today Gulasal requests 3400 Somoni (1000 $ US Dollars) for the term of 10 months. The loan shall be spent for purchasing dried fruits like raisins, apricots and almonds, pistachios, and peanuts for increasing the variety of goods for selling. Having proved herself as a reliable client, Gulasal promises to pay the current loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: Purchasing dried fruits like raisins, apricots, almonds, pistachios, and peanuts to increase the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Kheng

texts.en:
Mrs. Kheng P. is a 32-year-old widow from Roka Tong Village in the Kampong Chhnang Province of Cambodia, where her child is enrolled in the local school. She is a rice middle-woman who buys rice to keep in stock and re-sell later at a better price. 

Kheng's business activity works well, and she wants to expand it. Thus, Kheng is requesting a loan to buy more rice to keep in stock.

loans.use: Buy more rice stock.

loans.name: Wisdom 2015-8 Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Amuna M.. She is currently in the business of selling tea. She is 30 years old and married to a businessman. She has two children, age 10 and 16, who are both in school. Each week, Amuna makes approximately 100 Sudanese pounds in profit. With the extra capital from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy more sugar to sell.

Amuna is joined in her small group by Mary A., Madellina K., Regina M., and Anna P.. Mary has a business selling bread and wants to construct a house. Madellina is currently operating a business selling charcoal at the market and wants a loan to buy more charcoal to sell. Rejina operates a business selling beer at the bar and wants to start a poultry business. Anna is currently in the business of selling local brew and is requesting a loan to expand the business.

loans.use: To buy more sugar to sell.

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en:
Rehana A. M. is the wife of A. M. and lives in the Walton area of Lahore City, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the last 35 years. She is the mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. Her eldest son is in 9th standard. Her youngest son is in 5th standard. Her eldest daughter is in 7th standard. Her youngest daughter is in 3rd standard. For the past three years, Rehana baji's husband has had a business renting motorbikes, while she works as a cook in several houses. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a second loan to buy another motorbike for her husband’s business so that they may increase their profits.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Razia S. M. wants a loan to buy vegetables to resell. Mumtaz B. M. wants a loan to buy tools for her workshop. Naseem A. M. wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motorized vehicle).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another motorbike for her husband's motorbike rental business.

loans.name: Mujeres Confiadas Group

texts.en: "Mujeres Confiadas," as the name suggests, is a group of 10 confident women. Each one of these women is ready to change her life and start her own small business. Mirtha J. was chosen as the representative of this group. Mirtha is a hardworking mother of 6 children. She feels that starting her own business is a way she can improve her life and the life of her big family. She plans on starting a small business selling clothes, and hopes to someday turn it into a thriving business. Her dream is to provide her family a comfortable life and improve their situation. This whole group realizes that this is their chance to change their situation, and they are all ready for this loan and this opportunity. On behalf of Mirtha, the group, and Esperanza International, thank you for your support!

loans.use: To start a clothing business

loans.name: Virgen De Fátima Group

texts.es:
Banco D. Emprendimiento: Virgen D. Fatima se encuetra ubicado en la ciudad D. Santa Cruz Bolivia, se encuentra en su 2do cilco crediticio y está compuesto por 16 personas, Se fundo el 12 D. Junio del 2008, por iniciativa D. un grupo solidario D. señoras, la señora Delicia V. M. es la presidenta del grupo, tesorera es la Sra Ruth Negri R. A. y Secretaria la Sra. Asunta G. V.; en el grupo mayormente se dedican a la  venta D. Cosmeticos, Comida, Abarrotes, Empanadas, etc. Las reuniones se llevan acabo los dias miecoles a horas 9:30 AM en la casa D. la señora tesorera. Las Señoras estan conforme D. trabajar con Emprender por que aprendieron a ahorrar  y compartir con sus amigas cada 14 dias. En el grupo en sus inicios Se conformo con con 16 personas D. las cuales 3 se retiraron por motivos personales e ingresaron otras 3 nuevas, a la fecha ha sido un grupo muy cumplido.			
La Sra Delicia V. M. es la presidenta del grupo, tiene 8 años D. antigüedad en el rubro D. promotora D. cosmeticos y tejido a mano D. carteras, bolsones, monederos a lo que le dedica 8 horas al dia, Tiene 1 hija pequeña que todavia esta en colegio. La Sra es muy responsable y cumplida en el grupo y la oportunidad que le brinda Emprender no la defraudara. Tambien ella es unas D. las fundadoras y lider del grupo. 			
La Sra Ruth Negri R. A. es la Tesorera del grupo. Lleva 5 años D. antigüedad en el rubro D. venta D. cosmeticos y Ropa, trabaja 6 dias a la semana por 8 horas al dia ,su trabajo es mayormente fuera del domicilio, D. ambulante, su meta es D. seguir Trabajando con Emprender y tambien y ser Directora D. un Grupo D. promotoras D. cosméticos. La Sra es muy responsable y cumplida en el grupo y la oportunidad que le brinda el grupo y la Intitucion no la defraudara. Tiene 5 niños que estan en la escuela y con los ingresos que percibe pueD. ayudar en el sustento del hogar.
texts.en:
The loaning bank named "Virgen D. Fatima" is located in the city of Santa Cruz, Bolivia, and is asking for its second cycle of loans. Funded on 12 June 2008 by the initiative of a group of singlewomen, the group is composed of 16 people including Ms Delicia V. M. as president, Ruth Negri R. A. as treasurer and Asunta G. V. as secretary. The majority of the members are dedicated to the sales of cosmetcis, food, groceries, empanadas, etc. Meetings take place at the beginning of the day on wednesdays, at 9:30 am, at the treasurer's house. The women are satisfied to work with Emprender as they learn how to save and share with their friends every 14 days. The initial group was maD. up of 16 people, 3 of whom left due to personal reasons and who were replaced by 3 new women, and today they have a full group. Ms Delicia V. M. is the president of the group, has eight years of experience in the sales and promotion of cosmetics and hand weaves bags, purses, etc for eight hours a day. She has one small girl who is still in school. She is very responsible and polite and will not dissapoint Emprender with the opportunity she is given. She is also one of the founders and leaders of the group. Ms Ruth Negri R. A. is the treasurer, has five years of experience in the sales of cosmetics and clothes, and works six days a week for eight hours a day. Her work is largely done outsiD. of her home, as a traveling salesperson. Her dream is to continue working with Emprender and one day become director of a group of cosmetic promoters. She is very responsible and polite and is pleased with the opportunity provided by teh group and will not disappoint. She has five children who are in school and with the profits she is able to support her home.

Translated from Spanish by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing capital

loans.name: Cristo Vive Group

texts.en: Benita B. is a very young mother of one child. She is only 21 years old and has a son of 4 years. At this point she is living in extreme poverty and is also a single mother. She is requesting her second loan with Esperanza International (Kiva's Field Partner) and has a small business selling sweets in her neighborhood. Before her first loan, she had no steady income and needed a lot of help just to feed her child. She has experienced a little success with her first loan and feels that with this second loan she could really increase her business. For the first time in her life, she feels like she has something of her own and has a way to provide for her child. She is a very loving mother and much more mature than her years tell. She wants nothing more than a good life for her child, and wants someday to have her own house for her and her child. She is on the right path, and this next loan will help her take the next step!

loans.use: To buy food to sell

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 40-year-old woman who lives in Bourj el Barajneh (in the southern suburbs of Lebanon) with her husband and their six children. Since 2004, she has been in the business of selling bread, “saj”, and “nargileh” (also known as “shisha” in Egypt). The saj is a traditional Lebanese cooking dome used to make markouk (“thinned”) bread and doughy confections. The nargileh, meanwhile, is an ancient food tradition enjoyed by the people of the Middle East; in fact, nargileh is enjoyed in cafes across the Middle East, but it is beginning to gain popularity in the US, Europe, and other countries.

Mariam requests a loan in the amount of $1,000 via Al Majmoua in order to pay off her debt. This is the first time that she has asked for a loan. Mariam states that she is successful with her work because of her good behavior and the high quality of her foods (especially her bread). Her clients are primarily her friends and neighbors. She notes that she decided to open her business because of debts that had to be paid off. In the future, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business by reducing her debt load

loans.name: Path

texts.en:
Path R., 50, is married and lives with her husband and her children in Siem Reap province. She and her husband together are farmers growing rice. Beside this activity, this couple also works collecting palm juice and refining it to make sugar palm. On average, they make a combined income of around US$2.50 a day.

This couple has five children, two of whom are students while three others are farmers. Mrs. Path R. would like to take out a loan of US$ 600 to breed pigs and dig a pond to store water. This water will be used to irrigate their crops in the dry season.

loans.use: To breed pigs and dig a pond

loans.name: Mrs. Saruon Roth Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Saruon R. is a widow with two children, one of whom is a construction worker while the other is attending the local school.  She is a popular singer who has been hired to perform in wedding ceremonies, parties, and so on.  Aside from this career, she is a rice middleman.  Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more rice to sell to earn more profits.  The loan will also support the eleven members of the village bank, who plan to use the loan for different purposes.  Mrs. Saruon R. has been selected by the members to be village bank president.

loans.use: Purchasing more rice to sell.

loans.name: Zuhra

texts.ru: Зухра женщина 31 года , замужем , имеет пятерых детей.Муж работает мастер по ремонту мобильных трубок.Сама Зухра директор рынка скота на Чайрухском базаре.Зухра вместе со своей семьёй занимается откормом и продажей скота.У неё сейчас 30 баранов.Во время мониторинга Зухра была на работе, поэтому на снимке её старший сын , который кормит баранов.Для увеличения оборотного капитала скота Зухра решила повторно получить кредит.
texts.en:
Zuhra G. is 31 year old and is married with five children. Her husband makes a living by fixing mobile phones. Zuhra is Director of Chakhrui cattle market. Together with her family, Zuhra raises and sells cattle. Now she has 30 sheep. During the monitoring Zuhra was at work, and we could only take a picture of her elder son giving fodder to the sheep. Zuhra is applying for a second loan in order to increase cash flow.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: raise and sell cattle

loans.name: Cristina Santos

texts.es:
La señora Cristina Santos B. D. R. tiene 73 años D. edad, vive en el distrito D. Salaverry, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. la Libertad.
No tiene estudios realizados (analfabeta), tiene 6 hijos cuya situación económica es independiente.
Cristina recién ha ingresado como socia.
Con el crédito D. 300 soles que recibió D. su Banco Comunal  “Las Triunfadoras D. Salaverry II”, que será cancelada en 4 meses, que será invertido para la compra D. materiales D. escritorio, por campaña escolar en la pequeña tienda en el cual venD. útiles escolares. Su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa.
Manifiesta que su negocio va generando poco a poco mayores ingresos; así mismo se apoya con los ingresos que percibe su esposo en su condición D. jubilado.
Cristina tiene como sueño ser propietaria D. una tienda D. abarrotes.
texts.en:
Cristina Santos B. D. R. is 73 years old, and lives in the Salaverry district, province of Trujillo, in the La Libertad department. She never attended school and is illiterate; she has 6 children who are all economically independent. Cristina has recently become a bank member. With the loan of 300 PEN that she received from her Communal Bank “Las Triunfadoras D. Salaverry II” [“The Triumphant from Salaverry II”], that will be paid in full in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of school supplies; due to the of the upcoming school year she will be selling these supplies in her small school supply shop. Her business is run out of her home. Cristina discloses that her business is generating higher profits little by little; in this manner she supports herself with the income that she obtains given that her husband is retired. Cristina’s dream is to be the owner of a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase school supplies.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es: Arturo tiene 48 años de edad, vive con su hija, yerno y nietos. La casa donde viven es de su hija. Desde hace 7 años se dedica a brindar servicios de transporte en su propio motocarro, trabaja durante todo el día, a razón de ser padre soltero y velar por sus propias necesidades, ya que todos sus hijos son ya mayores de edad y con familias propias. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce muchos lugares y trata con algunas personas que le enseñan técnicas y estrategias para aumentar sus ganancias en el tipo de labor que realiza. En la ciudad de Pucallpa, el principal medio de transporte es el motocarro, por ello, le es rentable, ya que el mismo maneja y administra sus ganancias diarias. Arturo considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es cuando no tiene en buenas condiciones su vehículo y no contar con un garaje para guardarlo. Con MFP, ya tiene 8 préstamos, y le gusta mucho trabajar con su banco comunal porque los integrantes son unidos y puntuales en los pagos. Arturo desde invertir el dinero que solicita ahora en la reparación de su motocarro, cambiar algunos piezas y sin preocupaciones, por lo que gastará un promedio de 1000 soles. Lo restante lo usará en sus cultivos, para obtener una buena cosecha, pues cuenta con unas 18 hectáreas de palmito (palma aceitera).
texts.en:
Arturo is 48 years old and lives with his daughter, son-in-law and grandchildren in his daughter’s house. For 7 years now he has provided transportation services with his own motor-car. He works all day because he is a single father and wants to take care of his own needs; his children are now grown and have their own families. What he enjoys about his work is that he gets to know a lot of places and he tries to learn from some people the technical aspects of his work and strategies for increasing the income he earns from his type of business. The principal mode of transportation within the city of Pucallpa is by moto-car. For this reason, his enterprise is profitable given that he himself drives his vehicle and administers his daily earnings. Arturo considers the most difficult aspect of his business to be when his moto-car is in disrepair, and not having a garage to use for storage. He already has had 8 loans with MFP, and he enjoys working with the cooperative bank greatly because the members are united and timely with their loan payments. Arturo wants to invest the funds he is requesting into repairs for his moto-car, specifically for some replacement parts, for which he will spend 1,000 soles. He will invest the remaining funds into his crops in order to have a good harvest. He has 18 hectares of palmetto trees.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To maintain his moto-car, and invest into his crops.

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr: Monsieur  Mamadou D. est  un  jeune marié boulanger  qui habite au quartier Keur Serigne Ablaye. Il travaille  comme livreur de pain à la boulangerie  ABAK mais depuis 1991 il fait  l’embouche ovine parallèlement à son travail. Il a soldé son premier prêt sans difficulté. Avec ce prêt il veut renforcer son activité c'est-à-dire il achète des moutons qu’il élève quelques temps pour les revendre. Par exemple s’il achète 8 moutons et leur nourriture à 470 000 FCFA ($100) il peut les revendre à 720000 FCFA ($150). Il a un bon bénéfice qui pourra rembourser normalement son prêt et le reste il l’investit dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Mamadou D. is a young married baker who lives in the district of Keur Serigne Ablaye. He works as a delivery man at the ABAK bakery, but since 1991, he has been fattening sheep concurrently. He has settled his first loan without difficulty. With the current loan loan, he wants to bolster his business, that is, buying sheep to raise for a time and then selling them. For example, if he buys eight sheep plus feed for 470,000 francs CFA, he can resell them at 720,000 francs. He makes a good profit for repaying his loan regularly, and he's investing the rest in his business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep and food for them

loans.name: Quvatali

texts.ru: Алтыбаев Куватали  житель Вахшского района. Возраст 52 года, женат и имеет четверых детей. По специальности водитель. Занимается сельским хозяйством. Имеет участок земли , засеевает Пшеницей и подсолнечником. Сейчас необходимо закупить удобрения и поэтому для этого он решил получить кредит . Занимается данным видом бизнеса уже 26 лет.
texts.en:
Quvatali A. lives in the Vakhsh region. He is 52 years old, is married and has four children. He is a driver by profession. He works in agriculture. He has a plot of land on which he plants wheat and sunflowers. Right now he needs to purchase fertilizer and this is why he decided to get credit. He has been in this business for 26 years.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Djidja 2 .1 Group

texts.fr:
Djidja 2. 1 est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village  Siguémona de la ville de Koutiala (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec  en moyenne 50 ans et au moins 6 enfants.
 Elles cultivent  principalement  du riz et  de l’arachide comme activité Secondaire.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe  Djidja 2 .1 ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant quatre ans. Après avoir correctement remboursés  les trois  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter,  des semences de riz  d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture,  au marché de Zansoni, M’pessoba et de Fonfona. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au  marché de M’pessoba et  de Koutiala, en détail ou en gros au comptant à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe Djidja 2 .1 comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 85 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Djidja 2. 1 is a group of married women from the village of Siguémona, town of Koutiala (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in big traditional extended families and have an average age of 50 and at least 6 children. They cultivate principally rice, with peanuts as a secondary crop.

With the intention of making their agricultural businesses profitable, the members of the Djidja 2 .1 group decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso four years ago. After having correctly reimbursed the three preceding loans, they are on their fourth rural loan.

This loan will be used to buy rice seedlings, peanut seeds, minor material and intrants for their crops at the markets of Zansoni, M’pessoba, and Fonfona. After the rainy season, the harvests are stockpiled for a certain time so that they gain in value before being sold at the market of M’pessoba and of Koutiala, retail and wholesale, for cash, to a clientele generally coming from the big cities.

Each of the members of the Djidja 2 .1 group expects to make, after their crops have been sold, a profit of 85,000 F CFA which will be used to reimburse the loan and for current family expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of intrants, seed, and minor agricultural materials

loans.name: Lien's Group

texts.en:
Liên Thị Trần (no: 010103060011) was born in 1983. She lives with her husband in Ly Nhan village, Dong Anh community, Ha Noi. Her husband is a driver. She sells rice to people in other villages and has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND. She is reliable and responsible and has been elected as group leader. She wants to borrow 2,900,000 VND to buy paddy rice to resell.

There are 5 other participants in her group:

Thủy Thị Phạm (no: 010103060014) was born in 1980. She is a seamstress. She needs 2,900,000 VND to buy cloth.

Hằng Thị Ngô (no: 010103060015) was born in 1984. She has a monthly income of about 3,500,000 VND. She wants to borrow 2,900,000 VND to breed pigs and poultry.

Dương Thị Thùy Đỗ (no: 010103060018) was born in 1982. She wants to borrow 348,000 VND to buy food in bulk. 
Thời Thị Trần (no: 010103060012) was born in 1963. She has a monthly income of about 2,500,000 VND. She wants to borrow 2,900,000 VND to buy feed for her pig.

Ngân Thị Phạm (no: 010103060016) was born in 1984. She sells noodle soup every morning. She wants to borrow 2,900,000 VND to invest in her shop.

loans.use: To buy paddy rice and resell

loans.name: Diamantes Group

texts.es: Los miembros del grupo “Diamante” están representadas por L. señora Delia y Conformado por  12 miembros los cuales empiezan su tercer ciclo en los cuales han demostrado ganas D. trabajar honestidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos. Todas las socias poseen sus propios negocios como L. venta D. abarrotes, productos lacteos, cosméticos por catálogos, comida en snacks ubicados en el parque urbano y electrodomésticos en el mercado local. L. competencia en el ámbito comercial es alta pero los miembros del grupo saben como salir adelante gracias a su experiencia y sus ganas D. trabajar. El destino del financiamiento es para L. adquisición D. materiales, insumos y herramientas que ayuden a generar un mayor ingreso ya que D. ello depenD. el sustento D. sus familias y mejoramiento D. su calidad D. vida. Por cursar su tercer ciclo juntas las socias cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios por lo que L. fundación Agrocapital les otorgando un apoyo económico mientras el grupo demuestre unidad y solidaridad entre ellos.
texts.en:
The Diamante Group, represented by Delia, is comprised of 12 members who are starting their third loan cycle, having demonstrated their desire to work, their honesty and responsibility in making their payments. The members all have their own businesses—general stores, dairy product sales, cosmetics by catalog, a snack bar located in the park, or home appliance sales at the local market. Competition is high, but the group members know how to get ahead thanks to their experience and their desire to work. The loan will be used to purchase the materials, supplies, and tools that will help them increase profits because their families depend on them. They want to improve their quality of life. Because this is their third loan cycle, the members all have experience with solidarity groups because Fundación Agrocapital has given them financial support, as long as the group demonstrates unity.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: Jacinta P. is from the village of Langcayan, Mahinog, Camiguin. She is 49 years old and is married. Jacinta owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling personal and home products such as cologne, shampoos, powder and bath soaps in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In July 2009, Jacinta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: 16 De Julio Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes del grupo “16 de Julio”, son personas que en su mayoría viven en la zona del mismo nombre y asisten a sus reuniones al Centro Focal “Los Andes”, cada dos semanas, ellas se agruparon por la necesidad de contar con un capital de trabajo que les permita mejorar sus negocios. 

Diversos son los negocios de las integrantes de “16 de Julio”, algunas se dedican a la  artesanía, produciendo prendas como carteras, sombreros y mantillas, los mismos están hechos a  mano utilizando cordeles o cola de rata, otras se dedican a la comercialización de productos vendiendo ropa, dulces y alimento.  

Todas necesitan el préstamo para la compra de materia prima como el cordel, o adquirir mayor mercadería para venderlo en el mercado.
texts.en:
The members of the group “16 de Julio” (July 16th) are mostly residents who live in the area of the same name. They meet at the “Los Andes” Community Center every 2 weeks. They have joined together because of their need for working capital to improve their businesses.

The members are engaged in different businesses. Some are involved in making handicrafts, producing items such as purses, hats, and blankets. These products are made by hand using rope or rat’s tail (a plant native to South America). Other members sell products such as clothing, candy and food.

They all need a loan to purchase raw materials, such as rope, or acquire more merchandise to sell in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials & merchandise

loans.name: Carlos Luis
