Levan plans to rent 3 ha of land. After cultivation watermelons will be sown; Levan already prepared seedlings. Also fertilizers will be purchased and used for the plot. 16% of the total credit will be used for covering an old loan of Levan's, borrowed from Credo. 

Part of the profit will be reinvested in farming in order to expand it and make more sustainable.

loans.use: to pay for tilling the land and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Ana Isabel de 37 años, vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas (llamado así porque en su originalidad había muchas flores orquídeas) de Guayaquil. Su esposo trabajo en un empresa como aperador de maquinas, tiene tres hijos de 10, 8 y 15 años que estudian en colegios fiscales.

Comenzó por medio de una amiga que la inscribió en productos por catálogos y después se se inscribió en un curso de tejidos. Labora sola y diariamente o en su tiempo libre no tiene horarios fijos. Con la ayuda del préstamo desea comprar productos por catálogos y realizas sus tejidos de carteras para incrementar sus ingresos. En un futuro desea poner un a papelería.
texts.en:
Ana Isabel, 37, lives in an urban zone in Las Orquídeas (so called because at its founding there were many orchid plants there) in Guayaquil.  Her husband works for a firm as a machine operator.  She has three children who are 10, 8 and 15 years of age; they all go to public schools.

She started out thanks to a friend who got her into catalogue sales.  Later, she enrolled in a weaving course.  She works alone every day or during her free time; she does not have fixed schedules.

With help from the loan she’d like to buy catalogue products and to weave the purses to increase her income.  In the future she’d like to set up a stationery shop

loans.use: to buy merchandise and thread for her weaving.

loans.name: Maulidi

texts.en:
Maulidi is a married woman with four children, one of whom still attends school, while the others have graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 15 years, she has operated a fish selling business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During hot dry season the availability of fish for sale is lower and demand is higher while during rainy season the availability of fish for sale is higher and demand is lower. Maulidi dreams of expanding and purchasing a freezer to store fish for sale in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fishing nets and hooks. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of fishing nets and hooks.

loans.name: Sineoun

texts.en: Sineoun, 32, resides in Prey Veng province, Cambodia, an area known as one of the largest rice producing regions in Cambodia. Sineoun is a housewife while her husband is a driver for a blacksmith, earning an income of $7 USD per day. Each month, the family has to spend $56 USD on food and $24 USD on the other necessary expenses. Sineoun is requesting a loan of $1,200 USD to purchase more supplements to improve her husband’s blacksmith business. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more supplements to improve the blacksmith business

loans.name: Jose Diego

texts.es:
A sus 62 años de edad Jose Diego se siente orgulloso de su negocio, el cual ha sacado adelante con esmero y dedicación, desde hace varios años Jose tiene un kiosco ubicado en el parque de Caldas, un municipio del departamento de Antioquia donde es reconocido por sus clientes, gracias a la buena atención que les brinda y la variedad de productos que les ofrece.

Sin embargo Jose Diego es conciente que para mejorar el servicio que ofrece deberá mejorar su lugar de trabajo y para esto solicita un préstamo con el cual comprar una nevera que le hace falta para mantener en buen estado sus productos, igualmente necesita surtir su negocio con nuevos productos para seguir posicionando su negocio y con sus ganancias mejorar su calidad de vida
texts.en:
At 62 years old, Jose Diego is proud of his business, which he has improved with care and dedication.  For many years, Jose has had a kiosk located in the Caldas park, a municipality in the Antioquia department where he is recognized by his customers thanks to the good service he has given them and the variety of products he offers.

However, Jose Diego knows that in order to improve the service he offers, he should improve his place of work.  Therefore, he is asking for a loan to purchase a refrigerator that he needs to keep his products fresh.  He also needs to stock his store with new products to continue positioning his business and improve his quality of life with his earnings.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator and stock for his store.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo tiene 50 años de edad y vive con su hijo en una comunidad urbana pequeña, humilde y en vías de desarrollo perteneciente al distrito de Castilla en Piura. Los pobladores de esta comunidad son principalmente comerciantes minoristas.

Consuelo se dedica a la venta de ropa y moños hechos a base de junco (ramas de plantas secas). Ella cuenta con clientela establecida en la zona ya que viene realizando esta actividad desde hace 8 años y conoce el rubro a la perfección.

Consuelo solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un  préstamo de 800 nuevos soles para comprar prendas de vestir y junco (para realizar moños) que le permitan abastecer los pedidos con los que cuenta.

El negocio de Consuelo  se está desarrollando cada vez más  y ella espera seguir aumentando su demanda para tener mayores ingresos que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Consuelo is 50 years old and lives with her son in a small, modest, developing, urban community in the Castilla district in Piura.  

Consuelo sells clothing and bows made from reeds (dried plant branches).  She has an established customer base in her area as she has had this business for 8 years and knows the trade perfectly.  

Consuelo is requesting a loan for 800 nuevos soles [Peruvian currency] through Edpyme Alternativa to buy clothing and reeds (to make her bows).  This will allow her to fill her existing orders.  

Consuelo's business is growing and she hopes to continue increasing demand so she can increase her income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: purchase clothing and reeds to make bows.

loans.name: Johanna Del Socorro

texts.es: Johana Del Socorro tiene 41 años. Es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo que trabajan de manera independencia. Su actividad económica es una pulpería. Ella es una mujer que disfruta mucho de su trabajo es atender a sus clientes hace mas de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que todos los días se levanta muy temprano para atender a sus clientes. Su mayor sueño es mejorar sus ingresos, para seguirle proporcionando a su familia el alimento diario. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de granos básicos, enlatados, detergentes, papel higiénico, refrescos y pan.
texts.en:
Johana Del Socorro is 41 years of age. She is a single mother and has one child who works independently. Her income-generating activity is a general store. She is a woman who really enjoys her work and waiting on her customers. She has been earning a living in this business for more than five years, and gets up early every day to wait on her customers. 

Her greatest dream is to improve her earnings in order to continue providing daily sustenance to her family. The loan she is seeking is for the purchase of basic food staples, canned goods, detergents, toilet paper, drinks and bread.

loans.use: to purchase basic food staples, canned goods, detergents, toilet paper, drinks and bread.

loans.name: Riza Mae

texts.en:
Riza Mae is 20 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 
Riza Mae has a retail shop that sells canned goods, breads & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She hasrequested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.
Riza Mae is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Riza Mae hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks

loans.name: Natalie Sheilah

texts.es:
Natalie nació en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 28 años de edad, ella es madre soltera y tiene un hijo de dos años y medio. Actualmente, ella vive en la misma  ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades, ella se dedica a la distribucion de productos de locería a pedido del cliente. Ya son siete años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien, ella tambien se dedica a brindar servicio de llamadas a celulares móviles.   

Natalie requiere el préstamo para comprar más productos de locería como platos y vasos. 

El Banco Comunal “Siempre Adelante” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Natalie was born in the city of Cusco (Perú) and is 28 years old.  She’s a single mother of a two-and-a-half-year-old son.  She currently lives in the same city where she was born and where she carries out her activities.  She distributes dinnerware based on customer orders.  She’s been in business seven years and does very well.  She also provides cellular telephone services.  Natalie needs the loan to buy more dinnerware items like dishes and glasses.

The “Siempre Adelante” (Always Forward) communal bank meets every thirty days in the city of Cusco (Perú).  Cusco is known for tourism, commerce, its traditional “Inti Raymi” festival and because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is locate here.

loans.use: to buy more dinnerware like dishes and glasses.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 37-year-old married woman and has two children who are in school. She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Marilou requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Marilou has been raising pigs for 15 years now, and has borrowed 19 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Marilou would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en:
Rosalita is 57 years old and lives in Palayan, Aloran Misamis Occidental. She is married with seven children. 

Rosalita has a dried fish retail store. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to purchase materials for her house repair.

Rosalita has been a member of PMPC for five years.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her house repair.

loans.name: Lagrimas

texts.en:
Lagrimas is 42 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.
Lagrimas has borrowed and paid back 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for nine years and also earns an income from rice farming and photography.
Lagrimas aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Susannah

texts.en:
Susannah, age 53, is a breadmaker. She has been engaged in this business for the past ten years. She is well-known in her community and makes a good profit from making and selling her bread. 

She is divorced and has three grown children in their thirties. They are attending college and living at home. Susannah herself is a high-school graduate.

At present, she does not have sufficient baking supplies in stock, so she is requesting a loan in order to purchase more sugar, flour, oil, and butter. 

Her eventual goal is to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, flour, oil, and butter

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose sells cosmetics, pegs and cloth in Takoradi. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a teacher. Rose has been selling cosmetics for five years. She supports her husband to take care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy cosmetics. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Therese

texts.en: Therese is 27 years old and has two children, ages 3 and 5. Both of her children are in school. She is married to a technician. Therese sells bed sheets in a store she has been running for five years. She will use the loan to buy more bed sheets to expand her business. She will use any profits to reinvest in her business and renovate her house. She would love to see her business prosper.

loans.use: To buy more bed sheets to sell.

loans.name: Verónica Patricía

texts.es:
La señora Verónica tiene 34 años de edad, es acompañada con dos hijos uno de 5 años y otro de 3 años.

Ella realiza actividades del hogar, pero desde hace dos años se ha dedicado a vender ropa para adultos y niños. Verónica viaja casi 200 kilómetros, para comprar la mercadería en la capital del país, debe abordar dos buses, sale a las 5:00 a.m. y regresa a las 4:00 p.m.

Verónica vende la ropa de comunidad en comunidad, caminando a pie, cargando la mercadería, trabaja por lo menos 8 horas diarias, recorriendo una comunidad por día. Por la experiencia que tiene, ella quiere comprar suficiente mercadería, para la navidad, ya que es una época en la cual la venta se incrementa. 

El préstamo será utilizado, para comprar: 48 pantalones para adulto y 5 pantalones para niño, 5 docenas de blusas para mujer y ropa interior para hombre y mujer. Además quiere comprar sandalias, por que actualmente no tiene ese producto disponible.

Con el préstamo, ella diversificara su negocio, comprara a mejores precios por que lo hará por mayor, ya que ella necesita tener mercadería, para ofrecer y obtener mejores ingresos. Ella desea tener fortalecido su negocio, para contratar a otras personas que le ayuden a vender, ya que en estos momentos lo hace sola.
texts.en:
Verónica is 34 years old, accompanied by two children who are 5 and 3 years old.

She is a homemaker but for the last two years has been dedicated to selling adult and children's clothing. Verónica travels almost 200 kilometers to buy the merchandise in the country's capital. She has to take two buses, and leaves at 5AM and returns at 4PM.

Verónica sells the clothings from community to community walking, carrying the merchandise. She works at least eight hours a day, covering one community a day. From the experience she has, she wants to buy enough merchandise for the holidays since it is a time when sales increase.

The loan will be used to buy 48 adult pants and 5 children's pants, 5 dozen women's blouses and men's and women's underwear. Additionally, she wants to buy sandals because currently she does not have this product available.

With the loan, she will diversify her business. She will buy at better pricess because she will do it at wholesale since she needs to have merchandise in order to offer and obtain better income. She wishes to establish her business so she can hire other people to help her sell since right now she does it alone.

loans.use: to buy 48 adult pants and 5 children's pants, 5 dozen women's blouses, sandals, men's and women's underwear.

loans.name: Makatini Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Makatini Group in Western Kenya! Alice is the facilitator of the Makatini group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Alice takes care of two children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Alice had an excellent maize yield harvesting 18 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Alice was only able to harvest five bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Alice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Alice will invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Makatini group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.
